original: dper na ba lang dang rta lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang rta lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a cow and a horse.

original: grangs dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang rdzas las shes ba khyad par can gyi yul du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang rdzas las shes ba khyad par can gyi yul du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
translated: And number, etc. are the objects of a special cognition of substance. This is the natural inference.

original: dngos po tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pas ma nges par ston par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pas ma nges par ston par byed do //
translated: He shows that it is not established by ‚Äúdifferent things,‚Äù etc.

original: grangs la sogs pa'i yul can gyi sgra dang shes pa brtags don can te /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa'i yul can gyi sgra dang shes pa brtags don can te /
translated: The words and cognitions that have number, etc. as their objects are imputed objects.

original: sgro btags pa'i spyod yul can dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i spyod yul can dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they have a superimposed object.

original: gang gis brtags pa'i don can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis brtags pa'i don can yin zhe na /
translated: By what are they imputed objects?

original: rnam par rtog pas te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas te /
translated: By conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: By a conceptual consciousness.

original: ci 'dra bas she na /
analyzed: ci 'dra bas she na /
translated: What kind of conceptualization?

original: dngos po tha dad rjes 'brang ba'i sdud pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyis so //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad rjes 'brang ba'i sdud pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyis so //
translated: That which has as its object the inclusion, etc. of different things.

original: des ni de ltar kun du rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: des ni de ltar kun du rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan to //
translated: This teaches the reason for such a conception.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What kind of conception?

original: dper na yon tan la sogs bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na yon tan la sogs bzhin te /
translated: For example, like qualities and so on.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa dag la gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang sgra 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa dag la gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang sgra 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the terms ‚Äúone‚Äù and ‚Äúpossesses‚Äù are used in relation to form and so on.

original: de la yon tan du bgrang ba'i grangs la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yon tan du bgrang ba'i grangs la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not a case of counting qualities, such as number.

original: yon tan rnams las yon tan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams las yon tan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because qualities do not possess qualities.

original: 'jig dang ma skyes bzhin /
analyzed: 'jig dang ma skyes bzhin /
translated: Like destruction and the nonarisen.

original: dper na 'jig pa gcig dang gnyis dang mang po dag ces skabs 'gar brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig pa gcig dang gnyis dang mang po dag ces skabs 'gar brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, sometimes the terms ‚Äúone,‚Äù ‚Äútwo,‚Äù and ‚Äúmany‚Äù are used in relation to destruction.

original: ma skyes pa rnams la yang dper na gcig dang gnyis dad du ma dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams la yang dper na gcig dang gnyis dad du ma dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: And sometimes the terms ‚Äúone,‚Äù ‚Äútwo,‚Äù and ‚Äúmany‚Äù are used in relation to the nonarisen.

original: de ltar na 'jig pa dang ma skyes pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig pa dang ma skyes pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because neither destruction nor the nonarisen exist in the least, this is indefinite.

original: gal te nyer btags 'dir 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te nyer btags 'dir 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that this is a designation,

original: gal te yon tan dag la gcig la sogs pa'i tha snyad nye bar btags pa las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yon tan dag la gcig la sogs pa'i tha snyad nye bar btags pa las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the terms one and so on are applied to the qualities,

original: de'i tshe yon tan rnams la nye bar btags pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe yon tan rnams la nye bar btags pa /
translated: then at that time the application to the qualities

original: de rgyu can 'dod gang yin pa /
analyzed: de rgyu can 'dod gang yin pa /
translated: would be the cause of the desire for the one and so on.

original: nye bar btags pa yang rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩde ltar nye bar btags pa'i rgyu ni shes pa dang brjod pa dag gi 'jug pa'i rten yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa'i nye bar btags pa'i rten de nyid dngos rnams thams cad la /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa yang rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin no // de ltar nye bar btags pa'i rgyu ni shes pa dang brjod pa dag gi 'jug pa'i rten yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa'i nye bar btags pa'i rten de nyid dngos rnams thams cad la /
translated: But the application would not be causeless.

original: sgra @42b dang shes pa de dag gi rgyu cis mi 'dod /
analyzed: sgra @42b dang shes pa de dag gi rgyu cis mi 'dod /
translated: Thus the cause of the application is asserted to be the basis of the engagement of consciousness and verbalization. Why do you not assert that the basis of the application, which is the cause of consciousness and verbalization, is the cause of all things?

original: gang gis na grangs la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na grangs la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would the number and so on be understood?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te kun la nyer btags min //
analyzed: gal te kun la nyer btags min //
translated: if it is not applied to all,

original: gtso bo yod na nye bar btags par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gtso bo yod na nye bar btags par 'gyur gyi /
translated: if the principal exists, it would be applied to it,

original: thams cad la nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not applied to all.

original: de lta ma yin na gtso ngo med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtso ngo med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be no principal, the designation would not be possible.

original: sbyor ba ni nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de ni gtso bo la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de ni gtso bo la brten pa yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which is designated is based on the principal,

original: dper na khur bu ba la blang nyid nye bar btags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khur bu ba la blang nyid nye bar btags pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the number is designated in dependence on the pot.

original: yon tan rnams la yang grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yang nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yang grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yang nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The statement that the usage of number, etc., with regard to the qualities is also a designation is a natural inference.

original: gang dang chos mthun pa nyid can la sogs pas yon tan rnams la nye bar btags pa las grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i gtso bo mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhes dris pa la yang nye bar smras pa gtso bo tha dad khyad par can /
analyzed: gang dang chos mthun pa nyid can la sogs pas yon tan rnams la nye bar btags pa las grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i gtso bo mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhes dris pa la yang nye bar smras pa gtso bo tha dad khyad par can /
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the principal characteristic of the usage of number, etc., with regard to the qualities, which is based on the designation of number, etc., with regard to the qualities, by means of the similarity, etc., of the qualities?‚ÄùüîΩhe replies, ‚ÄúThe principal is that which has a different, particular quality.

original: dngos po gang la tha dad pa'i chos grangs la sogs pa yod pa de ni tha dad pa'i khyad par can te /
analyzed: dngos po gang la tha dad pa'i chos grangs la sogs pa yod pa de ni tha dad pa'i khyad par can te /
translated: That which has a different quality, such as number, is that which has a different particular quality.

original: gtso bo yin na gzhan ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo yin na gzhan ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: If it is the principal, the other is not the principal.üîΩIf such is the definition of the principal, then the principal is that which has a difference from something else.

original: gal te de 'dra ba gtso bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe tha dad pa'i khyad par can gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba nyid kyang gang las yin de 'dra ba'i gtso bo rang gi rnam par rtogs pas sbyar ba 'dod par bya ba ma yin no
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba gtso bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe tha dad pa'i khyad par can gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba nyid kyang gang las yin de 'dra ba'i gtso bo rang gi rnam par rtogs pas sbyar ba 'dod par bya ba ma yin no
translated: But this is not acceptable, since the principal is imagined by your own imagination.

original: // 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: // 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: dper na 'jig rten la grags pa'i klog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i ba lang nyid kyi ril po la 'jug pa can gyi shes pa'i yul 'di ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten la grags pa'i klog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i ba lang nyid kyi ril po la 'jug pa can gyi shes pa'i yul 'di ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: The object of the cognition that engages the whole, such as the cowness that possesses dewlap, etc., which is known in the world, is the principal.

original: cung zad chos mthun pa las khur bu ba la nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad chos mthun pa las khur bu ba la nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The universal is figuratively designated as having a slight similarity.

original: yon tan rnams la grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa ni de 'dra ba'i nye bar btags pa ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa ni de 'dra ba'i nye bar btags pa ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: The application of the conventions of number, etc., to the qualities is not such a figurative designation. Thus the reason is not established.

original: gzugs gcig dang bum pa gcig ces bya ba shes pa la 'jig rten gyi rtogs pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs gcig dang bum pa gcig ces bya ba shes pa la 'jig rten gyi rtogs pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The world does not have different understandings of the word one with regard to form and one with regard to a pot.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te tha dad med pa la tha dad med don can zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad med pa la tha dad med don can zhe na /
translated: if you say that the word one is not different from the one that is its referent,üîΩthen if you do not accept that sound and so on have the property of being different, such as being a number, and so on, then when the word one is applied to that which is not different,

original: gal te grangs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i chos dang ldan pa can gyi sgra la sogs pa mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang tha dad pa med pa de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa de la grangs la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgra 'jug pa gang yin pa deüîΩ@43a * // rnams don tha dad pa med pa can te /
analyzed: gal te grangs la sogs pa tha dad pa'i chos dang ldan pa can gyi sgra la sogs pa mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang tha dad pa med pa de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa de la grangs la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgra 'jug pa gang yin pa de @43a * // rnams don tha dad pa med pa can te /
translated: those words that express number and so onüîΩwould have a referent that is not different.

original: rnam grangs nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would be synonyms.

original: de ltar na ji ltar pa lang zhes brjod pa na shes pa 'gyur pa de ltar gcig dang chen po dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la yang shes par 'gyur ba yin na de yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar pa lang zhes brjod pa na shes pa 'gyur pa de ltar gcig dang chen po dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la yang shes par 'gyur ba yin na de yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the word cow is understood, so too the words one, great, and goer would be understood, but that is not the case.

original: de bas na don tha dad pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don tha dad pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the causes of different meanings.

original: sbyor ba ni sgra gang dag don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sgra gang dag don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am /
translated: The application is: those sounds that are the objects of a single meaning,

original: don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ba de dag ni rnam grangs yin pa'am /
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ba de dag ni rnam grangs yin pa'am /
translated: or that are not the causes of different meanings, are synonyms.

original: don tha dad pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: They are not the objects of different meanings.

original: dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang su rana dha ra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang su rana dha ra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, indra, sakra, and purandara.

original: gcig dang chen po dang yang dag par ldan pa dang 'gro ba dang / ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra yang don gcig pa can yin pa'am /
analyzed: gcig dang chen po dang yang dag par ldan pa dang 'gro ba dang / ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra yang don gcig pa can yin pa'am /
translated: The sounds ekam, mahat, samyuktam, gacchati, and go are not the causes of different meanings.

original: don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang / bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang / bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin par sems so //
translated: I think that this is an inference from the nature of the reason, and a non-observation of a pervader that depends on a second probandum.

original: rnam grangs kyang ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyang ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since they are not synonyms,

original: rnam grangs nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgra de dag ni don tha dad pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgra de dag ni don tha dad pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: These words are not synonyms because they have different meanings,üîΩlike the words pot, cloth, and so on.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba ni thal ba bzlog par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba ni thal ba bzlog par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is the reverse of the original reductio.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: This reason is indefinite,

original: de ltar na don gzhan min rgyu can yin yang yon tan dkar la sogs la grangs la sogs /
analyzed: de ltar na don gzhan min rgyu can yin yang yon tan dkar la sogs la grangs la sogs /
translated: because even though the words white, quality, and so on are not based on different things, they are synonyms.

original: ldan pa can sgra rnam grangs min //
analyzed: ldan pa can sgra rnam grangs min //
translated: The words possessing number and so on are not synonyms.

original: dper na gcig dang dkar po dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / rnam par phye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rnam grangs ma yin par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gcig dang dkar po dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / rnam par phye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rnam grangs ma yin par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the words one, white, possessing, and divided are asserted to be synonyms.üîΩBut in the case of qualities, the objects of expression, such as number, do not exist as different qualities.

original: yon tan dag la yang brjod par bya ba grangs la sogs pa yon tan de tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te de ltar na thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa la ma nges pa yin no //üîΩgal te de la'ang don gzhan na /
analyzed: yon tan dag la yang brjod par bya ba grangs la sogs pa yon tan de tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te de ltar na thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa la ma nges pa yin no // gal te de la'ang don gzhan na /
translated: Thus the original reductio and its reversal are indefinite.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that even in that case, they are based on different things,üîΩthen that is so.

original: yon tan dag la yang grangs la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gyi sgra rnams kyi grangs la sogs pa'i don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan yod pa de ltar na /üîΩma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan dag la yang grangs la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gyi sgra rnams kyi grangs la sogs pa'i don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan yod pa de ltar na / ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And in the case of qualities, the words possessing number, etc., have a basis for the meaning of number, etc., and so it is not indeterminate.

original: de'i tshe yon tan rdzas ni khyad med 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe yon tan rdzas ni khyad med 'gyur /
translated: Then the substance of the quality would be undifferentiated.

original: las dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i rdzas kyi mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: las dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i rdzas kyi mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ro//
translated: The definition of substance would be confused, since it would be the cause of the conjunction of action, the conjunction of quality, and the conjunction of inherence.

original: @43b gang gi tshe yon tan dag la yang ldan pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang las yod cing yon tan dag la yon tan dang las 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @43b gang gi tshe yon tan dag la yang ldan pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang las yod cing yon tan dag la yon tan dang las 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: When qualities also have the qualities of inherence, etc., and action, and qualities have the conjunction of qualities and action,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid yod pa de ltar na rdzas dang yon tan dag gi mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur na de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid yod pa de ltar na rdzas dang yon tan dag gi mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur na de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: then the definitions of substance and quality would be confused, but that is unacceptable.

original: gzhan yang ba lang la sogs pa grangs la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgra tha dad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang ba lang la sogs pa grangs la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgra tha dad pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the different words expressing number, etc., of cows, etc.,

original: tha dad pa'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i yul can nyid do //
translated: The cognition is different, because it is different in terms of the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ldog pa'i khyad par phyir te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i khyad par phyir te /
translated: Because of the difference in the exclusion.

original: sdud pa la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud pa la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference in the exclusion of the included extension, etc.

original: de ltar na thal bar bsgrub pa yang ma grub pa nyid dang / bzlog pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na thal bar bsgrub pa yang ma grub pa nyid dang / bzlog pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reductio is not established, and the contrapositive is the establishment of what is already established.

original: grangs la sogs ba yang ldan pa can gyi sgra rnam grangs ma yin pa nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grangs la sogs ba yang ldan pa can gyi sgra rnam grangs ma yin pa nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Number, etc., are also not synonyms of the word ‚Äúpossessor,‚Äù

original: don gzhan min don can /
analyzed: don gzhan min don can /
translated: because they do not have a different meaning.

original: yin yang las rdzas min sgra bzhin /üîΩdper na las ma yin pa'i sgra dang rdzas ma yin pa'i sgra ldog pa'i sgo na sa 'di las nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yin yang las rdzas min sgra bzhin / dper na las ma yin pa'i sgra dang rdzas ma yin pa'i sgra ldog pa'i sgo na sa 'di las nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Even if they do not have a different meaning, they are not substantial actions, like the word ‚Äúsound.‚Äù

original: rdzas nyid ma yin no zhes tha dad du byed mod kyi /
analyzed: rdzas nyid ma yin no zhes tha dad du byed mod kyi /
translated: For example, the words ‚Äúnon-action‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-substance‚Äù are distinguished in terms of negation, and it is said that ‚Äúthis is not action‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is not substance.‚ÄùüîΩHowever, they are not different in meaning.

original: de dag don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar gzhan dag la yang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar gzhan dag la yang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Other cases are similar.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i don can nyid kyis ma grub pa la sogs pa dang ma nges pa nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i don can nyid kyis ma grub pa la sogs pa dang ma nges pa nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: This establishes the thesis that, since they are different isolates, the existence of possession, etc., is not established by the meaning of difference, etc., and that they are not ascertained.

original: gal te ldan pa la sogs pa don gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa la sogs pa don gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If possession, etc., are not different objects,

original: tha dad par rjod par byed pa'i drug pas tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad par rjod par byed pa'i drug pas tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the sixth case, which expresses difference, would not be used,

original: dper na 'di'i gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin na yang 'gyur ba de'i phyir don gzhan yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di'i gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin na yang 'gyur ba de'i phyir don gzhan yin no //
translated: just as in ‚Äúits oneness,‚Äù etc. But it is used, therefore they are different objects.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad par bstan pa de ni de las don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad par bstan pa de ni de las don gzhan yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is taught as different from something else is a different object from it,

original: dper na lha sbyin gyi spyi blugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyi spyi blugs lta bu'o //
translated: like Devadatta‚Äôs water pot.

original: ldan pa la sogs pa yang bum pa la sogs las tha dad par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
analyzed: ldan pa la sogs pa yang bum pa la sogs las tha dad par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
translated: And possession, etc., are taught as different from pot, etc. This is a natural inference.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: This reason is inconclusive.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi khyab pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi khyab pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is true, but it is pervasion,

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a difference in effect is seen.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la 'bras bu tha dad pa yod pa de la rgyu tha dad pas 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la 'bras bu tha dad pa yod pa de la rgyu tha dad pas 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever has a difference in effect has a difference in cause,

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu @44a * //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu @44a * //
translated: like a pot and a cloth, etc.,

original: tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: whose different effects have different causes.üîΩWe see a difference in effect, which has the characteristic of a difference in word,üîΩlike ‚Äúendowed with a pot‚Äù and ‚Äúendowed with a cloth,‚Äù etc.

original: bum pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / bum pa'i ldan ba zhes bya ba sgra tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu tha dad pa yang mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //üîΩgcig kyang 'bras bu du ma can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / bum pa'i ldan ba zhes bya ba sgra tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu tha dad pa yang mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so // gcig kyang 'bras bu du ma can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is a reason based on nature.üîΩEven though one has many effects,

original: 'bras bu tha dad las rgyu tha dad pa zhes bya ba yang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad las rgyu tha dad pa zhes bya ba yang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: the statement ‚ÄúA difference in cause is from a difference in effect‚Äù is inconclusive.

original: gzhan yang de ldan ni bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de ldan ni bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas so //
translated: Moreover, the possessor is the substance, such as the pot, etc.

original: grangs sogs ni chos so //
analyzed: grangs sogs ni chos so //
translated: Number, etc. are the attributes.

original: dngos po brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyis chos rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams kyis /
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyis chos rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams kyis /
translated: The words which express the substance express the attributes.

original: tha dad bzhin /
analyzed: tha dad bzhin /
translated: They are different,

original: brjod pa gang yin de dag kyang //üîΩchos gzhan khyad par byed pa yin //
analyzed: brjod pa gang yin de dag kyang // chos gzhan khyad par byed pa yin //
translated: but that which is expressed by themüîΩis the differentia of another attribute.

original: chos gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the differentia of another attribute.

original: de bas na de tsam shes bar 'dod pa la /
analyzed: de bas na de tsam shes bar 'dod pa la /
translated: Therefore, when one wishes to know just that much,

original: chos tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa las /
analyzed: chos tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa las /
translated: when one wishes to know just the attribute,

original: gzhan ma lus spong ba can thos pa /
analyzed: gzhan ma lus spong ba can thos pa /
translated: one must eliminate everything else.

original: sgra gang la chos gzhan gyi khyad par spong pa yod ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra gang la chos gzhan gyi khyad par spong pa yod ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word which expresses the attribute is the word which eliminates the differentia of another attribute.

original: khyad par gzhan spong ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan spong ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it eliminates the differentia of another attribute.

original: chos rjod par byed pa'i thos pa de /üîΩtha dad chos bzhin rjod byed de //
analyzed: chos rjod par byed pa'i thos pa de / tha dad chos bzhin rjod byed de //
translated: That hearing which expresses the attributeüîΩexpresses it as if it were a different attribute.

original: de tsam gyis kyang dngos su tha dad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang dngos su tha dad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not really different.

original: dper na la lar sor mo'i ldan bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na la lar sor mo'i ldan bzhin te /
translated: For example, like the word ‚Äúfinger‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúhaving fingers.‚Äù

original: sar mo'i ldan pa zhes bya ba'i chos la lar de tsam zhes bar 'dod pa la khyad par gzhan spong ba'i sgra'i sgo nas ston par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sar mo'i ldan pa zhes bya ba'i chos la lar de tsam zhes bar 'dod pa la khyad par gzhan spong ba'i sgra'i sgo nas ston par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the expression ‚Äúhaving fingers,‚Äù the word ‚Äúfinger‚Äù is used to indicate the presence of a certain number of fingers, but it does not exclude other attributes.

original: sgra ni chos can brjod par grags pa yin /
analyzed: sgra ni chos can brjod par grags pa yin /
translated: The word is known to refer to the thing itself.

original: dper na sor mo ldan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sor mo ldan bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the word ‚Äúfinger.‚Äù

original: khyad par thams cad ni spong min phyir /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad ni spong min phyir /
translated: Because all the attributes are not excluded.

original: sor mo'i khyad par mi spong ba can ston par byed do //
analyzed: sor mo'i khyad par mi spong ba can ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúfinger‚Äù does not exclude the attributes of the finger.

original: de ltar na rtogs pa po'i rjes su byed pas chos gzhan spong ba dang mi spong pa'i rgyu mtshan 'ba' zhig yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na rtogs pa po'i rjes su byed pas chos gzhan spong ba dang mi spong pa'i rgyu mtshan 'ba' zhig yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, the reason for excluding or not excluding other attributes is simply the requirement of the person who understands.

original: don gcig brjod kyang don dam par rnam pa gnyi ga dag gis tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don gcig brjod kyang don dam par rnam pa gnyi ga dag gis tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Even though the same thing is expressed, the word is understood to be different in the two cases, because it is understood in two different ways.

original: sgra 'di la don gyi khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra 'di la don gyi khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word does not have a different meaning.

original: don gyi khyad par med na yang ci'i phyir tha dang pa bzhin du ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par med na yang ci'i phyir tha dang pa bzhin du ston par byed ce na /
translated: But if it does not have a different meaning, why is it used in two different ways, like the word ‚Äúfinger‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar de ltar brda ni byas can yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar brda ni byas can yin /
translated: Thus, the word is one that has a sign.

original: de ltar brda byas pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar brda byas pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the word is one that has a sign.üîΩThe other property that is the reason for the word is either the abandonment or non-abandonment.

original: brda'i rgyu mtshan can chos gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar dpyad pa zin pa nyid kyi phyir rgyas par ma bshad do //
analyzed: brda'i rgyu mtshan can chos gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar dpyad pa zin pa nyid kyi phyir rgyas par ma bshad do //
translated: Since this has already been analyzed, it is not explained in detail.

original: de ltar re @44b zhig chos tsam shes par 'dod pa las gnas skabs kyi khyad par byed pa chos gzhan spong ba can gyi sgra 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar re @44b zhig chos tsam shes par 'dod pa las gnas skabs kyi khyad par byed pa chos gzhan spong ba can gyi sgra 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in the desire to know mere property, the word that has the abandonment of another property that is a particular state is engaged.

original: tshogs brjod par byad pa yang /
analyzed: tshogs brjod par byad pa yang /
translated: The collection is also stated:

original: gzugs sogs nus pa'i khyad par rnams /
analyzed: gzugs sogs nus pa'i khyad par rnams /
translated: The particular abilities of form and so on

original: spong ba'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spong ba'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: are engaged by way of abandonment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i nus pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i nus pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The ability of form and so on is twofold:

original: spyi'i ni dper na bum pa'i dbyibs can dag chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: spyi'i ni dper na bum pa'i dbyibs can dag chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa lta bu'o //
translated: The general, for example, is like the ability to produce the effect of holding water and so on in those that have the shape of a pot.

original: so sor nges pa'i ni dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa lta bu'o //üîΩbum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs can rnams la so sor nges pa de'i nus pa spangs na /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i ni dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa lta bu'o // bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs can rnams la so sor nges pa de'i nus pa spangs na /
translated: The specific is, for example, the potency to produce the effect of the eye consciousness, etc.üîΩThe general is, for example, the potency to hold water, etc., which is common to the shapes of pots, etc.

original: bum pa'i sgra ni 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i sgra ni 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word pot is applied to those shapes that are endowed with the potency to hold water, etc.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where is it applied?

original: de 'bras mtshungs pa'i /üîΩrgyu min pa ni rnam gcod la //
analyzed: de 'bras mtshungs pa'i / rgyu min pa ni rnam gcod la //
translated: To those that are similar in effect.üîΩThe word pot is applied to those shapes that are similar in effect to the shapes of pots seen previously, but it is not applied to those that are not similar in effect.

original: rdzas du ma yod na yang gzugs la sogs de dag gis chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig gang yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin pa shing la sogs pa gang yid pa de bzlog pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas du ma yod na yang gzugs la sogs de dag gis chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig gang yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin pa shing la sogs pa gang yid pa de bzlog pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though there are many substances, the word pot is applied to those that are endowed with the potency to produce the single effect of holding water, etc., in order to exclude those that are not similar in effect, such as wood, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it applied?

original: 'bras bu gcig byed par nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig byed par nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the potency to produce a single effect.

original: de ltar brdar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar brdar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a convention that is made in that way.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mang po dag la yang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mang po dag la yang /
translated: Even though there are many forms, etc.,

original: nus pa gcig yod pa de brjod par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: nus pa gcig yod pa de brjod par 'dod pa la /
translated: the potency to produce a single effect is asserted to exist in those.

original: brda'i rjes su byed pas bum ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig la 'gal ba yong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda'i rjes su byed pas bum ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig la 'gal ba yong pa ma yin no //
translated: But this does not mean that the word pot is contradictory, since it does follow the convention.üîΩBecause it is the collection that is expressed, and because it is the collection that has the specific power to produce the cognition of pot, the word pot does not exclude form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs ba rjod par byed par gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad par can spong ba can 'di yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir bum pa gzugs shes pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs ba rjod par byed par gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad par can spong ba can 'di yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir bum pa gzugs shes pa /
translated: Therefore, the pot is the form, etc.

original: gzhi gcig pa can sgra ma yin //
analyzed: gzhi gcig pa can sgra ma yin //
translated: of a single basis, but it is not the sound.

original: don spong ba brjod pa can dang gzhi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don spong ba brjod pa can dang gzhi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no expression that excludes the object and no common basis.

original: shing zhes bya pa'i rigs brjod pa'i sgra yang de'i khyad par mi spong ba'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar na shing sha pa shing yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrigs dang tshogs pa rjod byed pa'i //
analyzed: shing zhes bya pa'i rigs brjod pa'i sgra yang de'i khyad par mi spong ba'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar na shing sha pa shing yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro // rigs dang tshogs pa rjod byed pa'i //
translated: The word that expresses the class tree does not operate by excluding its particularities, and thus it is that a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is a tree.

original: khyad par 'di yang dod pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yang dod pa yin //
translated: This difference is also accepted.

original: spong pa dang mi spong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par 'di yang 'dod pa yin na //
analyzed: spong pa dang mi spong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par 'di yang 'dod pa yin na //
translated: This difference, which is characterized by the exclusion or nonexclusion of the particularities, is also accepted.

original: rigs dang tshogs pa rjod byed pa'i //
analyzed: rigs dang tshogs pa rjod byed pa'i //
translated: The word that expresses the class and the collection

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: gcig la 'jug pa can ni 'bigs byed la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gcig la 'jug pa can ni 'bigs byed la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The word vase is used in reference to the collection of form, etc. The word vase is used in reference to the collection of form, etc.üîΩThe word vase is used

original: rang gi tshogs pa can la ltos nas tshogs pa'i sgra des ni spong ba yin no //üîΩtshogs pa'i khyad par de nyid la ltos nas rigs kyi sgra yin pa des ni tshogs pa'i khyad par des spong par mi byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa can la ltos nas tshogs pa'i sgra des ni spong ba yin no // tshogs pa'i khyad par de nyid la ltos nas rigs kyi sgra yin pa des ni tshogs pa'i khyad par des spong par mi byed pa de ltar na /
translated: The word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù excludes the members of the collection when it is used in reference to the collection itself.üîΩThe word ‚Äúgenus‚Äù excludes the specific collection when it is used in reference to the specific collection.

original: de rjod par byed pa rnams dang / lhan cig gzhi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa rnams dang / lhan cig gzhi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the words ‚Äúcollection‚Äù and ‚Äúgenus‚Äù are used in a manner that is mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: rigs dang tshogs pa'i sgra nyid ni rnam pa de lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang tshogs pa'i sgra nyid ni rnam pa de lta bu dag yin no //
translated: These are the ways in which the words ‚Äúcollection‚Äù and ‚Äúgenus‚Äù are used.

original: 'ga' zhig ni rigs kyi sgra kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni rigs kyi sgra kho na yin te /
translated: There are some cases in which the word ‚Äúgenus‚Äù is used in a manner that is not mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: dper na tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa can gzugs dang bde ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa can gzugs dang bde ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the words ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúpleasure,‚Äù etc., are used to refer to substances that are not collections.

original: de bzhin du grangs la sogs pa'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la 'jug pa can dag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs la sogs pa'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la 'jug pa can dag yin no //
translated: Similarly, the words ‚Äúnumber,‚Äù etc., are used to refer to the collection of form, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig ni yul gyi khyad par la ltos nas gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni yul gyi khyad par la ltos nas gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i khyad par yin no //
translated: There are some cases in which the word ‚Äúgenus‚Äù is used in a manner that is mutually exclusive and exhaustive in reference to a particular object.

original: gal te 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i sgras rjod par byed pa gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig yin pa de'i tshe rdzas med pa'i phyir bum pa'am snam bu'i gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya bar tha rdzod pa'i snyed med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i sgras rjod par byed pa gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig yin pa de'i tshe rdzas med pa'i phyir bum pa'am snam bu'i gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya bar tha rdzod pa'i snyed med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If only form, etc. were the referents of the terms pot, etc., then, because they would not be substances, it would be impossible to say ‚Äúthe form, etc. of a pot‚Äù or ‚Äúthe form, etc. of a cloth.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: de ltar brdar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩde ltar sgra nges par sbyor ba gang yin pa de dag de ltar rjod par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar brdar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de ltar sgra nges par sbyor ba gang yin pa de dag de ltar rjod par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: because they are designated in that way.üîΩThose who employ terms in that way express themselves in that way.

original: tha dad pa med du zin kyang de bzhin du tha snyad du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med du zin kyang de bzhin du tha snyad du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though there is no difference, they make conventional expressions in that way.

original: 'on kyang dgos pa la ltos pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dgos pa la ltos pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that they do so without regard to purpose.

original: de yang yod pa nyid yin te /üîΩbum pa yin ni gzugs sogs shes //üîΩtha snyad byad @45b pa na /
analyzed: de yang yod pa nyid yin te / bum pa yin ni gzugs sogs shes // tha snyad byad @45b pa na /
translated: That is also possible,

original: de'i spyi nye bar byas pa can yin /
analyzed: de'i spyi nye bar byas pa can yin /
translated: because when one makes a conventional expression,üîΩone does so with the universal of pot as the referent.

original: bum pa'i spyi nye bar byas pa'i bye brag de'i nus pa'i khyad par gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i spyi nye bar byas pa'i bye brag de'i nus pa'i khyad par gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe particular that is the manifestation of the universal of pot‚Äù is to be analyzed as follows:

original: de'i nus pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa'i khyad par te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe particular that is the power of that‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad par ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad par ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba ston par byed do //
translated: means that it shows the particular power of those forms, etc.,

original: bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i khyad par la yod pa can gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu so sor nges pa can gyi bdag nyid bum pa'i khyad par gyi sgras rnams par gcod par byed de /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i khyad par la yod pa can gzugs la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu so sor nges pa can gyi bdag nyid bum pa'i khyad par gyi sgras rnams par gcod par byed de /
translated: The word ‚Äúpot‚Äù excludes the particular of the manifestation of pot, etc., which is the nature of the individual effect of eye consciousness, etc., which is the particular power of those forms, etc.

original: chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it shows the nature of the particular of holding water, etc.

original: phyogs 'dis gzhan la'ang brjod par bya //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis gzhan la'ang brjod par bya //
translated: By this method, the others should be explained.

original: dper na tsandan gyi dri zhes bya ba 'di la yang /
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi dri zhes bya ba 'di la yang /
translated: For example, in the case of ‚Äúthe smell of sandalwood,‚Äù

original: tsandan zhes bya ba'i rdzas cung zad kyang dri la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tsandan zhes bya ba'i rdzas cung zad kyang dri la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the fact that the substance called sandalwood is not different from its odor, etc.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: dri du ma'i bdag nyid can las tsandan gyi rang bzhin gyi dri gang yin pa des de ltar ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri du ma'i bdag nyid can las tsandan gyi rang bzhin gyi dri gang yin pa des de ltar ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the odor of the nature of sandalwood that is the nature of many odors.

original: de dag ni rgyas par sngar spyi dpyod pa'i skabs su dpyad zin pa de ltar na 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyas par sngar spyi dpyod pa'i skabs su dpyad zin pa de ltar na 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: We have already examined this in detail in the chapter on universals, so we will not discuss it here.

original: zhar la 'ongs ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs ba rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is concluded.

original: // / de ltar na lus gcig yod pa ni ma yin zhes bya pa 'dir gnas so //
analyzed: // / de ltar na lus gcig yod pa ni ma yin zhes bya pa 'dir gnas so //
translated: Thus, the body is not a single entity.

original: rdul phra mos du mar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdul phra mos du mar 'gyur na /
translated: If it is multiple because of the atoms,

original: 'di la yang rdul phran rnams tshogs pa rnams sems nyid la nus pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'di la yang rdul phran rnams tshogs pa rnams sems nyid la nus pa nyid yin nam /
translated: is the capacity of the mind itself the collection of atoms?

original: gang yang re re yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gang yang re re yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it each atom?

original: gal te re zhig lus kyi yan lag ma lus pa rnams rgyu nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te re zhig lus kyi yan lag ma lus pa rnams rgyu nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the body is the cause of all its parts,

original: ma lus rgyu nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: ma lus rgyu nyid yin na yang /
translated: then even if it is the cause of all,

original: lus yan lag gcig dang bral ba na yang /
analyzed: lus yan lag gcig dang bral ba na yang /
translated: If the body is deprived of one of its members,

original: sna bcad pa la sogs pas sems nyid min zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sna bcad pa la sogs pas sems nyid min zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the nose, for example, the mental consciousness would not be the effect of the body.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig ma lus pa gang dag gi 'bras bu yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig ma lus pa gang dag gi 'bras bu yin pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever is the effect of all of these is not the effect of any one of them,

original: de dag las gcig med pas me 'gyur te dper na gzugs dang mig gi 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / sa bon dang sa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myu gu'i rdzas lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag las gcig med pas me 'gyur te dper na gzugs dang mig gi 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / sa bon dang sa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myu gu'i rdzas lta bu'o //
translated: like the visual consciousness, which is the effect of the totality of the eye, form, light, and mental activity, or like the sprout, which is the effect of the totality of the seed, water, and so on.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the effect of the totality of the body‚Äôs atoms.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus kyi rdul phra rab rnams tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus kyi rdul phra rab rnams tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is an inference based on the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de dag las gcig med na yang de 'gyur bas na de'i phyir ma lus pa de dag gi @46a * //
analyzed: de dag las gcig med na yang de 'gyur bas na de'i phyir ma lus pa de dag gi @46a * //
translated: If the mental consciousness were the effect of the body, then it would not be the effect of any one of the body‚Äôs parts.

original: 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness is not the effect of the totality of the body‚Äôs parts.

original: thal ba bzlog pa ni gang dang du ma dag las gcig med na yang 'gyur ba de ni de dag ma lus pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: thal ba bzlog pa ni gang dang du ma dag las gcig med na yang 'gyur ba de ni de dag ma lus pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: The reversal of the reductio is: If something does not exist when one or many do not exist, then it is not the effect of all of them.

original: dper na 'khor lo la sogs pa med na yang snam bu 'gyur ba ni 'khor lo dang rdza mkhan la sogs pa ma lus pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor lo la sogs pa med na yang snam bu 'gyur ba ni 'khor lo dang rdza mkhan la sogs pa ma lus pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa de lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even if a wheel, etc., does not exist, a cloth can come into existence, but it is not the case that a cloth is the effect of all of the wheel, potter, etc.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus kyi rdul phra rab dag gi nang nas gcig med na yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus kyi rdul phra rab dag gi nang nas gcig med na yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Also, even if one of the subtle particles of the body does not exist, mental consciousness can arise. This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervasion.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab re re nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab re re nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if each subtle particle has the ability, then

original: re re'ang nus pa nyid yin na //üîΩcig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: re re'ang nus pa nyid yin na // cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: each would have the ability.üîΩMany would arise simultaneously.

original: dus gcig la rdul phra rab re res rnam par shes pa mang po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig la rdul phra rab re res rnam par shes pa mang po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: At one time, each subtle particle would generate many consciousnesses.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag 'bras bu gang la re re nus pa yod pa de dag ni 'bras bu de byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag 'bras bu gang la re re nus pa yod pa de dag ni 'bras bu de byed par 'gyur te /
translated: The argument is this: those that have the capacity for a particular effect individually will produce that effect.

original: dper na sa bon mang po dag so sor ljang bu la nus pa yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon mang po dag so sor ljang bu la nus pa yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, many seeds have the capacity for a sprout individually.

original: lus kyi rdul phra rab re re la yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i nus pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus kyi rdul phra rab re re la yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i nus pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And each atom of the body has the capacity for a mental consciousness. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar na mi 'gyur te gal te yang rdul phra rab re re nus pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang rnam par shes pa gcig nyid la nus pa yod pa yin gyi mang po dag la yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'gyur te gal te yang rdul phra rab re re nus pa nyid yin pa de ltar na yang rnam par shes pa gcig nyid la nus pa yod pa yin gyi mang po dag la yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But that is not so, for even if each atom has the capacity, the capacity is for a single consciousness, not for many.

original: de ni ma yin te mang po dag la yang rim gyis nus pa nyid khas len pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrim gyis ma yin par de byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te mang po dag la yang rim gyis nus pa nyid khas len pa'i phyir ro // rim gyis ma yin par de byed pa'am /
translated: That is not so, because we accept that the capacity is for many in a sequential order.üîΩIt is not that they produce it non-sequentially,

original: phyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it that they produce it later,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: de ltar go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba can gnas skabs gzhan dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba can gnas skabs gzhan dag kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, the order is established.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: But, in fact, the order of the moments of the life-force is not determined by the order of the moments of the in-breath and out-breath.

original: dbugs 'byung ba'am rngub pa gcig gis sems gcig nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba'am rngub pa gcig gis sems gcig nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa de ltar na /
translated: In fact, a single moment of the life-force causes the arising of a single moment of thought; a single moment of the in-breath and out-breath causes the arising of a single moment of the life-force.

original: cig car rnam par shes pa mang po 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: cig car rnam par shes pa mang po 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, there is no simultaneity of many consciousnesses.

original: de ni 'byung rngub dag ni nges byed min //
analyzed: de ni 'byung rngub dag ni nges byed min //
translated: The order of the moments of the life-force is not determined by the order of the moments of the in-breath and out-breath.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang /
translated: Because the in-breath and out-breath

original: du ma nyid du mtshungs nyid phyir //
analyzed: du ma nyid du mtshungs nyid phyir //
translated: are similar in being multiple.

original: ji ltar lus yan lag du ma can nyid yin pas rnam par shes pa mang po gcig car skyed par 'gyur ba de ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges @46b pa nyid med do //
analyzed: ji ltar lus yan lag du ma can nyid yin pas rnam par shes pa mang po gcig car skyed par 'gyur ba de ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges @46b pa nyid med do //
translated: Just as the body, which is made up of many parts, gives rise to many consciousnesses at one time, so too the in-breath and out-breath are not determined because they are multiple.

original: ci ste nyes pa der ma gyur cig snyam pas dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa rdzas gcig yin par rtogs par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa der ma gyur cig snyam pas dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa rdzas gcig yin par rtogs par byed na /
translated: If you think that this fault does not arise because you understand that the exhalation, etc., are one substance,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: that is not so,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pas cha 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pas cha 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body consciousness apprehends the parts, etc.

original: de ltar dbugs 'byung rngub dag gam //üîΩlus kyang gcig nyid yin par khas len na yang mang gsal 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar dbugs 'byung rngub dag gam // lus kyang gcig nyid yin par khas len na yang mang gsal 'gyur /
translated: Thus, if you accept that the exhalation and inhalation are one,

original: cig car de las 'byung ba can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car de las 'byung ba can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or that the body is one, then there would be the fault of the simultaneous arising of many mental consciousnesses from that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de rgyu yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyus lus dang dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa rtag tu nye phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyus lus dang dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa rtag tu nye phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of the mental consciousness is always near, since the body and exhalation, etc., are its cause.

original: rgyu ma tshang pa med pa thag nye ba can gang yin pa de ni 'gyur ba nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang pa med pa thag nye ba can gang yin pa de ni 'gyur ba nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: That which is near, having an unbroken cause, is just so.

original: lus dang dbugs 'byung rngub kyi 'bras bu nyid kyis yid kyi rnam pa ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang dbugs 'byung rngub kyi 'bras bu nyid kyis yid kyi rnam pa ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind that is the result of the body and inhalation and exhalation is the result of a complete cause,

original: cig car skye bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: cig car skye bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: it would arise simultaneously.

original: de'i gnas skabs can gyi nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs can gyi nyes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a fault that it has that state.

original: gal te du ma rgyu min zhes de ltar ne mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te du ma rgyu min zhes de ltar ne mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúMany are not causes,‚Äù that is not so.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang lus ni du ma nyid na yang shes pa gcig nyid la nus pa nyid yin gyi mang po dag la ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang lus ni du ma nyid na yang shes pa gcig nyid la nus pa nyid yin gyi mang po dag la ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though inhalation and exhalation and the body are many, they are the cause of a single consciousness, not of many.

original: de ni khyad med phyir rim las kyang min /
analyzed: de ni khyad med phyir rim las kyang min /
translated: That is not so, because there is no difference.

original: dgos pa ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag dang / lus kyi bdag nyid phyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa sngar yang de nyid yin pa de ltar na khyad par med pa'i phyir rgyu rim gyis bdag nyid can ma yin pa las 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rim pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag dang / lus kyi bdag nyid phyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa sngar yang de nyid yin pa de ltar na khyad par med pa'i phyir rgyu rim gyis bdag nyid can ma yin pa las 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rim pa can ma yin te /
translated: The purpose is that if inhalation and exhalation and the body are the cause of consciousness later, they are the cause of consciousness earlier. In that case, there is no difference. Therefore, the result, consciousness, is not sequential, arising from a cause that is not sequential.

original: sngar nyid cig car rnam par shes pa thams cad bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: sngar nyid cig car rnam par shes pa thams cad bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: It is just as you have stated, that is, that all consciousnesses would be produced simultaneously.

original: spyor ba ni gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par med pa'i ngo bo can yin pa de ni de'i skyed par byed pa yin te /üîΩdper na gnas skabs phyi ma'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: spyor ba ni gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par med pa'i ngo bo can yin pa de ni de'i skyed par byed pa yin te / dper na gnas skabs phyi ma'i khyad par ni /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not different from the nature that produces something is the producer of that,

original: mngon par 'dong pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par med pa'i ngo bo can yin pa de'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dong pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par med pa'i ngo bo can yin pa de'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the nature that produces the result that is the difference in the later state is not different from the nature that produces the result that is the difference in the later state.üîΩThe difference in the later state is not different from the nature that produces the result that is the difference in the later state.

original: snga ma'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang da'i 'bras bu'i khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs phyi ma'i khyad par gyi dngos po las khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs
analyzed: snga ma'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang da'i 'bras bu'i khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs phyi ma'i khyad par gyi dngos po las khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs
translated: The difference in the earlier state is not different from the nature that produces the result that is the difference in the later state, which is asserted to be the producer of the result that is the difference in the later state.
This is a logical argument from nature.

original: rgyu go rims med pa las kyang go rims dang ldan par gyur pa la ltos nas 'bras bu go rims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu go rims med pa las kyang go rims dang ldan par gyur pa la ltos nas 'bras bu go rims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not logical to say that an effect has a sequence, in dependence on a cause that does not have a sequence.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba rnams kyis gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdag nyid go rims med pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba rnams kyis gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdag nyid go rims med pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, since the primary elements have a nature that does not have a sequence,

original: gyur pa dag kyang go rims dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyur pa dag kyang go rims dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the transformations would not have a sequence.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi go rims med pa can gyi rgyu yin pa de ni rim bzhin du 'byung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi go rims med pa can gyi rgyu yin pa de ni rim bzhin du 'byung ba ma yin te //
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is the cause of something that does not have a sequence does not occur in a sequence,

original: dper na gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gcig gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gcig gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: like the primary elements, which are the cause of the single result that is the specific transformation.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gyur ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams kyi yang go rims med pa can gyi rgyu 'byung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gyur ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams kyi yang go rims med pa can gyi rgyu 'byung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the primary elements, which are the cause of the other specific transformations, does not have a sequence. This is a case of the observation of what is contradictory to the pervasion.

original: rgyu'i chos thams cad la 'bras bu'i chos rjes su byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu'i chos thams cad la 'bras bu'i chos rjes su byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, the effect does not follow all the properties of the cause.

original: rgyu go rims med pa can las 'bras bu go rims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang gtam las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu go rims med pa can las 'bras bu go rims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang gtam las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the statement ‚ÄúThe effect has order, but the cause does not‚Äù is also established.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu ni chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu ni chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par ni mi smra'i /
translated: Thus, we do not say that the effect follows all dharmas,

original: 'on kyang re zhig 'bras bu thams cad rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ni bya ba ma yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na 'bras bu'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig 'bras bu thams cad rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ni bya ba ma yin no // de lta ma yin na 'bras bu'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: but we do say that all effects follow the existence and nonexistence of causes.

original: 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the effect would not be an effect because it would not follow the cause.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pa de bas na gal te sems kyi rgyu lus la sogs pa sngar yang nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe rgyu la sogs pa gags byed pa med pa can de las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can dag tu rnam par shes par 'gyur
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa de bas na gal te sems kyi rgyu lus la sogs pa sngar yang nus pa nyid yin na de'i tshe rgyu la sogs pa gags byed pa med pa can de las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can dag tu rnam par shes par 'gyur
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, if the cause of mind, such as the body, is already capable, then consciousness would arise from it, since it would not be obstructed by causes and so on.

original: ba can nyid yin te /
analyzed: ba can nyid yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe /
translated: The performance is that at whatever timeüîΩ

original: rgyu ma lus pa'i nus pa thag nye ba can yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu ma lus pa'i nus pa thag nye ba can yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the proximate cause of the complete potential of something is that at that time.

original: dper na myu gu rgyu ma lus pa'i nus pa thag nye ba can yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu rgyu ma lus pa'i nus pa thag nye ba can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout is the proximate cause of the complete potential of its seed.

original: rim bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can du 'dod pas gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: rim bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can du 'dod pas gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang /
translated: Since it is accepted that they occur in sequence, the specific states of the process and the mental consciousness, etc.

original: sngar yang rgyu ma lus pa'i nus pa nye ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sngar yang rgyu ma lus pa'i nus pa nye ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: are also the proximate cause of the complete potential of their seeds. This is a syllogism of essential nature.

original: ci ste de la nus pa ma yin pa yod na yang 'bras bu de mi 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste de la nus pa ma yin pa yod na yang 'bras bu de mi 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: If something does not become the effect of something else even when it has its complete potential,

original: de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the effect of that.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la nus pa ma lus pa yod na @47b yang mi 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la nus pa ma lus pa yod na @47b yang mi 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not become something else even when it has its complete potential

original: de'i 'bras bu ma yin te //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma yin te //
translated: is not the effect of that.

original: dper na ba lang ni rta'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang ni rta'i lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a cow is not the effect of a horse.

original: phyis skyed par byed par khyad par med pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu'i nus pa ma lus pa sngar yod na yang /
analyzed: phyis skyed par byed par khyad par med pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu'i nus pa ma lus pa sngar yod na yang /
translated: If the power of the cause, which is the nature of the effect, were to exist previously without exception,üîΩthen later the effect, such as consciousness, would not occur.

original: phyis 'byung ba can gyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩdbugs 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba can gyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o // dbugs 'byung ba'am /
translated: This is a nonobservation of a pervader.

original: rngub pa gcig gis sems gcig nyid mngon par gsal bar byed par smras pa gang yin pa de yang yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rngub pa gcig gis sems gcig nyid mngon par gsal bar byed par smras pa gang yin pa de yang yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that a single mind is clearly manifest by a single exhalation or inhalation.

original: de ltar na dbugs 'byung ba gcig gi dus na'ang /
analyzed: de ltar na dbugs 'byung ba gcig gi dus na'ang /
translated: That is not so, because even at the time of a single exhalation,

original: don du ma 'dzin phyir blo du ma 'byung ba dang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don du ma 'dzin phyir blo du ma 'byung ba dang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: many minds would arise and cease because many objects would be apprehended.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang de las nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang de las nges pa yin no //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation are ascertained from that.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na de'i tshe blo go rims dang ldan pa mang po ni med kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na de'i tshe blo go rims dang ldan pa mang po ni med kyi /
translated: If that were so, then at that time there would not be many minds in sequence,

original: 'on kyang de ltar go rims dang ldan pa'i byed pa can gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar go rims dang ldan pa'i byed pa can gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: but rather there would be a single mind with sequential activity.

original: de ltar na ni blo gcig gis don du ma shes pa khas len pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na ni blo gcig gis don du ma shes pa khas len pa yin na yang /
translated: Thus, if you accept that a single cognition cognizes multiple objects,

original: blo'i byed pa thams cad cig car 'gyur gyi rim gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i byed pa thams cad cig car 'gyur gyi rim gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: then all the activities of cognition would occur simultaneously, not sequentially.

original: de ltar na 'gal ba med phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gal ba med phyir te /
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction,

original: ji ltar gcig gi rgyu mtshan blo yin pa de ltar de las phyis kyi yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig gi rgyu mtshan blo yin pa de ltar de las phyis kyi yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because just as the cause of one is cognition, so the cause of the subsequent ones is also that.

original: cig car byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they would occur simultaneously.

original: gal te ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that is not so,

original: rim gyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rim gyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: then they would not occur sequentially either.

original: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between them.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin la khyad par med pa'i phyir nges pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin la khyad par med pa'i phyir nges pa yin no //
translated: Because there is no difference in the nature of the former.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyis dbugs 'byung ba gcig ni rnam par shes pa du ma'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyis dbugs 'byung ba gcig ni rnam par shes pa du ma'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: As explained, a single exhalation is not the cause of multiple consciousnesses.üîΩHowever,üîΩIf many elements arise in a single moment,

original: 'on kyang / gal te 'byung ba mang skad cig rang rigs mun pa'i dus can dag / gang gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba gcig yin pa de'i tshe gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang / gal te 'byung ba mang skad cig rang rigs mun pa'i dus can dag / gang gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba gcig yin pa de'i tshe gzhan ma yin no //
translated: when there is a single exhalation, there is not another.

original: de 'dra ba de rnams kyis rim bzhin du 'byung ba can mang po skad cig ma /üîΩsems de 'dra ba bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: de 'dra ba de rnams kyis rim bzhin du 'byung ba can mang po skad cig ma / sems de 'dra ba bdag nyid kyi //
translated: The order of the elements is determined by the order of their appearance.üîΩThe mind is the cause of the elements.

original: rgyu nyid yin par rtogs pa na /
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin par rtogs pa na /
translated: When one understands that the mind is the cause of the elements,

original: de'i tshe go rims ldan pa'i rgyu med pa dbugs 'byung ba dang / de dag rim ldan ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe go rims ldan pa'i rgyu med pa dbugs 'byung ba dang / de dag rim ldan ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: then, in the absence of a cause, how can the order of the elements be explained?

original: dbugs 'byung ba de dag gi lus go rims med pa can rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba de dag gi lus go rims med pa can rgyur 'dod do //
translated: The body is the cause of the order of the elements.

original: de bas na go rims med pa can las dbugs 'byung ba go rims dang ldan pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de bas na go rims med pa can las dbugs 'byung ba go rims dang ldan pa ma yin na /
translated: If the body is not the cause of the order of the elements,üîΩhow can the order of the elements be explained?üîΩIf the order of the elements is not explained,

original: ci'i phyir de dag las kyang rnam par shes pa go rims @48a * //üîΩdang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag las kyang rnam par shes pa go rims @48a * // dang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: how can the order of the consciousnesses be explained?

original: de ltar na 'di rtog pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di rtog pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the theory of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is not reasonable.

original: ci ste nyes pa de 'chab pa'i phyir dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa ni lus kyi rgyu can du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa de 'chab pa'i phyir dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa ni lus kyi rgyu can du mi 'dod do //
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the elements are not the cause of the body,

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what is the cause of the elements?

original: dbugs 'byung ba snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The previous elements are the cause of the later elements.

original: de lta yin pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: de lta yin pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: If that is so,

original: rang rigs snga ma'i rgyu can yin /üîΩdbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa dag yin par rtog na /
analyzed: rang rigs snga ma'i rgyu can yin / dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa dag yin par rtog na /
translated: then it has the same cause as the previous type.üîΩIf you imagine that it is the exhalation of breath,

original: mngal la sogs par dbugs 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: mngal la sogs par dbugs 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
translated: then the exhalation of breath in the womb and so on

original: dang po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would not occur in the beginning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / de rgyu de 'dra yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de rgyu de 'dra yod ma yin //
translated: Because it does not have a cause like that.

original: dang po gang yin pa de'i rgyur gyur pa dbugs 'byung ba rigs mthun pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
