analyzed: dang po gang yin pa de'i rgyur gyur pa dbugs 'byung ba rigs mthun pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not have another homogeneous cause that is the exhalation of breath, which is the cause of the first.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod par bya ste de'i rgyu yod na yang dbugs 'byung ba rigs mthun pa /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod par bya ste de'i rgyu yod na yang dbugs 'byung ba rigs mthun pa /
translated: Even if you accept that, we would say that if it has a cause, then the homogeneous exhalation of breath

original: du ma nyid du des skad cig ma gcig la gdon mi za bar mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma nyid du des skad cig ma gcig la gdon mi za bar mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: would be multiple. Without a doubt, it would be multiple in a single moment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩtha dad yul can phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / tha dad yul can phyir te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it has a different object.

original: yul tha dad pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has a different object that is different from the other.

original: dbugs 'byung ba ni yan lag du ma'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba ni yan lag du ma'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: The exhalation of breath has the nature of many parts.

original: khyu la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: khyu la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is like a herd, etc.

original: de bas na yul sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa can nyid ni tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yul sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa can nyid ni tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the possession of a variety of objects is the difference.

original: gang dang gang yul sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa can de ni sna tshogs pa ma yin te dper na til mang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang yul sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa can de ni sna tshogs pa ma yin te dper na til mang po lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever possesses a variety of objects is not a variety, like a multitude of sesame seeds.

original: dbugs 'byung ba skad cig ma yang yul sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba skad cig ma yang yul sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The momentary exhalation possesses a variety of objects. This is a natural inference.

original: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba yan lag re re nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba yan lag re re nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the exhalation has a variety of potencies in each part,

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: from those,

original: de phyir blo ni cig car skye //
analyzed: de phyir blo ni cig car skye //
translated: the cognition arises simultaneously.

original: gsal bar byed pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the variety of illuminations.

original: gal te dbugs 'byung ba du ma'ang gcig dus can /
analyzed: gal te dbugs 'byung ba du ma'ang gcig dus can /
translated: If many exhalations have the same time,

original: yin la sems gcig rgyu yin na //
analyzed: yin la sems gcig rgyu yin na //
translated: and one mind is the cause,

original: cig car mang por 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car mang por 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: many would not arise simultaneously.

original: de'i tshe ma lus pa shes pa gcig la nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma lus pa shes pa gcig la nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the capacity for knowing all is in one consciousness.

original: dbugs 'byung ba'i yan lag gcig ma tshang na'ang /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba'i yan lag gcig ma tshang na'ang /
translated: If one part of the exhalation is missing,

original: rnam par shes pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness does not occur.

original: gang la zhe na dal bar ni /üîΩ'byung ba can sogs la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na dal bar ni / 'byung ba can sogs la'o //
translated: With respect to what?üîΩWith respect to slow exhalation, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni dbugs 'byung ba chad pa can dang / dbugs mi 'byung ba @48b can gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni dbugs 'byung ba chad pa can dang / dbugs mi 'byung ba @48b can gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes interrupted exhalation and nonexhalation.

original: dbugs 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / lus kyi rdul phra rab de dang de dag ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gcig la nye bar sbyor ba tha dad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / lus kyi rdul phra rab de dang de dag ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gcig la nye bar sbyor ba tha dad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The parts of the exhalation and the various atoms of the body are said to be associated with one result, consciousness.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa du ma'i 'bras bu gcig nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa du ma'i 'bras bu gcig nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: For example, even though the result of many things, such as the eye, is the same,

original: rnam par shes pa'i yid la byed pa las nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid dang yul las der snang ba dang dbang po las yul so sor nges par thob pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yid la byed pa las nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid dang yul las der snang ba dang dbang po las yul so sor nges par thob pa lta bu'o //
translated: consciousness is experienced as having a different object from mental activity, as having an appearance of the object, and as having a particular object from the sense faculty.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig kho na nye bar sbyor bar byed na ni gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig kho na nye bar sbyor bar byed na ni gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then if only one were to be applied, the other would be pointless.

original: nye bar spyor ba nyid yod du zin kyang phan gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nye bar spyor ba nyid yod du zin kyang phan gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: Even if there were application, the particular nature of what is to be benefited would have to be indicated,

original: dper na kho bos bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na kho bos bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as in the case of my teaching.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: If it were not so, then the difference in the effect would not be due to the difference in the cause.

original: // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bcu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu drug pa /
translated: Book Sixteen

original: ci ste ji ltar yod rgyu yin //
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar yod rgyu yin //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow can it be the cause?‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: It can be so.

original: dbugs 'byung ba ring ba can la sogs pa dag la dbugs 'byung ba ji srid 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag rgyu yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba ring ba can la sogs pa dag la dbugs 'byung ba ji srid 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag rgyu yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the length of the breath and so on are the cause of the change in the breath,

original: shes pa la yang khyad par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa la yang khyad par 'gyur //
translated: then there will be a difference in consciousness as well.

original: gang gi tshe skyes bu'i dbugs lhag par 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes bu'i dbugs lhag par 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When a person‚Äôs breath is excessive,

original: rnam par shes pa gsal bar 'gyur zhing dbugs mi 'byung ba can gyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal bar 'gyur zhing dbugs mi 'byung ba can gyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness would be clear and there would be no cessation of breathing.

original: de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gang zhig gang gi tha dad las //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi tha dad las //
translated: then that which is not different from that which is different

original: tha dad min te de 'bras min //
analyzed: tha dad min te de 'bras min //
translated: is not its effect.

original: gal te dbugs 'byung ba'i 'bras bu sems nyid yin pa de'i tshe 'di dbugs 'byung ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbugs 'byung ba'i 'bras bu sems nyid yin pa de'i tshe 'di dbugs 'byung ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind itself were the effect of the exhalation of breath, then it would follow that this mind would conform to the clarity and unclarity of the exhalation of breath.

original: rjes su mi byed pa de bas na de ni 'bras bu ma yin no//
analyzed: rjes su mi byed pa de bas na de ni 'bras bu ma yin no//
translated: But it does not conform to it, and therefore it is not its effect.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis /üîΩgang zhig gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin te dper na me gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gis khyad par nyams su myong ba can gyi mo gsham
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis / gang zhig gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin te dper na me gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gis khyad par nyams su myong ba can gyi mo gsham
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not distinguished by the distinctions of clarity, unclarity, etc.,

original: gyi bu ni me'i 'bras bu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gyi bu ni me'i 'bras bu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: is not the effect of that, like the son of a barren woman, who is not distinguished by the distinctions of clarity, unclarity, etc., of fire, because he is not fire.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i khyad par gyis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs @49a * //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i khyad par gyis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs @49a * //
translated: The mental consciousness is not clear or unclear due to the difference in the clarity or unclarity of the exhalation and inhalation of breath.üîΩThis is a non-observation of the pervader.

original: pa'o // de ltar ni 'gyur na rnam par shes pa snga ma mi gsal du zin kyang yul gsal ba las phyis kyi shes pa gsal bar 'gyur ba des na sngar gyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na
analyzed: pa'o // de ltar ni 'gyur na rnam par shes pa snga ma mi gsal du zin kyang yul gsal ba las phyis kyi shes pa gsal bar 'gyur ba des na sngar gyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na
translated: If it were like that, even if the previous consciousness were unclear, the later consciousness would become clear due to the clarity of the object. Therefore, it is not definite that it follows the previous consciousness, because it does not have that.

original: / de ni ma yin te sngar gyi shes pa dang yul gsal bar 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba med pa'i phyir cha de tsam nyid kyis rjes su byed par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ni ma yin te sngar gyi shes pa dang yul gsal bar 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba med pa'i phyir cha de tsam nyid kyis rjes su byed par byas pa yin no //
translated: That is not so, because it follows that very portion by being similar to the previous consciousness and the clarity of the object, even though it is not exactly the same.

original: gal te khyed cag gi yang ci'i phyir cig car shes pa mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gi yang ci'i phyir cig car shes pa mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: If you ask why consciousness does not arise simultaneously,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: kho bo'i lus sam dbugs 'byung ba dag ni yid kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin na gang gis na de ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: kho bo'i lus sam dbugs 'byung ba dag ni yid kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin na gang gis na de ltar 'gyur /
translated: If my body or my breathing are not the cause of the appropriation of mind, how could it be otherwise?

original: 'on kyang rigs mthun pa'i sems snga ma snga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs mthun pa'i sems snga ma snga ma yin no //
translated: But it is the former mind of the same type.

original: des na rnam shes nus pa nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rnam shes nus pa nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the potency of consciousness is determined,üîΩone mind is the cause of one mind.

original: sems gcig ni sems gcig gi rgyu yin pa de ltar na rigs mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems gcig ni sems gcig gi rgyu yin pa de ltar na rigs mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, because consciousness of the same type is not simultaneous, it is not similar.

original: sems snga ma snga ma rgyu yin pa de nyid kyang gang las she na /
analyzed: sems snga ma snga ma rgyu yin pa de nyid kyang gang las she na /
translated: And how is it that the former mind is the cause?

original: don gzhan chags bral sems yod na //
analyzed: don gzhan chags bral sems yod na //
translated: If there is a mind free from attachment to another object,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bzung ba ma yin no zhes 'dod pa de las don gzhan bzung bar gyur pa ni ser po la sogs pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bzung ba ma yin no zhes 'dod pa de las don gzhan bzung bar gyur pa ni ser po la sogs pa'i yul yin no //
translated: If it is asserted that blue, etc., is not apprehended because it is not compatible with the object, then the object apprehended is different from that, such as a yellow object.

original: de la chags pa ni yul de nyid la yang dang yang skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa ni yul de nyid la yang dang yang skye ba'o //
translated: Attachment to that is the repeated arising of the mind to that object.

original: de dang bral ba ni yul gzhan la shes pa skye ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni yul gzhan la shes pa skye ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of being free from that is the state of being free from the nature of a cause for the arising of consciousness in another object.

original: yid la byed pa'i ming can snga ma de 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa de yod na de las phyis 'byung nas /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i ming can snga ma de 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa de yod na de las phyis 'byung nas /
translated: If there were such a prior consciousness, which is called attention, then a subsequent one would arise from it.

original: don gzhan 'dzin pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan 'dzin pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehension of another object.

original: yul gzhan rtogs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan rtogs pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehension of another object.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: sems snga ma snga ma rnyog pa dang dang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag yin na /
analyzed: sems snga ma snga ma rnyog pa dang dang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag yin na /
translated: If the prior mental states are associated with turbidity, clarity, and so on,

original: phyis kyi yang rjes su mthun pas de bzhin du 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: phyis kyi yang rjes su mthun pas de bzhin du 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: then the subsequent ones will be similar, in accordance with them.

original: blo ni gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo ni gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is preceded by another.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang rjes su mi mthun pa yod na mi 'byung ba dang / yang rjes su mthun pa yod na 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang rjes su mi mthun pa yod na mi 'byung ba dang / yang rjes su mthun pa yod na 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te /
translated: An application is that if something does not occur when something else that is not in accordance with it exists, and if it occurs when something else that is in accordance with it exists, then the latter is the cause and the former is the result.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa mi mthun pa dang mthun pa nyid yod na skye ba dang mi skye ba'i myu gu dag ni sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa mi mthun pa dang mthun pa nyid yod na skye ba dang mi skye ba'i myu gu dag ni sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if a seed, etc., is both dissimilar and similar, then the sprout, etc., is the effect of the seed, etc., whether or not it is produced.

original: phyis kyi shes pa yang snga ma'i shes pa mi @49b mthun pa dang mthun pa dag las skye ba dang mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyis kyi shes pa yang snga ma'i shes pa mi @49b mthun pa dang mthun pa dag las skye ba dang mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the subsequent cognition is produced from the previous cognition, whether or not it is similar. This is a natural inference.

original: mngal la sogs par gal te lus las lan cig blo skye zhing ste /
analyzed: mngal la sogs par gal te lus las lan cig blo skye zhing ste /
translated: If the mind arises once from the body in the womb, etc.,

original: blo cig car skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: blo cig car skye ba ma yin no //
translated: the mind does not arise simultaneously.

original: phyis ni ste de las 'og tu rang rigs las nges par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: phyis ni ste de las 'og tu rang rigs las nges par 'gyur na'o //
translated: Later, it is determined from its own kind, and not from the body.

original: gal te blo snga ma snga ma re res blo phyi ma phyi ma nyid skyed par byed par de ltar na lus las cig car sems mang po nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo snga ma snga ma re res blo phyi ma phyi ma nyid skyed par byed par de ltar na lus las cig car sems mang po nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If each previous mind produces the subsequent mind, then many minds do not arise simultaneously from the body.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar lus kyis nus pa ni blo skyed par byed pa las ci'i phyir na ldog pa yin rang bzhin gang gis lus ni blo snga ma gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de dang / de ni phyis kyang ma bral ba nyid yin pa de ltar na blo gzhan dang gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ci'i phyir blo skyed pa de'i byed pa ldog pa can yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyis nus pa ni blo skyed par byed pa las ci'i phyir na ldog pa yin rang bzhin gang gis lus ni blo snga ma gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de dang / de ni phyis kyang ma bral ba nyid yin pa de ltar na blo gzhan dang gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ci'i phyir blo skyed pa de'i byed pa ldog pa can yin /
translated: Why would the body‚Äôs ability to generate cognition cease? Whatever is the nature of the body that generates cognition by means of one cognition, it would not be separated from that nature later. In that case, it would generate other and other cognitions. Why would the activity of generating cognition cease?

original: spyor ba ni gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang ma bral bar gnas pa de ni de skyed par byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: spyor ba ni gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang ma bral bar gnas pa de ni de skyed par byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Whatever is the nature of generating something and it remains without being separated from that nature, it is the generator of that.

original: dper na myu gu'i rgyu tshogs pa'i gnas skabs tha ma ni myu gu'i skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu'i rgyu tshogs pa'i gnas skabs tha ma ni myu gu'i skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the final stage of the assembly of the causes of a sprout is the generator of the sprout.

original: lus bdag nyid gcig pa can phyis kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus bdag nyid gcig pa can phyis kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The body is not different from the nature that generates mental consciousness later, this is a natural inference.

original: phyis kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i de'i phyir phyi ma bzhin du bdag nyid des sngar yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i de'i phyir phyi ma bzhin du bdag nyid des sngar yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Later, it does not generate mental consciousness, and therefore, like the later body, it does not generate mental consciousness earlier,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin du khyad par med pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin du khyad par med pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not a generating state and is not different from the nature of that is not a generator.

original: dper na phyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i lus de nyid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i lus de nyid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, that very body which does not generate mental consciousness later is not a generator of mental consciousness.

original: skyed par byed par mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyi lus kyang skyed par mi byed pa'i tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin las khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed par mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyi lus kyang skyed par mi byed pa'i tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin las khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: The body in the final stage, which is not productive of the body that is desired to be produced, is not different from the nature of the body in the initial stage.

original: gal te lus ni sems kyi rten ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lus ni sems kyi rten ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the basis of mind,

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni shi ba'i gnas skabs su ldog pa na /üîΩrten med phyir na phyis kyang sems 'ba' zhig /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni shi ba'i gnas skabs su ldog pa na / rten med phyir na phyis kyang sems 'ba' zhig /
translated: because when the body with its faculties ceases in the state of death,

original: lus la ltos pa med pa gnas 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lus la ltos pa med pa gnas 'gyur zhe na /
translated: the mind does not remain without a basis.üîΩIf you say that the mind is the basis of the body,

original: gal te de'i rgyu 'jug thob phyir lus tha ma'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i lus skyed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gal te de'i rgyu 'jug thob phyir lus tha ma'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i lus skyed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the mind is the cause of the body,üîΩthe mind is the cause of the body that is the link to the next life.

original: @50a * // sems rgyud gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni blo phyi ma phyi ma nying mtshams sbyor bar nus pa blo snga ma snga ma'i ngo bo'i las yin no //
analyzed: @50a * // sems rgyud gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni blo phyi ma phyi ma nying mtshams sbyor bar nus pa blo snga ma snga ma'i ngo bo'i las yin no //
translated: The cause of the mind‚Äôs remaining in the body is the action of the nature of the earlier minds that are able to link to the later minds.üîΩIf it is not the cause of the body,

original: yan lag ste lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: yan lag ste lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur na /
translated: it would not be a condition.

original: de'i tshe sems 'ba' zhig gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems 'ba' zhig gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the mind alone remains,

original: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams su skyed pa'i srog chags lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams su skyed pa'i srog chags lta bu'o //
translated: like a living being born in the formless realm.

original: gang gi tshe lus tha ma lus phyi ma dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir blo lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur ba de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus tha ma lus phyi ma dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir blo lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur ba de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: When the mind is the co-originating cause of the body, because it is the cause of the body‚Äôs arising in the next life, then it is a co-originating cause because it is a co-originating factor. Thus there is no contradiction.

original: yang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus kyi rgyu gang gang yin /üîΩgang gi 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus kyi rgyu gang gang yin / gang gi 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the cause of the body in the next world?üîΩWhat is the cause of the mind‚Äôs entry into the body?

original: sems gnas pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid du bstan ce na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid du bstan ce na /
translated: Why is the mind taught to be the co-originating condition of the body?

original: tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga tshe 'di nyid kyi dbang po lnga'i ngo bo can te lus kyi tha ma ni lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga tshe 'di nyid kyi dbang po lnga'i ngo bo can te lus kyi tha ma ni lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The five sense bases of this life, which have the nature of the five sense faculties of this life, are the cause of the body‚Äôs arising in the next life.

original: ci ste yang de'i yan lag dang lus kyi rgyu nyid ni bkag pa la ni sems gnas pa'i rgyu las de'i lus kyi 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste yang de'i yan lag dang lus kyi rgyu nyid ni bkag pa la ni sems gnas pa'i rgyu las de'i lus kyi 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the cause of its body and limbs has been refuted, then the cause of the body‚Äôs engagement is the cause of the mind‚Äôs abiding.üîΩYou have not seen the refutation of the nature of the cooperative cause, nor the refutation of the five sense spheres of this life being the cause of the body in the next life. You have stated the mere nonobservation of that as the reason, ‚ÄúI do not see it.‚Äù

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo bkag pa dang / tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga lus phyi ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa bkag pa la de ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa de dang de'i yan lag gi ngo bo dang de'i rgyu nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir maüîΩgyur pa nyid kyi phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyi mi dmigs pa ni nges byed min par rab tu bshad //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo bkag pa dang / tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga lus phyi ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa bkag pa la de ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa de dang de'i yan lag gi ngo bo dang de'i rgyu nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyi mi dmigs pa ni nges byed min par rab tu bshad //
translated: But that mere nonobservation is not a valid reason, because it is not the observation of the nature of that and its cause.

original: mtshan nyid dpyad pa'i skabs su ma nges par brjod pa de lta na go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dpyad pa'i skabs su ma nges par brjod pa de lta na go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In the context of the analysis of the defining characteristics, it is said that it is not ascertained. In that case, it is not a proof.

original: dbang sogs kyang ni lhag ldan yin //
analyzed: dbang sogs kyang ni lhag ldan yin //
translated: The sense faculties and so on are also possessed in excess.

original: de'i yan lag dang rgyu'i ngo bo bkag pa nyid ni mig gi dbang po nyid yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po tha ma dbang po phyi ma'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i yan lag dang rgyu'i ngo bo bkag pa nyid ni mig gi dbang po nyid yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po tha ma dbang po phyi ma'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: Because it is the nature of the eye faculty, the final eye faculty does not link with a subsequent eye faculty,

original: mig gi dbang po snga ma snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po snga ma snga ma bzhin no //
translated: just as the prior eye faculty does.

original: de bzhin du sems nyid yin pa'i phyir tha ma'i sems ni lus phyi ma skyed pa la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te sems snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems nyid yin pa'i phyir tha ma'i sems ni lus phyi ma skyed pa la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te sems snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, because it is the nature of mind, the final mind is not the co-originating cause for the generation of a subsequent body, just as the prior mind is.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni de lta bu'i rigs can lag pa dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni de lta bu'i rigs can lag pa dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes such things as the possession of hands.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyir la ma mthong ba tsam gyis khyab pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa lhag ma dang ldan pa ni ma @50b nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyir la ma mthong ba tsam gyis khyab pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa lhag ma dang ldan pa ni ma @50b nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of the contradiction, and because there is no pervasion by mere non-observation, the remainder of the proof is inconclusive.

original: de ltar na re zhig yod pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig yod pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the existence of the past and future.

original: 'di las tha ma'i skye mched lnga rgyu 'ba' zhig nyid du lus gzhan skyed pa yod pas bshad pa ma yin gyi 'di ltar 'di nyid kyi dbang po snga ma'i rang rigs la /
analyzed: 'di las tha ma'i skye mched lnga rgyu 'ba' zhig nyid du lus gzhan skyed pa yod pas bshad pa ma yin gyi 'di ltar 'di nyid kyi dbang po snga ma'i rang rigs la /
translated: The five latter bases are not explained to be only causes that generate other bodies.üîΩ

original: dbang po phyi ma dag la yang nus pa dag ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po phyi ma dag la yang nus pa dag ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: The five latter bases are not explained as only causes that generate another body, but rather, in this way, the former faculties of this very person are seen to have the power with regard to the latter faculties.

original: sbyor ba ni gang skye mched lnga yin pa de ni phyis kyi skye mched lnga nying mtshams sbyor ba can du yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang skye mched lnga yin pa de ni phyis kyi skye mched lnga nying mtshams sbyor ba can du yod pa yin te /
translated: The application is: Whatever is the five bases is the five latter bases that link with the prior bases.

original: dper na snga ma'i skye mched lnga'i skad cig ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snga ma'i skye mched lnga'i skad cig ma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the moment of the former five bases.

original: tha ma'i skyed mched lnga yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: tha ma'i skyed mched lnga yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The five latter bases are the reason that is the nature of the predicate.

original: 'ba' zhig gi tshe nying mtshams sbyor ba yod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi tshe nying mtshams sbyor ba yod pa de ltar na /
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúonly‚Äù linking with the prior bases exists,

original: sgrub par byed pa la ma khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la ma khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: the proof is not non-pervasive,

original: gcig tu nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it excludes the single non-linking.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na skye mched lnga'i rang bzhin tha dad pa med pas na dbang po snga ma dag ni dbang po phyi ma dag gi rgyu nyid ma yin pa de ltar na dpe la chos can ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na skye mched lnga'i rang bzhin tha dad pa med pas na dbang po snga ma dag ni dbang po phyi ma dag gi rgyu nyid ma yin pa de ltar na dpe la chos can ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then since the natures of the five sense faculties are not different, the former faculties would not be the causes of the latter faculties. In that case, the subject is not established in the example.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: 'di ltar gzhan gzhan gyi skye ba dag kyang grub pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gzhan gyi skye ba dag kyang grub pa yin /
translated: the arising of one thing from another is established.

original: dbang po rnams kyi dang ba dang rnyog pa la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi dang ba dang rnyog pa la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the change of the faculties, such as clarity and turbidity, is seen.

original: skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa sgrub par byed pa'i 'thad pa gnas gzhan du bshad pa dag gis kyang gzhan dang gzhan gyi skye ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa sgrub par byed pa'i 'thad pa gnas gzhan du bshad pa dag gis kyang gzhan dang gzhan gyi skye ba ste /
translated: The reasonings that prove momentariness, which are explained in another treatise, also prove the arising of one thing from another.

original: dbang po gzhan dang gzhan gyi skye ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan dang gzhan gyi skye ba grub pa yin no //
translated: They prove the arising of one faculty from another.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Since that is so,

original: rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid la rgyu bstan pa ni ma spros so //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid la rgyu bstan pa ni ma spros so //
translated: I have not elaborated on the cause of a different nature.

original: sbyor ba yang gang rang bzhin du gyur ba tha dad pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par can yin pa de ni dngos su phan tshun shin tu tha dad pa yin te sa dang chu la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang rang bzhin du gyur ba tha dad pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par can yin pa de ni dngos su phan tshun shin tu tha dad pa yin te sa dang chu la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dag lta bu'o //
translated: The proof is as follows: that which is a transformation is a particular that has a different state from its nature; it is actually mutually different, like the elements earth, water, etc.

original: gyur ba re re la snga phyir gyur pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa can gyi skye mched lnga yang rang bzhin du gyur pa'i tha dad pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gyur ba re re la snga phyir gyur pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa can gyi skye mched lnga yang rang bzhin du gyur pa'i tha dad pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The five sense-spheres that have a different state in the past and future in each transformation are a particular that has a different state from its nature. This is a natural inference.

original: de bas na dpe la chos can ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dpe la chos can ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the subject is not unestablished in the example.

original: gal te lus las de skye na /
analyzed: gal te lus las de skye na /
translated: If it arises from the body,

original: rigs mthun pa'i dbang po dag las phyis kyi dbang po rnams skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i dbang po dag las phyis kyi dbang po rnams skye ba ma yin no //
translated: the later sense-faculties do not arise from sense-faculties of a similar type.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩlus las dbang po de dag skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / lus las dbang po de dag skye bar 'dod do //
translated: What then?

original: dbang @51a * //
analyzed: dbang @51a * //
translated: It is asserted that those sense-faculties arise from the body.üîΩThe sense-faculties

original: po dag gi rgyu mtshan dbang po las tha dad pa'i lus gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: po dag gi rgyu mtshan dbang po las tha dad pa'i lus gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But the body that is separate from the sense faculties does not exist.

original: 'on kyang dbang po can ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po can ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If you say that the sense faculties are not the body,

original: de ltar na yang shi ba'i lus las kyang dbang po skye ba bzlog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang shi ba'i lus las kyang dbang po skye ba bzlog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the sense faculties would arise from the body of a dead person.

original: snga ma bzhin du thal par 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thal par 'gyur //
translated: The same errors would occur as before.

original: dbang po du ma cig car thal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dbang po du ma cig car thal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Many sense faculties would arise simultaneously.

original: snga ma bzhin te lus sems skyed par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te lus sems skyed par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the mind and body are the causes of the sense faculties,

original: mang gsal 'gyur /
analyzed: mang gsal 'gyur /
translated: then the sense faculties would be manifest

original: rtag tu de rgyu nye phyir ro //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i skyon gang yin pa de dbang po skyed pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de rgyu nye phyir ro // zhes bshad pa'i skyon gang yin pa de dbang po skyed pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: because their cause would always be present.

original: gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par skyon brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par skyon brjod par bya'o //
translated: The errors that would occur if the sense faculties were produced from the elements would also occur if the sense faculties were produced from the elements.üîΩThe errors that would occur if the sense faculties were produced from the mind would also occur if the sense faculties were produced from the mind.üîΩIf you assert that the sense faculties arise from the mind because it is illogical that the body arises from the mind,

original: gal te sems las kyang lus nyid du rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir lhag mar gyur pa sems las dbang po skye ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sems las kyang lus nyid du rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir lhag mar gyur pa sems las dbang po skye ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: then the sense faculties would arise from the mind.

original: sems de las skye mched lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lus gzhan dag kyang skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sems de las skye mched lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lus gzhan dag kyang skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Other bodies, which are the nature of the five sense spheres, arise from that mind.

original: ji ltar tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i kho bo cag gi 'ching bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ji ltar tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i kho bo cag gi 'ching bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What harm is there in our saying that the five sense spheres of this very life are the cause?

original: gang gi phyir lus sems kyi nye bar len par gyur pa ma yin par bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus sems kyi nye bar len par gyur pa ma yin par bsgrubs pa /
translated: We have established that the body is not the appropriated object of the mind.

original: de'i phyir lus kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the body is devoid of the cause of the elements,üîΩthe final mind of an ordinary being or an arhat,

original: so so'i skye bo dang dgra bcom par 'dod pa'i skyes bu dang 'brel pa can gyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang dgra bcom par 'dod pa'i skyes bu dang 'brel pa can gyi /
translated: which is related to the person who is asserted to be either an ordinary being or an arhat,

original: sems tha ma nyid thams cad kyi /üîΩmtshams mi sbyor min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems tha ma nyid thams cad kyi / mtshams mi sbyor min zhes bya ba la /
translated: does not link with all subsequent minds.

original: rgyu dang bral phyir bya ba 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral phyir bya ba 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of a cause‚Äù indicates that the reason is not established.

original: des de dang 'dra ba'i 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag mar gyur pa /
analyzed: des de dang 'dra ba'i 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag mar gyur pa /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the final mind of death that is similar to that‚Äù and so on is a remainder.

original: sgrub byed lhag ldan yin par 'dod //
analyzed: sgrub byed lhag ldan yin par 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that the remainder is a proof statement that has a remainder.

original: sems gzhan nyid mtshams sbyor ba la gnod pa can nyid yod pa ma yin no //üîΩji ltar lus tha dad pa la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /üîΩ'jig rten gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa can gyi sems ni sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems gzhan nyid mtshams sbyor ba la gnod pa can nyid yod pa ma yin no // ji ltar lus tha dad pa la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir / 'jig rten gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa can gyi sems ni sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the mind is not connected to another mind.üîΩHow is it that the mind of one who is born in another world, and who is situated in a body that is desired in another world, is not connected to another mind?

original: skyes bu gzhan gyi sems bzhin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de yang de 'dra ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / lus tha dad pa la gnas pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyi sems bzhin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de yang de 'dra ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / lus tha dad pa la gnas pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: The mind of another person is not connected to it. This is not a fault, because there is no contradiction in the connection of a mind of one kind and a body of another kind.

original: lus dag ni rang bzhin tha dad pa tsam gyis nying mtshams mi sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lus dag ni rang bzhin tha dad pa tsam gyis nying mtshams mi sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that bodies are not connected because they are merely different in nature.

original: sa bon dang myu gu dag rang bzhin tha dad kyang mtshams sbyor ba'i @51b phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dag rang bzhin tha dad kyang mtshams sbyor ba'i @51b phyir ro //
translated: Seeds and sprouts are different in nature, but they are connected.

original: de bas na rgyud tha dad pa'i lus la gnas pa can nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba de yang grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rgyud tha dad pa'i lus la gnas pa can nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba de yang grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not established that the mind that is located in a body of a different continuum does not link with that body.

original: skye ba thams cad la skye mched lnga'i khyad par rnams ni sems can du btags pa gcig gi rten nyid yin pas du ma la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad la skye mched lnga'i khyad par rnams ni sems can du btags pa gcig gi rten nyid yin pas du ma la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the particularities of the five aggregates in all births are the very basis of a single designation as a sentient being, they do not engage many.

original: gnas skabs so so tha dad pas tha dad pa'i lus la gnas pa nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs so so tha dad pas tha dad pa'i lus la gnas pa nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not indefinite because the mind that is located in a different body that is different due to its different states links with that body.

original: lus la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no //
translated: It is not established because the mind that is located in a body is refuted.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de'i rten gyis bskyed pa yang skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de'i rten gyis bskyed pa yang skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that there is a fault in generating the sense consciousnesses by the support.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni rten pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni rten pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Because they are not the nature of a support.

original: sems dang sems las 'byung ba dag ni yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las 'byung ba dag ni yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind and mental factors do not abide in the object.

original: de las skye ba yang gnas pa yin na skyes bu gzhan gyi lus yul du 'gyur ba las kyang skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las skye ba yang gnas pa yin na skyes bu gzhan gyi lus yul du 'gyur ba las kyang skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If birth were the same as abiding, then the body of another person would be the object of birth.

original: de la gnas pa'i sems ni gzhan la mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems ni gzhan la mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The mind that abides in the body is uncertain, because it is connected to another body.

original: gal te dbang po 'gyur ba na 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po dang 'dra bar lus la gnas pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po 'gyur ba na 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po dang 'dra bar lus la gnas pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the mind does not abide in the body, because it changes when the sense faculties change, like the sense faculties, that is not so.üîΩBecause the appearance of the mind is different due to the change of the object, this is not a valid reason.

original: yul gyi 'gyur bas kyang snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'di gtan tshigs ma yin no sgrub par byed pa yang lus rten yin pa la gsal ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yul gyi 'gyur bas kyang snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'di gtan tshigs ma yin no sgrub par byed pa yang lus rten yin pa la gsal ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa de ltar na /
translated: The proof is that the body is the support, as has been explained by Ghosaka and others.

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun grub pa de ltar na snying rje la sogs pa'i yid kyi yon tan rnams goms pa yod pa dang / shin tu goms pa yod pa na de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun grub pa de ltar na snying rje la sogs pa'i yid kyi yon tan rnams goms pa yod pa dang / shin tu goms pa yod pa na de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when the stream of birth and death is established, when there is cultivation of mental qualities such as compassion, and when there is complete cultivation, there is no contradiction in their becoming the nature of the mind.

original: sbyor ba ni yid kyi yon tan gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu goms pa yod na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni yid kyi yon tan gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu goms pa yod na /
translated: The application is that when those mental qualities are well cultivated,

original: skyes bu shin tu de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu shin tu de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: they become the very nature of the person who has attained them.

original: dper na gcang sbra can thod pa can du gyur pa na yid 'byung ba med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gcang sbra can thod pa can du gyur pa na yid 'byung ba med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the ascetic who has become a skull-bearer, for whom there is no disgust.

original: snying rje chen pos ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can yang yid kyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can yang yid kyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And great compassion, which has the characteristics explained above, is also a mental quality. This is a natural inference.

original: gang dang gang yid kyi yon tan goms pa las khyad par can du 'gyur ba de ni rim bzhin du shin tu goms pa las skyes bu de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang yid kyi yon tan goms pa las khyad par can du 'gyur ba de ni rim bzhin du shin tu goms pa las skyes bu de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever mental quality is cultivated becomes special, and in due course, through well-cultivating it, it becomes the very nature of that person.

original: dper na gtsang sbras spyod pa thod pa can de nyid yid 'byung ba med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gtsang sbras spyod pa thod pa can de nyid yid 'byung ba med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the ascetic who practices with a skull-cup, for whom there is no disgust.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi snying rje chen po yang goms pa las khyad par can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi snying rje chen po yang goms pa las khyad par can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The great compassion of beings is also distinctive due to cultivation. This is a natural inference.

original: gal te goms pas zhes bya ba la sogs @52a * //
analyzed: gal te goms pas zhes bya ba la sogs @52a * //
translated: If it is due to cultivation, etc.

original: bas ma nges pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: bas ma nges pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: is a response to the doubt that this is indeterminate.

original: goms pas khyad par yod pa yin na yang rang bzhin las 'das te /
analyzed: goms pas khyad par yod pa yin na yang rang bzhin las 'das te /
translated: Even if there is a distinction due to cultivation, it does not transcend its nature.

original: rigs mi mthun las 'das pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can snying rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba min no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun las 'das pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can snying rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba min no //
translated: It does not become the nature of compassion, etc., which is characterized by engagement by its own accord, transcending dissimilar types.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhen mchongs bzhin te /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhen mchongs bzhin te /
translated: What is it like? Like jumping.

original: dper na shin tu legs par goms par byas pa can gyi skyes bu mchongs pa na /
analyzed: dper na shin tu legs par goms par byas pa can gyi skyes bu mchongs pa na /
translated: For example, when a person who is very well trained in jumping jumps,

original: yul cung zad cig gnon par byed kyi /üîΩdpag tshad dam rgyang grags phyed dam /
analyzed: yul cung zad cig gnon par byed kyi / dpag tshad dam rgyang grags phyed dam /
translated: he covers a little distance.üîΩIt is not a league or half a krosa,

original: rgyang grags sam lhag pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags sam lhag pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: a krosa, or more.

original: chu'i dro bzhin du ste chu'i dro ba ches shin tu gyur pa na yang dus yun ring po nas kyang 'bar ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu'i dro bzhin du ste chu'i dro ba ches shin tu gyur pa na yang dus yun ring po nas kyang 'bar ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just like the heat of water, when the heat of water is greatly transformed, it does not become fire even after a long time.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin las ma 'das pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin las ma 'das pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, because it does not transcend its intrinsic nature, it is uncertain.üîΩIf it is produced by that, etc.

original: gal te des byas pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i sgo nas ma nges pa'i lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: gal te des byas pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i sgo nas ma nges pa'i lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: He replies to the uncertainty by teaching a reason that has a distinction.

original: gal te goms pa gang yin pa 'ga' zhig gis gang 'ga' zhig la khyad par gang yin pa de byas pa na yang yang bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te goms pa gang yin pa 'ga' zhig gis gang 'ga' zhig la khyad par gang yin pa de byas pa na yang yang bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If a certain person produces a certain distinction by some practice, then it must be done again and again.

original: 'bad rtsol la yang ltos yin te //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la yang ltos yin te //
translated: Therefore, it also depends on effort.

original: dper na mchongs pa nyid sngar 'bad rtsol las thob pa yang 'bad rtsol las ltos pa med par skyes bu rang gi ngang gis mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mchongs pa nyid sngar 'bad rtsol las thob pa yang 'bad rtsol las ltos pa med par skyes bu rang gi ngang gis mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even though jumping is obtained from effort in the beginning, a person does not naturally jump without depending on effort.

original: dper na chu'i dro ba nyid mes skyed par byed pa de la ltos pa med pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu'i dro ba nyid mes skyed par byed pa de la ltos pa med pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the heat of water is not independent of the fire that generates it.

original: gal te khyad par te brtan min rten can 'gyur dper na chu'i dro ba nyid thob par gyur pa'i rang bzhin zad pa nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par te brtan min rten can 'gyur dper na chu'i dro ba nyid thob par gyur pa'i rang bzhin zad pa nyid lta bu'o //
translated: If the difference, i.e., the impermanent, were dependent, like the heat of water, then the nature of exhaustion would be obtained.

original: de'i tshe phyi ma'i khyad par nyid ni mi 'phel na /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi ma'i khyad par nyid ni mi 'phel na /
translated: If at that time the difference of the latter is not increased,

original: rnam par gnas pa nyid 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa nyid 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the increase of the abiding would be increased. This is the meaning.

original: rang bzhin dag ni de 'dra min //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni de 'dra min //
translated: The natures are not like that.

original: gang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not operate by its own nature,

original: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, desire, etc.

original: gang zhig yang bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol la ltos pa ji ltar du bshad pa'i phul du 'byung ba rnam par gnas pa 'phel ba can /
analyzed: gang zhig yang bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol la ltos pa ji ltar du bshad pa'i phul du 'byung ba rnam par gnas pa 'phel ba can /
translated: That which is dependent on effort for the sake of action, as explained, has the increase of the abiding of the highest.

original: de sbyor nus can te /
analyzed: de sbyor nus can te /
translated: That is able to apply.

original: sngar byas pa'i phul du byung ba skyed pa nyid la nus pa zad pa can gyi /
analyzed: sngar byas pa'i phul du byung ba skyed pa nyid la nus pa zad pa can gyi /
translated: The exhaustion of the ability to generate the highest that was previously done,

original: sgrub byed rnams nus pa med pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub byed rnams nus pa med pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: because the proofs are ineffective.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With regard to what?

original: khyad par phyi ma dag la ni ste khyad par phyi ma phul du byung ba byed pa la nus pa med pa nyid @52b kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par phyi ma dag la ni ste khyad par phyi ma phul du byung ba byed pa la nus pa med pa nyid @52b kyi phyir ro //
translated: With regard to the subsequent distinctions, because they are ineffective in producing the subsequent, superior distinctions.

original: rtag tu rten rnams med phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rten rnams med phyir ro //
translated: Because the bases are always absent.

original: mi brtan pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of instability.

original: sngar 'byung ba de'i khyad par 'phel ba yin na'ang cung zhig tsam 'phel ba yin na yang rang bzhin min phyir te de nyid rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de yang 'bad rtsol gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar 'byung ba de'i khyad par 'phel ba yin na'ang cung zhig tsam 'phel ba yin na yang rang bzhin min phyir te de nyid rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de yang 'bad rtsol gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Even if there is a slight increase in the development of that which occurs previously, it is not natural, because that very thing does not occur by its very nature, and so it must be accomplished by effort.

original: dper na mchongs pa dang chu dro ba nyid ces bya ba de 'dra ba'i phul du byung ba shin tu 'phel ba med pa lta bu'o //üîΩgang gi tshe /
analyzed: dper na mchongs pa dang chu dro ba nyid ces bya ba de 'dra ba'i phul du byung ba shin tu 'phel ba med pa lta bu'o // gang gi tshe /
translated: For example, it is like jumping and the heat of water. Such a superior development does not exist.üîΩWhen

original: 'ga' zhig byas pa yin na ste //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig byas pa yin na ste //
translated: if something is done.

original: phul du byung ba byas pa yin na 'jug pa'i phyir yang 'bad rtsol la ltos mi 'gyur /
analyzed: phul du byung ba byas pa yin na 'jug pa'i phyir yang 'bad rtsol la ltos mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is a superior action, it is engaged in without regard to effort.

original: de'i tshe yang phul du byung ba bsgrubs pa de las phyis kyi gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang phul du byung ba bsgrubs pa de las phyis kyi gang yin pa de ni /
translated: At that time, whatever it is that is later than the accomplishment of the superior action,

original: rtsol gzhan khyad par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsol gzhan khyad par byed par 'gyur //
translated: that is a different effort, which makes a difference.

original: phyi ma la nus pa mi byed pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la nus pa mi byed pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be able to function later.

original: rten brtan pa nyid du gyur pa na khyad par phyi ma byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten brtan pa nyid du gyur pa na khyad par phyi ma byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the support becomes stable, it makes a later difference.

original: de lta ma yin na 'phags pa nyan thos rgyud rgyun chad par can rnams de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'phags pa nyan thos rgyud rgyun chad par can rnams de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin /
translated: Otherwise, what is it that is the nature of the noble disciples who have interrupted their continuum?

original: 'jig rten la phan par bshad pa rnams ni rgyud rgyun bcad pas kyang rten mi brtan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten la phan par bshad pa rnams ni rgyud rgyun bcad pas kyang rten mi brtan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The explanations of benefit in the world are not unstable supports even when the continuum is interrupted.

original: dus gcig gi tshe 'ga' zhig brtse ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi spyor ba thob nas yang sbyor ba la ltos pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe 'ga' zhig brtse ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi spyor ba thob nas yang sbyor ba la ltos pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
translated: At one time, having obtained the practice of a special compassion, etc., it is not engaged in again with regard to practice.

original: 'on kyang khyad par thob pa gang yin pa de ni 'bad rtsol med par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par thob pa gang yin pa de ni 'bad rtsol med par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: But whatever is attained by special effort is entered into without effort.üîΩFor example:

original: dper na / sems la brtse sogs goms skyes pa //
analyzed: dper na / sems la brtse sogs goms skyes pa //
translated: Compassion, etc. arise from cultivation,

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug 'gyur ro //
translated: and they enter into their objects spontaneously.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni dga' ba dang btang snyoms la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni dga' ba dang btang snyoms la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes joy and equanimity.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?üîΩLike fire, etc. with regard to wood,

original: me la sogs pa shing dag dang // dngul chu dang ni gser sogs bzhin //
analyzed: me la sogs pa shing dag dang // dngul chu dang ni gser sogs bzhin //
translated: and like mercury, etc. with regard to gold.

original: dper na mes shing la byas pa'i tshos pa las byung ba'i yon tan ji tsam pa can gang yin pa de dang de yang de'i ngo bo'i phyir me la ltos pa med pa de lta bu de ni gags byed pa med na /
analyzed: dper na mes shing la byas pa'i tshos pa las byung ba'i yon tan ji tsam pa can gang yin pa de dang de yang de'i ngo bo'i phyir me la ltos pa med pa de lta bu de ni gags byed pa med na /
translated: For example, whatever is the quality that arises from the burning of wood by fire, that is not dependent on fire, because it has the nature of that.

original: thams cad thal bar gyur gyi bar du phyi ma phyi ma lhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad thal bar gyur gyi bar du phyi ma phyi ma lhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that, when there is no obstruction, causes the later moments to arise with a greater and greater excess, until everything is reduced to ashes.

original: yang dper na kha sbyar du bzhu ba la sogs pas gser rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang ba'i yon tan de ni kha sbyar gnyis pa bzhu ba la ltos pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dper na kha sbyar du bzhu ba la sogs pas gser rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang ba'i yon tan de ni kha sbyar gnyis pa bzhu ba la ltos pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: Again, for example, the quality of purification, which has the characteristic of pure gold, by melting it in a crucible, does not depend on melting it in a second crucible.

original: dper na kha sbyar du bzhu ba phyi ma phyi ma ni gzhan dang gzhan gyi byed pa yin pas na /üîΩrim bzhin du sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par sbyang ba'i @53a * //
analyzed: dper na kha sbyar du bzhu ba phyi ma phyi ma ni gzhan dang gzhan gyi byed pa yin pas na / rim bzhin du sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par sbyang ba'i @53a * //
translated: For example, the later melting in a crucible is the action of another,

original: mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: and so it is applied in sequence. This is the culmination of purification.

original: de bzhin du dngul chu'i yang sbyor ba dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i bar du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngul chu'i yang sbyor ba dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i bar du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the culmination of mercury is the holding of the union, practice, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni de lta bu'i rigs can zangs ma la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni de lta bu'i rigs can zangs ma la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The mention of etc. should be understood to include other types such as copper.

original: 'dis ni dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the example.

original: gang gi phyir brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa las skyes shing 'byung ba yon tan yang sbyor ba la ltos pa can ma yin pa dang / rten brtan pa can yin pa de'i phyir de'i rnams skyes yon tan de ni rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa las skyes shing 'byung ba yon tan yang sbyor ba la ltos pa can ma yin pa dang / rten brtan pa can yin pa de'i phyir de'i rnams skyes yon tan de ni rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Because the qualities that arise from the practice of love and so on are not dependent on application and are based on a stable support, therefore, those qualities that arise from practice become their nature.

original: 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: Even when they engage their object spontaneously without depending on effort,üîΩthe later and later efforts

original: de las 'bad rtsol phyi ma dang // phyi ma khyad par byed pa yin //
analyzed: de las 'bad rtsol phyi ma dang // phyi ma khyad par byed pa yin //
translated: make a difference.

original: 'bad rtsol snga ma snga ma las 'bad rtsol phyi ma phyi ma'i sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol snga ma snga ma las 'bad rtsol phyi ma phyi ma'i sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The later and later applications that arise from the earlier and earlier efforts

original: khyad par phyi ma phyi ma mthar phyin pa'i bar du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par phyi ma phyi ma mthar phyin pa'i bar du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: do not make a difference until the later and later perfections are completed.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig brtan pa'i rten can gyi chos yin pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig brtan pa'i rten can gyi chos yin pa /
translated: Application is the quality that is based on a stable support.

original: dang / gang la ji lta ba bzhin du skyes pa yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med pa ni goms pa las shin tu mthar thug par 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: dang / gang la ji lta ba bzhin du skyes pa yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med pa ni goms pa las shin tu mthar thug par 'gro ba yin te /
translated: And that which arises in accordance with the object, without depending on effort, is carried to the highest degree through cultivation.

original: dper na shing la sogs pa la chos pa las skyes pa'i gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing la sogs pa la chos pa las skyes pa'i gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the form, etc., that arises from the seed, etc.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi snying rje chen po shin tu goms pa yod pa can yang brtan pa'i rten can yin pa dang / khyad par skyes pa la yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med par yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi snying rje chen po shin tu goms pa yod pa can yang brtan pa'i rten can yin pa dang / khyad par skyes pa la yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med par yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the great compassion of beings, which is possessed by those who have cultivated it, has a stable basis and, even when it has arisen, exists without depending on effort. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Since it is thus qualified, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: gang phyir brtse ba la sogs blo //
analyzed: gang phyir brtse ba la sogs blo //
translated: Because the mind of love, etc.,

original: rigs mtshungs sa bon snga ma las 'phel ba can te /
analyzed: rigs mtshungs sa bon snga ma las 'phel ba can te /
translated: is increased from a previous seed of a similar type,

original: brtse ba la sogs pa gang la rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu las 'phel zhing khyad par du gyur pa yod pa ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa gang la rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu las 'phel zhing khyad par du gyur pa yod pa ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has arisen from a cause of a similar type‚Äù is to be supplied in the above statement.

original: gang gi phyir rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon snga ma snga ma goms pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu la ltos nas brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo rgyu tshogs pa yod na 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon snga ma snga ma goms pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu la ltos nas brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo rgyu tshogs pa yod na 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúwhen the collection of causes is present, the cognition of love, etc., is obtained‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: ji ltar de 'dra ba'i brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo de dag ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de 'dra ba'i brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo de dag ni /
translated: How is it that those cognitions of love, etc.,

original: goms yod yin na gnas gang las //üîΩkhyad par du rnam par gnas pa can te /
analyzed: goms yod yin na gnas gang las // khyad par du rnam par gnas pa can te /
translated: are present in a certain place?üîΩThey are present in a place that is distinguished by the presence of the repeated practice of the seeds of a similar type.

original: shin tu 'phel ba nyid ces @53b bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu 'phel ba nyid ces @53b bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is distinguished‚Äù means ‚Äúthat is greatly increased.‚Äù

original: des ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: des ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: This is the result of valid knowledge.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon snga ma las 'phel ba can yin pa de dag ni gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid can nam rgyu mtshang ba'i bar chad med na shin tu 'phel ba'i chos can nam 'phel ba tshad nges pa can ma yin
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon snga ma las 'phel ba can yin pa de dag ni gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid can nam rgyu mtshang ba'i bar chad med na shin tu 'phel ba'i chos can nam 'phel ba tshad nges pa can ma yin
translated: The application is that which increases from the previous seed of a similar type. If there is no obstacle that has the characteristic of an obstruction, then it is a phenomenon that increases greatly or increases to a definite extent.

original: te / dper na 'bru la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: te / dper na 'bru la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a grain of rice and so on.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa yang rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon las 'phel ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa yang rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon las 'phel ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Also, love and so on increase from a seed of a similar type. This is a natural inference.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs so //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs so //
translated: With regard to the second probandum, there is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa las rnam par bzlog pas ni mchongs pa la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba'i 'phel ba med pa'i rgyun 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa las rnam par bzlog pas ni mchongs pa la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba'i 'phel ba med pa'i rgyun 'chad pa yin no //
translated: In the explanation beginning with ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù the reversal is the interruption of the increase of the supreme, such as jumping and so on.

original: ji ltar brtse ba la sogs pa snga ma snga ma la brten nas brtse ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma 'gyur ba /
analyzed: ji ltar brtse ba la sogs pa snga ma snga ma la brten nas brtse ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma 'gyur ba /
translated: Compassion and so on arise in dependence on previous compassion and so on.

original: de ltar mchongs nyid las mchongs min no //
analyzed: de ltar mchongs nyid las mchongs min no //
translated: But jumping does not arise in dependence on previous jumping.

original: 'on ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is the cause of jumping?

original: lus kyi stobs dang / 'bad rtsol dag las yin zhing /
analyzed: lus kyi stobs dang / 'bad rtsol dag las yin zhing /
translated: It is the strength and exertion of the body.

original: de dag kyang nus pa nges pa can yin la /üîΩde rgyu stobs dang 'bad rtsol gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang nus pa nges pa can yin la / de rgyu stobs dang 'bad rtsol gyi /
translated: And these are definite in their capacity.üîΩThe capacity of these is definite because of the cause, the strength and exertion.

original: de dag gi nus pa nges pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu mchongs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi 'phel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi nus pa nges pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu mchongs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi 'phel ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the result, jumping, is definite in its nature, but it does not increase.

original: gal te stobs dang 'bad rtsol dag las mchongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te stobs dang 'bad rtsol dag las mchongs pa yin gyi /
translated: If jumping arises from strength and exertion,

original: rang gi rigs las 'jug pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rigs las 'jug pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: it does not arise from its own type.

original: 'di ltar goms pa'i dus phyis skyes bu'i sa ji tsam chod pa can gyi mchongs pa yin pa de ltar sngar yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa'i dus phyis skyes bu'i sa ji tsam chod pa can gyi mchongs pa yin pa de ltar sngar yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that when a person jumps a long distance after training, he does not jump that far at first?

original: de ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu'o //
translated: That is due to the person.

original: dang por ni goms pa las sngar ro //
analyzed: dang por ni goms pa las sngar ro //
translated: At first, before training, he jumps a short distance.

original: phyis bzhin du mchongs min te bad kan la sogs pa lus mi mthun phyir te /
analyzed: phyis bzhin du mchongs min te bad kan la sogs pa lus mi mthun phyir te /
translated: But later, it is not the case that one jumps, because the body is not the same, because of phlegm, etc.

original: lci ba nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lci ba nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the cause of heaviness.

original: phyis kyang rtsol bas rim gyis mi mthun pa bsal na lus lci ba med ba na lus kyi rang stobs nges pa yin /
analyzed: phyis kyang rtsol bas rim gyis mi mthun pa bsal na lus lci ba med ba na lus kyi rang stobs nges pa yin /
translated: But later, if one gradually removes the unfitness by effort, then, when the body is not heavy, the body‚Äôs own power is certain.

original: ji srid bgrod par bya ba nyid yin par phyin pa yin gyi /üîΩlhag par ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji srid bgrod par bya ba nyid yin par phyin pa yin gyi / lhag par ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: As long as one is going, one is going,üîΩbut not going beyond.

original: 'di las ring du song ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba yong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las ring du song ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba yong pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that there is a fault in saying that one is not going beyond this.

original: yid kyi yon tan gom sa pa yod na de'i bdag nyid du yod par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi yon tan gom sa pa yod na de'i bdag nyid du yod par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: If there is a quality of the mind, it is to be established as existing in the nature of that.

original: skyes bu thams cad brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa la sbyor ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa la sbyor ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that all men are engaged in the practice of cultivating compassion, etc.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩbrtse rang sa @54a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / brtse rang sa @54a * //
translated: What then is it?

original: bon las byung can //
analyzed: bon las byung can //
translated: Compassion arises from its own seed.

original: gal te mi mthun phyogs kyis te brtse ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i chos can dag gis so //
analyzed: gal te mi mthun phyogs kyis te brtse ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i chos can dag gis so //
translated: If it is by the opposite, i.e., by the qualities that are incompatible with compassion, etc.,

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of compassion?

original: rang sa bon 'byung can no //
analyzed: rang sa bon 'byung can no //
translated: That which is based on one‚Äôs own seed.

original: gang la rang gi sa bon gyis rab tu phye ba'i skye ba yod ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
