analyzed: gang la rang gi sa bon gyis rab tu phye ba'i skye ba yod ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has the arising that is distinguished by one‚Äôs own seed‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de dag gis snying rje la gnod pa med pa de'i tshe de yang dang yang goms pa na sems la de bdag nyid thob 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis snying rje la gnod pa med pa de'i tshe de yang dang yang goms pa na sems la de bdag nyid thob 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is not harmed by compassion, then, as one repeatedly cultivates it, one‚Äôs mind becomes imbued with that nature.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does it become so?

original: de ltar snying rje la sogs pa goms pa snga ma dang / snga ma rtsa ba yin te rgyu yin no //üîΩgang gi zhen brtse ba dang chags bral blo sogs gzhan dag gi ste /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje la sogs pa goms pa snga ma dang / snga ma rtsa ba yin te rgyu yin no // gang gi zhen brtse ba dang chags bral blo sogs gzhan dag gi ste /
translated: Because the previous cultivation of compassion, etc., is the root, i.e., the cause, of the later cultivation.

original: khyad par can gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The mind of the one who is compassionate, etc., is distinguished from the mind of the one who is not compassionate, etc.üîΩThe mind of the one who is compassionate, etc., is distinguished from the mind of the one who is not compassionate, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni yid kyi yon tan gzhan yang bzung ngo //üîΩbrtse ba la sogs pa ci 'dra pa zhig gi zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni yid kyi yon tan gzhan yang bzung ngo // brtse ba la sogs pa ci 'dra pa zhig gi zhe na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes other mental qualities.üîΩWhat kind of compassion, etc.?

original: sems chos kyi'o //
analyzed: sems chos kyi'o //
translated: The compassion, etc., of one who is devoted to the Dharma.

original: de la yang yid kyi chos snga ma snga ma goms pas byas pa 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med pa can phyis kyi brtse ba la sogs pa skye ba tsam gyi rgyu ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bsal ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: de la yang yid kyi chos snga ma snga ma goms pas byas pa 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med pa can phyis kyi brtse ba la sogs pa skye ba tsam gyi rgyu ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bsal ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the prior mental phenomena are not the cause of the mere arising of later affection, etc., which is independent of effort, since it is produced by the cultivation of prior mental phenomena.

original: khyad par phyi ma phyi ma byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par phyi ma phyi ma byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is the root of the manifestation, and it is the cause of the production of later and later distinctions.

original: sbyor ba yang sngar thob pa'i khyad par 'bad rtsol med par 'jug pa yod pa de'i gnas skabs can gyi yid kyi chos goms pa gang yin pa de yang de las khyad par lhag par byed pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang sngar thob pa'i khyad par 'bad rtsol med par 'jug pa yod pa de'i gnas skabs can gyi yid kyi chos goms pa gang yin pa de yang de las khyad par lhag par byed pa can yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cultivation of mental phenomena in that state, which is the effortless engagement in the distinction attained earlier, is also that which produces the superior distinction from that.

original: dper na sngar byas pa'i yid kyi chos kyi khyad par goms pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngar byas pa'i yid kyi chos kyi khyad par goms pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the cultivation of the distinction of mental phenomena that was previously produced.

original: brtse ba la gzhan dag kyang ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa'i khyad par 'bad rtsol med par 'jug pa yod pa de'i gnas skabs can gyi yid kyi chos de goms pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: brtse ba la gzhan dag kyang ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa'i khyad par 'bad rtsol med par 'jug pa yod pa de'i gnas skabs can gyi yid kyi chos de goms pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: de de ltar na ji lta bu bshad pa'i /
analyzed: de de ltar na ji lta bu bshad pa'i /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, as explained,üîΩthrough practice, becomes the very embodiment of love,

original: goms las brtse ba'i bdag nyid de shin tu sems can sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab bar byed pa bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: goms las brtse ba'i bdag nyid de shin tu sems can sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab bar byed pa bzhed pa ste /
translated: and is intent on protecting sentient beings from suffering.

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs brnyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs brnyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the attainment of the state of the cause.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: chags bral chags dang mi gtsang bzhin //
analyzed: chags bral chags dang mi gtsang bzhin //
translated: Like the dispassion of the liberated and like the impurity meditation.

original: dper na grol ba rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chags pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid thob pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grol ba rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chags pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid thob pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the attainment of the nature of the dispassion of the liberated, which is characterized by the absence of disgust and the absence of attachment toward the happiness and suffering of sentient beings.

original: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa ches shin tu goms pa can gyi 'dod chags la sogs par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de @54b bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa ches shin tu goms pa can gyi 'dod chags la sogs par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de @54b bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the natural engagement in desire, etc. of one who is very much habituated to desire, etc.

original: dper na mi gtsang ba la spod pa'i mtshan nyid can mi gtsang ba de goms pa can la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de dang 'dra bar brtse bas yang goms pa las rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang ba la spod pa'i mtshan nyid can mi gtsang ba de goms pa can la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de dang 'dra bar brtse bas yang goms pa las rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like the natural engagement in impurity of one who is habituated to the characteristics of impurity.

original: sgrub byed thugs rje goms pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sgrub byed thugs rje goms pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The proof of the statement that the Bodhisattva is compassionate by nature is from the line, ‚ÄúBecause of the cultivation of compassion,‚Äù up to

original: chags bral chags dang mi gtsang bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni 'gro la phan par bzhed pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chags bral chags dang mi gtsang bzhin // zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni 'gro la phan par bzhed pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike one free from desire and like one disgusted with impurity.‚ÄùüîΩThis explains the statement that he is compassionate by nature.

original: brtse ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa nyid 'chad par byed de brtse ldan te /
analyzed: brtse ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa nyid 'chad par byed de brtse ldan te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe Teacher himself has said that the compassionate one,‚Äù etc. explains the statement that the Bodhisattva is compassionate by nature.

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i ngang tshul can gyi brtse bas byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa brtse pa la goms par gyur pas de dag gi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar don du gnyer ba can nyid kyi
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i ngang tshul can gyi brtse bas byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa brtse pa la goms par gyur pas de dag gi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar don du gnyer ba can nyid kyi
translated: The love that has the nature of existing at the time of the cause, the bodhisattva who is pained by the suffering of other sentient beings, through being accustomed to that compassion,

original: sdug bsngal spang phyir de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad /
analyzed: sdug bsngal spang phyir de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad /
translated: is one who strives to completely pacify their suffering.

original: nyid nyid kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgal te ba rtse ba dang ldan pa sems can gyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs nyid /
analyzed: nyid nyid kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te ba rtse ba dang ldan pa sems can gyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs nyid /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhe realizes the path that is concordant with the pacification of his own suffering‚Äù is that he is one who applies himself to the methods for completely pacifying suffering.

original: sems can rnams la ston par mdzad pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: sems can rnams la ston par mdzad pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the one who possesses love teaches sentient beings the method for completely pacifying their suffering,

original: ci'i phyir skabs su ma bab pa ston ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skabs su ma bab pa ston ce na /
translated: why does he teach what is not relevant?

original: de ni skabs su ma bab pa ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni skabs su ma bab pa ston pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not teach what is not relevant.

original: nyid nyid kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs rtsom pa gang yin pa 'di nyid gzhan gyi don dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid nyid kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs rtsom pa gang yin pa 'di nyid gzhan gyi don dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: This very composition of the means for the pacification of one‚Äôs own suffering is in accord with the welfare of others.

original: de lta yin na thabs kyi don gang yin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa nan tan du byas pa las de'i thabs las byung ba'i don de gdul bya de dag gis thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na thabs kyi don gang yin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa nan tan du byas pa las de'i thabs las byung ba'i don de gdul bya de dag gis thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then whatever is the purpose of the means, whatever is its cause, by the practice of that, the purpose that arises from the means will be attained by those disciples.

original: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i skyes bu gang la thabs las byung ba dang de'i rgyu de dang de lkog tu gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i skyes bu gang la thabs las byung ba dang de'i rgyu de dang de lkog tu gyur pa de ni /
translated: The person who engages in the welfare of others, for whom the means and its cause are hidden,

original: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur can no //
analyzed: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur can no //
translated: is one who has the hidden cause of the means.

original: sems can bstan par bya ba la de 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: sems can bstan par bya ba la de 'chad pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the sentient beings to be taught is as follows.

original: thabs las byung ba dang de'i rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan par mdzad pa dka' ba yin te lam mi shes pas phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir re zhig rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid sems can rnams la de nyid dang
analyzed: thabs las byung ba dang de'i rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan par mdzad pa dka' ba yin te lam mi shes pas phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir re zhig rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid sems can rnams la de nyid dang
translated: It is difficult to teach the means of attaining it and its cause without error, because those who do not know the path have no opportunity to be taught the unerring path.

original: de'i rgyu ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'chad par bzhed pas mngon sum du mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'chad par bzhed pas mngon sum du mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who is endowed with thought, wishing to explain to sentient beings just that and its cause as they are, makes them manifest.

original: sbyor ba ni gang @55a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang @55a * //
translated: What is the application?

original: rtog ba sngon du gtong ba can gzhan la gang thob bar byed pa'i thabs phyin ci log pa ston par bzhed pa de ni thob bar bya ba dang / de'i thabs nyid mngon sum du mdzad par bzhed pa yin te dper na 'bab stegs kyi phyir skyes bu chu bo rgal ba la phyin ci ma log par ston par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtog ba sngon du gtong ba can gzhan la gang thob bar byed pa'i thabs phyin ci log pa ston par bzhed pa de ni thob bar bya ba dang / de'i thabs nyid mngon sum du mdzad par bzhed pa yin te dper na 'bab stegs kyi phyir skyes bu chu bo rgal ba la phyin ci ma log par ston par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: One who wishes to teach the means of attaining something to another who is endowed with thought and error, wishes to make manifest just that which is to be attained and its means, just as one who wishes to teach without error a person who is crossing a river at a ford.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid can rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yang /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid can rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yang /
translated: One who is compassionate by nature and endowed with thoughtüîΩwishes to teach the means of attaining the unerring path to sentient beings who are endowed with thought and error.

original: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal log pa thob par byed pa dang de'i thabs phyin ci ma log par ston par bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal log pa thob par byed pa dang de'i thabs phyin ci ma log par ston par bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The meaning of the above verse is this: The Buddha is the teacher of the true Dharma, because he is the one who has attained the true cessation of suffering for sentient beings, and because he is the one who teaches the true method for attaining that. This is a natural inference.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa de'i sdug bsngal bcom pa'i phyir sbyor ba gang yin zhen /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa de'i sdug bsngal bcom pa'i phyir sbyor ba gang yin zhen /
translated: What is the application of the one who is compassionate, in order to destroy the suffering of others?

original: lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúBy scripture and reasoning.‚Äù

original: re zhig lus mang po de la dmigs nas des bstan pa'am /
analyzed: re zhig lus mang po de la dmigs nas des bstan pa'am /
translated: First, one observes the many bodies of sentient beings and analyzes the teachings or practices that are indicated by those bodies.

original: sgrub pa rnam par dpyod pa yin gyi rig pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar na lung smos pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam par dpyod pa yin gyi rig pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar na lung smos pa yin no //
translated: When one understands this through reasoning, one engages in the practice. This is how scripture is mentioned.

original: de ltar ma yin na gang las 'di rnam par dpyod pa nye bar mkho ba can nyid yin /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gang las 'di rnam par dpyod pa nye bar mkho ba can nyid yin /
translated: If it were not so, then what is the purpose of analyzing this?

original: rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa ste /
translated: One analyzes with reasoning.

original: rnam par tshol bas spang bar bya ba sdug bsngal de'i rgyu de rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par tshol bas spang bar bya ba sdug bsngal de'i rgyu de rtog par mdzad do //
translated: One imagines the cause of that suffering, which is to be abandoned through searching.

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal 'di'i rgyu ni gang yin /
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal 'di'i rgyu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the cause of this suffering which has the characteristic of birth?

original: gang nye bar bcom pa las 'di bsal bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang nye bar bcom pa las 'di bsal bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is to be eliminated by the complete destruction of that?

original: de de ltar na rgyu tsam yongs su dpyad pa las 'di rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur bar mkhyen nas rgyu bkag pas de'i 'bras bu bcom par nus so zhes bya bar thugs su chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na rgyu tsam yongs su dpyad pa las 'di rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur bar mkhyen nas rgyu bkag pas de'i 'bras bu bcom par nus so zhes bya bar thugs su chud pa yin no //
translated: Thus, knowing that this is not causeless, merely by investigating the cause, he understood that the result can be destroyed by the refutation of the cause.

original: de ltar ma yin na rgyu med pa can gyi rang dbang can bcom pa gang yin sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i ngo bo shes par bya la //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rgyu med pa can gyi rang dbang can bcom pa gang yin sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i ngo bo shes par bya la //
translated: If it were not so, then what is to be destroyed, which is independent and causeless, would be the essence of the cause of suffering.üîΩAnd that is impermanent, etc.

original: de ni mi rtag sogs ngo bo yang de las dus phyis ci 'di rtag pa yin nam 'on te ma yin rtag pan yid yin na rtag pa nyid la byed pa po nyid med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag sogs ngo bo yang de las dus phyis ci 'di rtag pa yin nam 'on te ma yin rtag pan yid yin na rtag pa nyid la byed pa po nyid med pa de ltar na /
translated: If it is permanent, then it is not a creator, because it is permanent.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gcad par mi nus pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gcad par mi nus pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because it is causeless, it would be impossible to destroy suffering.

original: brtag par byed pa po nyid yin na yang mtshang ba med pa can de'i 'bras bu rgyun chad pa med pa'i chos can yin pa de ltar na bsal bar nus pa ma yin no zhes brtag par mdzad do //
analyzed: brtag par byed pa po nyid yin na yang mtshang ba med pa can de'i 'bras bu rgyun chad pa med pa'i chos can yin pa de ltar na bsal bar nus pa ma yin no zhes brtag par mdzad do //
translated: But if it is the very agent of the investigation, then it is not possible to remove it, since it is the possessor of the quality of the uninterrupted continuity of its effect.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rgyu de'i mtshan nyid dang 'phel ba'i rgyu brtags pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rgyu de'i mtshan nyid dang 'phel ba'i rgyu brtags pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that the investigation of the characteristics of that cause and the cause of its increase is also to be done.

original: de yang @55b 'gal ba bsgrub pas de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang @55b 'gal ba bsgrub pas de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is to be removed because it is established as contradictory.

original: gang gis brtag ba mdzad ce na //
analyzed: gang gis brtag ba mdzad ce na //
translated: By whom is it investigated?

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyi khyad par gyis //
translated: By the distinctive characteristic of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de'i chos des 'ga' 'byung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gis rgyu'i rang bzhin ji ltar sdug bsngal cung zad 'di ni res 'ga' 'jug pa yin pa de ltar na rgyu med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de'i chos des 'ga' 'byung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gis rgyu'i rang bzhin ji ltar sdug bsngal cung zad 'di ni res 'ga' 'jug pa yin pa de ltar na rgyu med pa can ma yin te /
translated: By those things that are produced, etc., from that suffering, that is, by the distinctive characteristic of suffering, since this suffering sometimes occurs, it is not without a cause,

original: rtag tu yod pa dad med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa dad med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would always exist or not exist.

original: res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is sometimes,

original: rgyu res 'ga' ba yin no zhes rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyu res 'ga' ba yin no zhes rtog par mdzad do //
translated: The cause is intermittent.

original: spyor ba ni gang zhig res 'ga' ba yin pa de ni rgyu res 'ga' ba can yin te /
analyzed: spyor ba ni gang zhig res 'ga' ba yin pa de ni rgyu res 'ga' ba can yin te /
translated: The application is: Whatever is intermittent has an intermittent cause,

original: dper na myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, a sprout.

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par 'di yang res 'ga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par 'di yang res 'ga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This difference in suffering is also intermittent. This is a natural inference.

original: rtag pa nyid kyang 'di'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyang 'di'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: This application should be stated: Permanence is not a cause.

original: rgyu rtag pa nyid la yang res 'ga' nyid 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa nyid la yang res 'ga' nyid 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even in the case of a permanent cause, the occurrence of intermittent suffering and so on is not tenable.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa gzhan dag gis kyang rgyu yod pa dang / de'i rang bzhin yongs su brtag ba mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa gzhan dag gis kyang rgyu yod pa dang / de'i rang bzhin yongs su brtag ba mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, he examines the existence of a cause and its nature in other ways.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu dang de'i rang bzhin la brtag pa mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu dang de'i rang bzhin la brtag pa mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he examine the cause and its nature?

original: gang phyir de ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gnas pa /
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gnas pa /
translated: Because the cause of suffering is not permanent,

original: 'bras ldog gzigs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras ldog gzigs pa med phyir ro //
translated: because the seer of the cessation of the effect does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal bzlog par mdzad par bzhed pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzlog par mdzad par bzhed pas so //
translated: because he wishes to stop suffering.

original: gang ldog pa ma gzigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang ldog pa ma gzigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is not seen to stop?

original: 'bras bu'i'o // gang gis gang bsal bar 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang de'i rang bzhin shes pa med pas de med par ma byas par de bsal bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i'o // gang gis gang bsal bar 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang de'i rang bzhin shes pa med pas de med par ma byas par de bsal bar mi nus te /
translated: The result. One cannot stop that without stopping its cause and its intrinsic nature, because one does not know what it is that is to be stopped and what is its cause.

original: dper na 'od kyi rgyu sgron ma med bar ma byas pa'i 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'od kyi rgyu sgron ma med bar ma byas pa'i 'od lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one cannot stop light without stopping the lamp which is its cause.

original: sdug bsngal bzlog par 'dod pas de'i rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzlog par 'dod pas de'i rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to stop suffering must understand its cause.

original: sbyor ba ni rgyu bzlog pa med pa can gang yin pa de ni bzlog par bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rgyu bzlog pa med pa can gang yin pa de ni bzlog par bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument is this: that which has an unstopped cause cannot be stopped.

original: dper na rgyu ldog pa med pa can gyi nad lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu ldog pa med pa can gyi nad lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a disease which has an unstopped cause.

original: sdug bsngal yang rgyu ldog pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang rgyu ldog pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And suffering has an unstopped cause. This is the apprehension of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: gzhan yang gang gis gang bzlog pa 'dod pa des de'i rgyu dang rang bzhin shes nas de bzlog pa la 'bad rtsol byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gis gang bzlog pa 'dod pa des de'i rgyu dang rang bzhin shes nas de bzlog pa la 'bad rtsol byed pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, whoever wishes to stop something must know its cause and nature and then make an effort to stop it.

original: dper na skyes bus nad bzlog par bya ba 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bus nad bzlog par bya ba 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a person who wishes to stop a disease.

original: @56a * // grol bar 'dod pa 'di yang sdug bsngal zlog par byed par 'dod pa yin no zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: @56a * // grol bar 'dod pa 'di yang sdug bsngal zlog par byed par 'dod pa yin no zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This person who wishes to be liberated also wishes to stop suffering. This is a natural inference.

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal bzlog par 'dod pas de'i rgyu ldog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal bzlog par 'dod pas de'i rgyu ldog par bya ba yin no //
translated: Because one who wishes to stop suffering must stop its cause.üîΩOtherwise, one would not be able to stop suffering.üîΩTherefore,üîΩone should cultivate the antidote to that suffering.üîΩOne should cultivate the antidote to that suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de rgyu bcom phyir de yi ni //üîΩmi mthun phyogs la ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'ga' ba 'ang gang goms pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ldog pa yin no zhes brtag par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de rgyu bcom phyir de yi ni //üîΩmi mthun phyogs la ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'ga' ba 'ang gang goms pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ldog pa yin no zhes brtag par mdzad pa'o //
translated: One should cultivate the antidote to that suffering.üîΩOne should cultivate the antidote

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gang gi rgyu de med par byed pa yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gang gi rgyu de med par byed pa yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be necessary to investigate what the cause of the other is, and to eliminate that.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gis gang spang bar 'dod pa des de'i gnod pa can dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gis gang spang bar 'dod pa des de'i gnod pa can dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: The application is this: whoever wishes to eliminate something should investigate the adversary of that.

original: dper na nyes pa rnams 'khrugs pa spong bar 'dod pas nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sman dpyad par bya ba yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nyes pa rnams 'khrugs pa spong bar 'dod pas nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sman dpyad par bya ba yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one who wishes to eliminate the disturbance of faults should investigate the medicine which is the antidote to the faults.

original: grol bar 'dod pa 'di yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu spong bar 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i chos gang yin pa de yang gang las shes shing /
analyzed: grol bar 'dod pa 'di yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu spong bar 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i chos gang yin pa de yang gang las shes shing /
translated: And this one who wishes to be liberated wishes to eliminate the cause of suffering, is the natural reasoning.üîΩFrom what is known that which is the quality that is the adversary of the cause of suffering?

original: gang nan tan du byas pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ldog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang nan tan du byas pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ldog pa yin zhe na /
translated: And from what practice is the cause of suffering eliminated?

original: de'i mi mthun phyogs kyang nges par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun phyogs kyang nges par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The adversary of that is also ascertained, he says.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i chos kyang shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i chos kyang shes par 'gyur te /
translated: One also understands the Dharma that is incompatible with the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i ngo bo rtogs phyir ro //üîΩgang gis tshe 'di'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa de 'dra ba can yin no zhes sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin shes par 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i ngo bo rtogs phyir ro // gang gis tshe 'di'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa de 'dra ba can yin no zhes sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin shes par 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Because one has realized the nature of the cause of suffering.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i rnam par gnas pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bde blag du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i rnam par gnas pa'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bde blag du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one understands the nature of the cause of suffering, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is such and such an object of observation and aspect,‚Äù then one easily understands that which is incompatible with it, thinking, ‚ÄúThat which has a mode of being incompatible with that is its opposing side.‚Äù

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'di dang / de dang 'gal ba'i chos kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'di dang / de dang 'gal ba'i chos kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of suffering characterized by birth and what is the Dharma that is incompatible with it?üîΩIt is said:

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin byas pa'i //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin byas pa'i //
translated: Through the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so forth.

original: chags pa ste sred pa ni rgyu yin par sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: chags pa ste sred pa ni rgyu yin par sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Attachment, i.e., craving, is the cause. This was explained earlier.üîΩWhat is it like?

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: It is said:

original: bdag dang bdag gis 'dzin byas pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gis 'dzin byas pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Through the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du song ba can no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du song ba can no //
translated: It is preceded by the manifest clinging to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir @56b 'dus byas spyod yul can yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @56b 'dus byas spyod yul can yin te /
translated: Therefore, it has the conditioned as its domain.

original: sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba'i 'dus byas bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba la bdag gi'i rnam par mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba'i 'dus byas bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba la bdag gi'i rnam par mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit engages by the manifest clinging to ‚Äòmine‚Äô‚Äù is that it engages the conditioned that is suffering, which is devoid of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù in the aspect of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi de'i rgyu gnod pa can nyid ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi de'i rgyu gnod pa can nyid ni /
translated: The suffering that is its cause is harmful.

original: bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: bdag med mthong ba 'gal ba yin //
translated: It is contradictory to see selflessness.

original: dmigs pa dad rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dad rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object and the aspect are erroneous.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las rang bzhin phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las rang bzhin phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is the opposite of the nature of something is the counteragent to that.

original: til rlung gi rang bzhin las phyin ci log pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: til rlung gi rang bzhin las phyin ci log pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the nature of sesame is the opposite of wind.

original: bdag med pa mthong pa yang skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las rang bzhin phyin ci log pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong pa yang skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las rang bzhin phyin ci log pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The seeing of selflessness is also the cause of the suffering of birth, because it has a distorted nature. This is a natural inference.

original: ma grub ba yang ma yin te sngar bstan zin pa de nyid kyi phyir dang / da yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma grub ba yang ma yin te sngar bstan zin pa de nyid kyi phyir dang / da yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor is it unestablished, because it has already been taught above and will be taught again.

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'dus byas kyi yul can nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'dus byas kyi yul can nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cause of suffering is the object of the conditioned, and selflessness is contradictory.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that the object and aspect are distorted.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang las dmigs nga dang rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid yin pa ni de'i gnod ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang las dmigs nga dang rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid yin pa ni de'i gnod ba can yin te /
translated: And the application is that whatever is distorted in terms of object and aspect in relation to something is harmed by it.

original: dper na thag pa la sbrul gyi shes pa la rtogs par byed pa po'i yang brtags nas sbrul ma yin pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sbrul gyi shes pa la rtogs par byed pa po'i yang brtags nas sbrul ma yin pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in relation to the cognition of a rope as a snake, the cognition of it as not a snake is the eliminator.

original: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba yang bdag dang bdag gir mthong ba'i chags pa las dmigs pa dang rnam pa phyin ci log pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba yang bdag dang bdag gir mthong ba'i chags pa las dmigs pa dang rnam pa phyin ci log pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the vision of selflessness is the antidote to the attachment to the view of self and entities connected to the self, which is the error of the object and the aspect. This is a natural inference.üîΩThe cause of suffering is attachment, as explained above, up to the statement, ‚ÄúThe mind that is erroneous with respect to the cause of suffering.‚ÄùüîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThis vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i chags pa'i yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu phyin ci log blo ni zhes bya ba'i bar der bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i chags pa'i yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu phyin ci log blo ni zhes bya ba'i bar der bstan zin to //
translated: The vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba de yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug par mdzad pa 'di'i dus ring por yang rnam pa mang pos rnam pa du mar thabs goms pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba de yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug par mdzad pa 'di'i dus ring por yang rnam pa mang pos rnam pa du mar thabs goms pa /
translated: The vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs par goms par mdzad pa bdag med pa nyid mthong ba dang de mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la skyon dang yon tan dag ma lus pa /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs par goms par mdzad pa bdag med pa nyid mthong ba dang de mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la skyon dang yon tan dag ma lus pa /
translated: The vision of selflessness is the cause of the vision of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is the antidote to the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: rab tu gsal ba nyid 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba nyid 'gyur te /
translated: The vision of selflessness is the cause of the

original: ji srid du ma lus par thugs su chud pa med pa de srid du ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa dang ldan pa ma @57a * //
analyzed: ji srid du ma lus par thugs su chud pa med pa de srid du ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa dang ldan pa ma @57a * //
translated: As long as there is no complete understanding, there is no perfection of the Teacher.

original: yin pa de ltar na skyes bu chen po dag gis dus ring por goms par mdzad pa 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la shes rab dus ring por rnam pa mang pos rnam pa du mar goms par byed pa de ni de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yon tan dang skyon gsal bar 'gyur te dper na bzo dang las kyi gnas la mngon
analyzed: yin pa de ltar na skyes bu chen po dag gis dus ring por goms par mdzad pa 'bras bu med pa ma yin no // sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la shes rab dus ring por rnam pa mang pos rnam pa du mar goms par byed pa de ni de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yon tan dang skyon gsal bar 'gyur te dper na bzo dang las kyi gnas la mngon
translated: Thus, the long cultivation of the Great Beings is not without fruit.

original: par sbyor ba'i skyes bu shes rab can 'ga' zhig gi lta bu'o //
analyzed: par sbyor ba'i skyes bu shes rab can 'ga' zhig gi lta bu'o //
translated: Application is that by which one cultivates wisdom for a long time in many ways with regard to something, and the qualities and faults of that and its counteragents become clear, as in the case of a wise person who is engaged in a craft or occupation.üîΩThis is a natural inference.

original: grol bar bzhed pa 'dis kyang bdag med pa mthong ba dus ring por rnam pa mang po sa rnam pa du mar goms par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: grol bar bzhed pa 'dis kyang bdag med pa mthong ba dus ring por rnam pa mang po sa rnam pa du mar goms par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The assertion of liberation also shows that one cultivates the view of selflessness for a long time in many ways with many aspects.

original: de ltar goms pa las thugs kyang gsal ba'i rgyu'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i bag chags nyon mongs pas byas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid las su mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid can spangs pa ni'o //üîΩ'di ni bcom ldan 'das thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi /
analyzed: de ltar goms pa las thugs kyang gsal ba'i rgyu'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i bag chags nyon mongs pas byas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid las su mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid can spangs pa ni'o // 'di ni bcom ldan 'das thub chen gzhan don 'jug can gyi /
translated: Thus, because of the cause of the clarity of mind, the Buddha has eliminated the body, speech, and mind that are the characteristics of unserviceability, which are produced by the passions, the predispositions that are the cause of suffering.

original: bse ru sogs la sa khyad 'di yin //
analyzed: bse ru sogs la sa khyad 'di yin //
translated: This is the difference in the stages of the Muni, the Lord, who is engaged in the benefit of others.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The Sravakas and the Self-Buddhas also have eliminated the passions.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi bag chags mnga' ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi bag chags mnga' ba yin la /
translated: However, they have the residues of the passions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de yang lus bar ma mdzad pa de ltar na nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de yang lus bar ma mdzad pa de ltar na nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have eliminated even those residues. Thus, the difference between the Lord Buddhas and the Sravakas and Self-Buddhas is that the former are free from the passions and their residues.

original: de yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug par mdzad pa kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug par mdzad pa kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the Lord Buddhas are engaged in the benefit of others.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi skyon dang yon tan rnam par ma phye ba can ni gzhan dag la de dag yang dag par ston pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi skyon dang yon tan rnam par ma phye ba can ni gzhan dag la de dag yang dag par ston pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: He is not able to teach them to others, because he has not distinguished the faults and virtues of the adverse side and the side of the antidote.

original: gdon mi za bar 'dis ni de dag rnam par phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'dis ni de dag rnam par phye ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, he must distinguish them.

original: dus ring por rnam pa mang pos du mar goms pa khyad par du mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dus ring por rnam pa mang pos du mar goms pa khyad par du mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He has done so in many ways, for a long time, and with special effort.

original: de yang bag cha gas spong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bag cha gas spong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is the cause for the abandonment of the latent states.

original: gzhan don 'jug can gyi /
analyzed: gzhan don 'jug can gyi /
translated: He is engaged in the welfare of others.

original: khyad par 'di yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is the difference.

original: thabs goms pa 'di nyid gang yin pa de ni ston pa yin par 'dod /
analyzed: thabs goms pa 'di nyid gang yin pa de ni ston pa yin par 'dod /
translated: He is considered the teacher because of his mastery of the means.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i tshigs su bcad par ro //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i tshigs su bcad par ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse of salutation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde don phyir na ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de don phyir na ste /
translated: Why is he the teacher?üîΩBecause of his purpose.

original: de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir @57b ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir @57b ro //
translated: He is the cause of that.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cause is figuratively designated as the result.

original: nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas yang bstan pa'i dgos pa ni sems can rnams la ston par rung ba'i thabs su gyur pa nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i thabs las khyad pa can du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas yang bstan pa'i dgos pa ni sems can rnams la ston par rung ba'i thabs su gyur pa nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i thabs las khyad pa can du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of the teaching by way of the designation is to show that it is superior to other methods, since it is the method suitable for teaching sentient beings.

original: gnyis bo 'di yi rgyu ru bshad //
analyzed: gnyis bo 'di yi rgyu ru bshad //
translated: The cause of these two is explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje dang thabs goms pa rgyu yin no zhes rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje dang thabs goms pa rgyu yin no zhes rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The cause of the Bhagavat's compassion and skill in means is the perfection of cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grub pa dang po yod phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang po yod phyir ro //
translated: Because of the existence of the first establishment.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The essence of the result called Well-Gone is the perfection of one's own aim.

original: grub pa de'i 'di nyid rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa de'i 'di nyid rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is the cause of that establishment.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde gshegs bya ba 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde gshegs bya ba 'chad par byed do //
translated: Cause and so forth explain the activity of the Well-Gone.

original: de ltar na goms pa'i khyad par gyis bdag dang bdag gi la chags pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gog pa na bdag med pa nyid mthong pa goms pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i sdug bsngal phyi ma'i rgyu mi
analyzed: de ltar na goms pa'i khyad par gyis bdag dang bdag gi la chags pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gog pa na bdag med pa nyid mthong pa goms pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i sdug bsngal phyi ma'i rgyu mi
translated: Thus, when the cause of suffering, which is characterized by attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù is naturally stopped through the power of habituation, the cause of future suffering is stopped for one who abides in the state of habituation to seeing selflessness.üîΩ

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par ni spangs pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the special cultivation of the vision of selflessness, the cause of suffering, which is characterized by attachment to self and to what is other, is naturally stopped. The special characteristic of the non-arising of future suffering is abandoned.

original: yon tan gsum ni khyab par gsum mo //
analyzed: yon tan gsum ni khyab par gsum mo //
translated: The three excellences are the three pervasivenesses.

original: de ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is the state of the Sugata.

original: de bas na su'i sgra 'di legs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis tshegs chung ba'i don la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de bas na su'i sgra 'di legs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis tshegs chung ba'i don la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin na yang /
translated: Therefore, although the term ‚Äúwell-gone‚Äù is used in the sense of ‚Äúeasy to understand‚Äù and so on,

original: 'dir don rnam pa gsum gsal bar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir don rnam pa gsum gsal bar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: it is used here to clarify the three meanings.

original: don rnam pa gsum yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three meanings?

original: bsngags pa nyid dang / slar mi ldog pa nyid dang / ma lus pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsngags pa nyid dang / slar mi ldog pa nyid dang / ma lus pa nyid do //
translated: They are praiseworthiness, irreversibility, and totality.

original: bde bar gshegs pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bsngags pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don yang gang yin /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bsngags pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don yang gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúsugata‚Äù that is to be praised?

original: gang gis na de bsngags pa nyid dang slar mi ldog pa nyid dang / ma lus par gshegs pa nyid ces bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na de bsngags pa nyid dang slar mi ldog pa nyid dang / ma lus par gshegs pa nyid ces bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what is it taught that it is praise, that it is non-return, and that it is complete going?

original: bshad pa re zhig sdug bsngal rten min phyir bsngags pa yin 'jig rten na yang bde ba dang de'i rgyu la bsngags pa yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa re zhig sdug bsngal rten min phyir bsngags pa yin 'jig rten na yang bde ba dang de'i rgyu la bsngags pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúsugata‚Äù is as follows: First, it is praise because it is not a basis of suffering. In the world, happiness and its cause are praised.

original: de las bzlog pa sdug bsngal du gyur pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa sdug bsngal du gyur pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is suffering, which is contaminated.

original: de brten pa gang yin pa de ni bsngags par 'gro ba can du 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa de ni bdag med pa mthong @58a * //
analyzed: de brten pa gang yin pa de ni bsngags par 'gro ba can du 'gyur ba ma yin no // sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa de ni bdag med pa mthong @58a * //
translated: That which is based on that is not praiseworthy.

original: ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a basis of suffering, it is the cause for seeing selflessness.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa spangs pa can ni sred pa'i dbang gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rten du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa spangs pa can ni sred pa'i dbang gis zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rten du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: One who has abandoned attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is not a basis for suffering, which has the characteristic of being defiled by craving.

original: bdag tu lta ba ma spangs pa can gyis ni cung zad spangs su zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ma spangs pa can gyis ni cung zad spangs su zin kyang /
translated: One who has not abandoned the view of self, even though he has abandoned something,

original: bdag tu chags pas bdag tu yongs su bzung nas de mi 'dod pa nyid kyis rtogs pa cung zad cig spong bar byed kyi /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pas bdag tu yongs su bzung nas de mi 'dod pa nyid kyis rtogs pa cung zad cig spong bar byed kyi /
translated: because of attachment to self, he clings to self and abandons a little of what he has understood,

original: cig shos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the other.

original: bdag nyid du yang yongs su bzung ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid du yang yongs su bzung ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not cling to self.

original: sbyor ba yang gang gis bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / chags pa med pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal du gyur pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gi sred pa'i dbang gis rten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang gis bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / chags pa med pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal du gyur pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gi sred pa'i dbang gis rten pa ma yin te /
translated: And the application is this: One who is free from the view of self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù and from attachment is not a basis for suffering, which is defiled by the power of craving for any defiled thing.

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like space.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba lhun gyis grub pa'i skyes bu'i yang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / chags pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba lhun gyis grub pa'i skyes bu'i yang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / chags pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The person who sees selflessness is also spontaneous, free from the view of self and what is mine, and free from attachment. This is the non-apprehension of cause.

original: rigs pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: Because of reason.

original: rigs pas yongs su mthong ba'i thabs bshad ma thag pas gshegs pa'i phyir bsngags par gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pas yongs su mthong ba'i thabs bshad ma thag pas gshegs pa'i phyir bsngags par gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone well by means of the method of seeing with reason, which has just been explained.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone to bliss.

original: de de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis bsngags par gshegs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis bsngags par gshegs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is the Sugata in two ways.

original: slar mi ldog par gshegs pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa yin na /
analyzed: slar mi ldog par gshegs pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa yin na /
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone without returning.

original: slar log pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: slar log pa yang gang yin /
translated: What is it to return?

original: gang bzlog pa las slar mi ldog pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang bzlog pa las slar mi ldog pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is it to not return from what one has turned away from?üîΩBirth and the arising of faults

original: skye dang skyon ni kun 'byung dag / slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin //
analyzed: skye dang skyon ni kun 'byung dag / slar yang ldog ces bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as returning.

original: skye ba yang 'byung pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon rnams yang 'byung ba ni slar ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yang 'byung pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon rnams yang 'byung ba ni slar ldog pa yin no //
translated: The arising of birth and the arising of faults such as attachment are returning.

original: gang gis skye ba dang skyon yang 'byung ba med pa de ni 'khor ba las grol ba'am nyes pa zad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis skye ba dang skyon yang 'byung ba med pa de ni 'khor ba las grol ba'am nyes pa zad pa yin no //
translated: When there is no birth and no fault, there is liberation from cyclic existence, or the exhaustion of faults.

original: de 'jug pa na 'khor ba dang so so'i skye bo nyid slar yang ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de 'jug pa na 'khor ba dang so so'i skye bo nyid slar yang ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: When that occurs, cyclic existence and the state of being an ordinary being will not occur again.

original: de dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag lta ba'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag lta ba'i sa bon spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the seed of the view of a self has been abandoned.

original: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin te //
translated: There is no return.

original: skye ba dang skyon mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang skyon mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: There is no birth and no fault.

original: de ltar na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yod na bdag gir chags pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyi tshogs 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yod na bdag gir chags pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyi tshogs 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, when there is attachment to a self, the mass of faults such as attachment to what belongs to a self occurs.

original: bdag tu chags pas kyang gnas @58b yongs su len par byed do //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pas kyang gnas @58b yongs su len par byed do //
translated: And because of attachment to a self, one grasps a place as one‚Äôs own.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa de dag med pa gang yin pa de gang las nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa len pa yin sbyor ba ni gang zhig bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa med pa de'i skye ba yongs su len pa med cing 'dod chags la
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa de dag med pa gang yin pa de gang las nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa len pa yin sbyor ba ni gang zhig bdag tu lta ba'i chags pa med pa de'i skye ba yongs su len pa med cing 'dod chags la
translated: What is the cause of the arising of the afflictions and of the taking up of existence?

original: sogs pa'i skyon 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: sogs pa'i skyon 'byung ba med de /
translated: The one who is free from the attachment of the view of self does not take up birth, and the faults of desire, etc., do not arise.

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like space.üîΩThe one who sees selflessness spontaneously does not have the view and attachment of clinging to the self as his own.

original: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba lhun gyis grub pa'i skyes pu'i yang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba dang chags pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba lhun gyis grub pa'i skyes pu'i yang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba dang chags pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-apprehension of cause.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i sa bon spangs pa /üîΩde bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i sa bon spangs pa / de bden tha dad bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The seed of the view of self is abandoned.üîΩThe view of self is not true,

original: bden pa nyid du bdag tu lta bas sgro btags pa bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par bzlog par 'dzin pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa nyid du bdag tu lta bas sgro btags pa bden pa ma yin pa'i rnam par bzlog par 'dzin pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the apprehension of the negation of the truth of the self that is imagined by the view of self as having the nature of a true self.

original: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang tshad ma'i grogs can yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang tshad ma'i grogs can yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The seeing of selflessness is the antidote to the views of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and it is unmistaken and has valid cognition as its companion.

original: tha dad pa nyid kyis ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyis ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: By ‚Äúdistinctness‚Äù it is shown that it is contradictory to the view of self.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni 'di'i rang bzhin nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni 'di'i rang bzhin nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: By ‚Äúitself‚Äù it is explained that it is its very nature.

original: gang gi phyir phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir de'i 'gal ba dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba 'joms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir de'i 'gal ba dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba 'joms par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it is unmistaken, it is contradictory to that, and so the seeing of selflessness destroys the views of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bden pa dang tshad ma'i grogs can nyid yin pa de'i phyir de dor bar bya ba'i phyir rtsol bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bden pa dang tshad ma'i grogs can nyid yin pa de'i phyir de dor bar bya ba'i phyir rtsol bar mi byed do //
translated: Because it has truth and valid cognition as its companion, one does not strive to abandon it.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni 'bad rtsol gyis bzlog par bya ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni 'bad rtsol gyis bzlog par bya ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: By ‚Äúitself‚Äù it is shown that it is to be averted by effort.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni 'bad rtsol med par bzlog par mi nus te dper na gtsang sbra can thod pa can du gyur pa'i skye ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni 'bad rtsol med par bzlog par mi nus te dper na gtsang sbra can thod pa can du gyur pa'i skye ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is the nature of something cannot be averted without effort, just as, for example, the birth of a person who is born pure cannot be averted.

original: bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol gyi rtsom pa mi byed pa de ltar na yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol gyi rtsom pa mi byed pa de ltar na yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: Because of the truth of that, one does not make an effort to compose, and thus there is no falling away.

original: de yang sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: And that has already been analyzed.

original: 'dis ni yang slar mi ldog pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang slar mi ldog pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the irreversibility.

original: da ni ma lus pa'i don lus ngag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la lhag ma de yang gang yin /
analyzed: da ni ma lus pa'i don lus ngag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la lhag ma de yang gang yin /
translated: Now, the remaining meaning is explained by the words ‚Äúof body, speech, and mind‚Äù and so on. What is the remainder?

original: gang spangs pas shes par bya ba ji srid par gshegs pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang spangs pas shes par bya ba ji srid par gshegs pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: And why is it called ‚ÄúWell-Gone‚Äù because he has gone to the end of what is to be known?üîΩThe remaining is the negative tendencies of body,

original: lus ngag sems kyi gnas ngan len //
analyzed: lus ngag sems kyi gnas ngan len //
translated: speech, and mind.

original: lus yin @59a * //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lus yin @59a * //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The body is the remaining.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na nyon mongs med dang nad med dang / nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir nad med cing gdung ba med pa ste /üîΩyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdung bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na nyon mongs med dang nad med dang / nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir nad med cing gdung ba med pa ste / yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdung bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat. The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat. The nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat. The nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat.

original: de la nyon mongs ba can ma yin pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len ni ma brtags par yang goms pa las mchongs shing 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs ba can ma yin pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len ni ma brtags par yang goms pa las mchongs shing 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat. The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat. The nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat. The nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat. The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat.

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med par yang dmangs rigs brjod pa la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med par yang dmangs rigs brjod pa la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat. The nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat. The nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat. The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat. The nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat. The nonafflicted mind is the nonafflicted mind of the arhat.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni rtag tu mnyam par ma bzhag pas lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs de gnas ngan len rnam pa gsum po de dag ni lus pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni rtag tu mnyam par ma bzhag pas lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs de gnas ngan len rnam pa gsum po de dag ni lus pa yin no //
translated: The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat. The nonafflicted body is the nonafflicted body of the arhat.üîΩThe nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat. The nonafflicted speech is the nonafflicted speech of the arhat.üîΩThe

original: dus ring por rnam pa mang pos rnam pa du mar lam goms par ma byas pas lam de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yon tan dang skyon rnams khyad par du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ring por rnam pa mang pos rnam pa du mar lam goms par ma byas pas lam de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yon tan dang skyon rnams khyad par du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have not cultivated the path in many ways for a long time, they do not have the special realization of the virtues and faults that are incompatible with this or that path.

original: yang na ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i lam yang rnam par phye ba dang / bshad pa la mi gsal ba ni lus pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i lam yang rnam par phye ba dang / bshad pa la mi gsal ba ni lus pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the path of realization as it truly is is distinguished and explained, but the remainder is not clear.

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i lus pa de dang de gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa can gyis dus ring por rnam pa mang pos /üîΩrnam pa du mar lam /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i lus pa de dang de gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa can gyis dus ring por rnam pa mang pos / rnam pa du mar lam /
translated: The remainder that is mentioned is engaged in the benefit of others for a long time in many ways.üîΩBecause they cultivate the path in many ways,

original: goms phyir ma lus spangs pa yin //
analyzed: goms phyir ma lus spangs pa yin //
translated: they abandon the remainder.

original: de mi mnga' ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa la mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: de mi mnga' ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa la mi mnga' zhing /
translated: Because they do not have that, the noble listeners and so on do not have it.

original: grol ba na yang phyis lus spangs pa mi mnga' ste lus pa ni skye ba du mas tshar gcad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa la ni yang skye ba'i rgyun mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba na yang phyis lus spangs pa mi mnga' ste lus pa ni skye ba du mas tshar gcad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa la ni yang skye ba'i rgyun mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And even when liberated, they do not later abandon the body, because they must be destroyed by many rebirths, and because noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on do not have a continuum of rebirth.

original: rgyal dpogs pa la sogs pa kha cig smra sogs phyir na /
analyzed: rgyal dpogs pa la sogs pa kha cig smra sogs phyir na /
translated: Some, such as the Jains, say:

original: smra ba po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'ga' zhig gi skyon zad min na /
analyzed: smra ba po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'ga' zhig gi skyon zad min na /
translated: If the reason of being a speaker and so on does not eliminate the faults of some,

original: gang las ma lus pa spangs pa'am gzhan du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang las ma lus pa spangs pa'am gzhan du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: from what is the complete abandonment or transformation?

original: smra ba po nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni nyes pa zad pa 'gog pa nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni nyes pa zad pa 'gog pa nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The proof of being a speaker and so on is not able to negate the exhaustion of faults.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba med par grub pas smra ba po la sogs pa 'di ldog la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba med par grub pas smra ba po la sogs pa 'di ldog la /
translated: Because it is established that there is no contradiction, this speaker and so on is reversed.

original: the tshom za ba de'i phyir 'khrul pa ldog pa la the tshom za pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin @59b pa de ltar na lan mang du dpyad zin pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: the tshom za ba de'i phyir 'khrul pa ldog pa la the tshom za pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin @59b pa de ltar na lan mang du dpyad zin pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir ma spros so //
translated: Because of that doubt, there is doubt about the cessation of error. Therefore, it is uncertain. Since this has been analyzed many times, I will not elaborate on it here.

original: smra ba nyid kyi phyir nyes pa zad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de dang de ni shin tu rigs pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: smra ba nyid kyi phyir nyes pa zad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de dang de ni shin tu rigs pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that faults are not exhausted because of mere speech.

original: 'on kyang sems dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig 'di ltar /
translated: However, some intelligent person might think this:

original: skyon rnams mi zad rtog 'gyur te //
analyzed: skyon rnams mi zad rtog 'gyur te //
translated: Faults are not exhausted because of conceptualization.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because

original: rtag nyid phyir te ther zug tu gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag nyid phyir te ther zug tu gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: they are permanent, that is, because they endure eternally.

original: rtag pa gang yin pa de dag ji ltar zad par 'gyur /üîΩrtag pa nyid ni ma yin te //
analyzed: rtag pa gang yin pa de dag ji ltar zad par 'gyur / rtag pa nyid ni ma yin te //
translated: How could those that are permanent be exhausted?üîΩThey are not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin mod kyi //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin mod kyi //
translated: They are impermanent.

original: 'on kyang de dag zad pa'i thabs sred pa ma yin na gang gis na zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag zad pa'i thabs sred pa ma yin na gang gis na zad par 'gyur te /
translated: However, if craving is not the means for their exhaustion, by what means would they be exhausted?

original: de ltar na thabs med phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na thabs med phyir /
translated: Thus, because there is no means,

original: nyes pa rnams zad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams zad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: faults are not exhausted.

original: nyes pa de rnams zad pa'i thabs yod pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: nyes pa de rnams zad pa'i thabs yod pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is all right if there is a means to eliminate those faults.

original: de ltar na yang thabs de rigs par byed pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang thabs de rigs par byed pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But even if there were such a means, it is not reasonable.

original: gang las de nan tan du byas pa las zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las de nan tan du byas pa las zad par 'gyur /
translated: How could they be eliminated by the practice of that?

original: de ltar na yang na thabs ni mi shes phyir mi zad pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang na thabs ni mi shes phyir mi zad pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one would understand that they are not eliminated because the means is not known.

original: sbyor ba ni rtag pa gang yin pa de dag ni zad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rtag pa gang yin pa de dag ni zad pa ma yin te //
translated: The application is this: those that are permanent are not eliminated.

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like space.

original: nyes pa yang rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa yang rtag pa yin no //
translated: And the faults are also permanent.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction.

original: gang zad pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin pas de ni zad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zad pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin pas de ni zad pa ma yin te /
translated: That which has no means of elimination is not eliminated.

original: dper na nam mkha' de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like that very space.üîΩAnd there is no means of eliminating faults.

original: nyes pa rnams la yang zad pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams la yang zad pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the non-observation of a pervader.

original: gang zhig gang zad pa'i thabs rigs pa ma yin pa de ni de zad par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang zad pa'i thabs rigs pa ma yin pa de ni de zad par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not a proper means for the destruction of something does not bring about the destruction of that thing.

original: dper na nad zad pa'i thabs mi rigs pa'i sman pa ngan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nad zad pa'i thabs mi rigs pa'i sman pa ngan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a bad doctor is not a proper means for the destruction of a disease.

original: skyes bu 'di yang nyon mongs pa zad pa'i thabs mi rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang nyon mongs pa zad pa'i thabs mi rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This person is not a proper means for the destruction of the afflictions. This is a non-observation of a cause.

original: gtan tshigs gsum po de dag kyang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum po de dag kyang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Those three reasons are also unestablished.

original: rgyu ldan nyid phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ldan nyid phyir te /
translated: Because they possess a cause.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa nyid ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa nyid ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Since the afflictions are impermanent, their permanence is not established.

original: gang dang gang du rgyu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du rgyu dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever possesses a cause is not permanent.

original: dper na sgron ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a lamp.

original: skyon yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyon yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the faults also possess a cause. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: ma gru ba pa yang ma yin te glo bur ba ma yin na @60a * //
analyzed: ma gru ba pa yang ma yin te glo bur ba ma yin na @60a * //
translated: Nor are they adventitious.
