original: thams cad dus thams cad du bdag nyid thams cad kyis mngon du phyogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dus thams cad du bdag nyid thams cad kyis mngon du phyogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be directly perceptible at all times and in all ways.

original: rtag pa nyid sbong ba la res 'ga' 'byung ba dmigs pa la sogs pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid sbong ba la res 'ga' 'byung ba dmigs pa la sogs pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to avoid the fault of permanence, you will have to say that the reason is that it is perceived sometimes.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams so //
translated: The afflictions are desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni gti mug go //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni gti mug go //
translated: The view of self and mine is delusion.

original: de sngon du song ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gir zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: de sngon du song ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gir zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the clinging to self and mine that is preceded by that.

original: de sngon du song ba can rjes su chags pa'i yul la gnod par byed pa la mnar sems pa ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: de sngon du song ba can rjes su chags pa'i yul la gnod par byed pa la mnar sems pa ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Hatred is the ill will that is preceded by that toward the object of attachment.

original: de ltar na bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag kyang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag kyang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the other afflictions and secondary afflictions that are preceded by the view of self also come to be.

original: thams cad kyi yang bdag tu nga rgyal ba'i mngon par chags pa rtsa ba yin pa lta rna /
analyzed: thams cad kyi yang bdag tu nga rgyal ba'i mngon par chags pa rtsa ba yin pa lta rna /
translated: Just as the root of all is the manifest clinging to the view of the transitory collection as real ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba nyes pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba nyes pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the cause of faults,

original: de mngon du gyur pa na gzhan dag kyang mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de mngon du gyur pa na gzhan dag kyang mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because when it is manifest, the others are manifest.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu bdun pa /
translated: Book Seventeen

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang mngon du gyur pa na mngon du 'gyur zhing de las gzhan pa'i rgyu lhag ma rnams mngon du 'gyur na yang de mngon du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang mngon du gyur pa na mngon du 'gyur zhing de las gzhan pa'i rgyu lhag ma rnams mngon du 'gyur na yang de mngon du mi 'gyur na /
translated: The argument is this: If when one thing is manifest, another thing is manifest, and if when the remaining causes other than that are manifest, that is not manifest,

original: mngon du mi 'gyur ba don de de las 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon du mi 'gyur ba don de de las 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then that which is not manifest is not the object of that.

original: dper na sa bon mngon du phyogs pa na myu gu mngon du phyogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon mngon du phyogs pa na myu gu mngon du phyogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the seed is manifest, the sprout is manifest.

original: skyes bu stong pa nyid sgom pa'i gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: skyes bu stong pa nyid sgom pa'i gnas skabs sam /
translated: In the context of a person meditating on emptiness,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa mngon du 'gyur ba na bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'i skyon mngon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa mngon du 'gyur ba na bdag la chags pa la sogs pa'i skyon mngon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: When one is in a neutral state, the manifest conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù occur, and the faults of attachment to the self, etc., manifest.

original: dbang po la sogs pa de las gzhan pa yod na yang de mngon du mi 'gyur na mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa de las gzhan pa yod na yang de mngon du mi 'gyur na mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: If the sense faculties, etc., were different from that, then even though they exist, they would not manifest. The statement ‚Äúthey would manifest‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: de bas na bdag tu lta ba ni nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag tu lta ba ni nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore the view of the self is the cause of faults.

original: rgyu 'di dang 'gal ba ni bdag med pa nyid mthong ba yin la de goms pas nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu ni zad phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'di dang 'gal ba ni bdag med pa nyid mthong ba yin la de goms pas nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu ni zad phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the cessation of the faults is the vision of selflessness, which is incompatible with that cause.

original: de ltar na nyes ba zad pa'i thabs yod pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyes ba zad pa'i thabs yod pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Since there is a method for the cessation of faults, the second reason is also unestablished.

original: spyor ba ni rgyu 'gal ba'i rang bzhin @60b goms pa yin pa can gang yin pa de ni rgyud rgyun chad pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: spyor ba ni rgyu 'gal ba'i rang bzhin @60b goms pa yin pa can gang yin pa de ni rgyud rgyun chad pa yod pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever has the nature of the cause of the cessation of the faults has the cessation of the continuum of the faults,üîΩbecause it is the cultivation of the nature that is incompatible with the cause.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like grain, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rgyu 'gal ba goms pa yod pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rgyu 'gal ba goms pa yod pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the cause of desire, etc., is the cultivation of an opposing cause. This is a natural inference.

original: sbyor ba nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la de lta bu'i ngo bro sgro btags nas 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba'i rkyen yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la de lta bu'i ngo bro sgro btags nas 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba'i rkyen yod pa yin te /
translated: The application is that which, in regard to things that are not of such a nature, engages in them after superimposing such a nature upon them. It is the presence of a contradictory condition.

original: dper na thag pa la sprul gyi shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sprul gyi shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the consciousness of a snake in regard to a rope.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang bdag med pa'i phung po rnams la rtag pa dang / bde ba dang bdag dang zad ga gir sgro btags nas 'jug pa 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu log pa'i shes pa yang de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos rnams la de lta bu'i ngo bro sgro btags nas 'jug pa yin no
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang bdag med pa'i phung po rnams la rtag pa dang / bde ba dang bdag dang zad ga gir sgro btags nas 'jug pa 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu log pa'i shes pa yang de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos rnams la de lta bu'i ngo bro sgro btags nas 'jug pa yin no
translated: Desire, etc., engage in the aggregates, which are impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial, after superimposing upon them permanence, pleasure, purity, and substance. The cause of those, the erroneous consciousness, also engages in things after superimposing upon them such a nature, because it is not of such a nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so//
translated: This is a logical argument from nature.

original: gtan tshigs snga ma ma grub pa ma yin la 'di yang ma yin te skabs ji lta ba bzhin du la lar 'ga' zhig bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir dang ston par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma ma grub pa ma yin la 'di yang ma yin te skabs ji lta ba bzhin du la lar 'ga' zhig bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir dang ston par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The previous logical argument is not unestablished, nor is this one, because in some cases, some things have already been taught and will be taught, as is appropriate.

original: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun nus pa'i ngo bo gnas skabs kyis rgyun chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun nus pa'i ngo bo gnas skabs kyis rgyun chad pa'i phyir /
translated: The continuum of seeds, etc., is interrupted by the power of circumstances.

original: snga ma bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba yang ma yin te /üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa de ni de las shin tu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba yang ma yin te / sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa de ni de las shin tu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the previous proof devoid of the probandum,üîΩbecause non-apprehension is a proof that something does not exist in a certain place, as in the case of a pot, etc.

original: dper na sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid la bde ba dang / me la chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid la bde ba dang / me la chu lta bu'o //
translated: The application is this: If something does not exist in a certain place, then it is not apprehended in that place, as in the case of water in a mirage.

original: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun tshig pa can la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yod pa la phyis shin tu mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩrgyu'i rang bzhin shes pa yis //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun tshig pa can la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yod pa la phyis shin tu mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o // rgyu'i rang bzhin shes pa yis //
translated: The non-apprehension of the nature of something is, for example, the non-apprehension of the continuity of a flame, or of a seed, etc., which has the characteristic of being perceived, but which later is not at all perceived.

original: nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas /üîΩde shes pa yang nges par 'gyur//
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas / de shes pa yang nges par 'gyur//
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause is, for example, the non-apprehension of the cause of a fault, when one has understood the characteristic of the cause of a fault.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is also the apprehension of the counteragent to the cause of a fault.üîΩThe cause of a fault is the cause of that which is to be abandoned.üîΩThe cause of the counteragent is the cause of the antidote.

original: nyes pa'i rgyu rnams kyi gnyen po'i shes pa yang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa'i rgyu rnams kyi gnyen po'i shes pa yang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of the cause is the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.

original: gang dang gang rgyu'i rang bzhin rigs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ni de'i ma tshan nyid shes pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa'i ngo bo can yin te /üîΩdper na rlung la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'dod chags @61a * //
analyzed: gang dang gang rgyu'i rang bzhin rigs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ni de'i ma tshan nyid shes pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa'i ngo bo can yin te / dper na rlung la sogs pa lta bu'o // 'dod chags @61a * //
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote.

original: la sogs pa'i yang rgyu'i rang bzhin rigs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i yang rgyu'i rang bzhin rigs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause is the apprehension of the cause of the cause of the antidote

original: de ltar na thabs yongs su shes pa grub ba nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs gsum pa yang ma grub ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na thabs yongs su shes pa grub ba nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs gsum pa yang ma grub ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since the complete understanding of the means is established, the third reason is also not established.

original: skyob ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig bzhi ba 'chad par byed pa la skyob pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: skyob ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig bzhi ba 'chad par byed pa la skyob pa yang gang yin /
translated: He explains the four-line verse beginning with ‚Äúprotector‚Äù and so on. What is a protector?

original: gang dang ldan pas na bde gshegs skyob pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas na bde gshegs skyob pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: By possessing what is a Sugata called a protector?

original: bshad pa / skyobs pa nyid gzigs lam gsung pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / skyobs pa nyid gzigs lam gsung pa //
translated: The explanation is: He teaches the path that is seen as the protector.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i lam 'chad par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i lam 'chad par mdzad pa ste /
translated: He teaches the path that is understood just as it is.

original: kun ston par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun ston par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he reveals it.

original: de nyid ni rjes su ston pa'i cho 'phrul zhes grags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni rjes su ston pa'i cho 'phrul zhes grags pa nyid yin no //
translated: That itself is known as the miracle of instruction.

original: gang gis sems can rnams skyob par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams skyob par mdzad pa ste /
translated: He is the one who protects sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs yang dag par ston pa'i sgo nas phan pa la 'jug pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs yang dag par ston pa'i sgo nas phan pa la 'jug pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He engages in benefiting them by teaching the method for exhausting suffering.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de yang 'bras med phyir te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de yang 'bras med phyir te /
translated: The Sugata is also without result.

original: log bar gsung ba la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro brdzun mi gsung /
analyzed: log bar gsung ba la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro brdzun mi gsung /
translated: because there is no purpose in false speech.

original: lam phyin ci log par ston par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: lam phyin ci log par ston par mi mdzad de /
translated: He does not teach a wrong path,

original: de skad du ston pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du ston pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for teaching that way.

original: de ltar na lam log par ston pa'i rgyu skyon nam lam gyi yul mi shes pa yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de ltar na lam log par ston pa'i rgyu skyon nam lam gyi yul mi shes pa yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, the cause of teaching a wrong path would be a fault or ignorance of the object of the path.

original: de ni des spangs pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni des spangs pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But it has been explained that he has abandoned that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyid kyi bde ba mngon par bzhed pa la sogs pas rnam pa gzhan du ston pa la dgos pa med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyid kyi bde ba mngon par bzhed pa la sogs pas rnam pa gzhan du ston pa la dgos pa med pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, since there is no purpose in teaching a different way because he manifestly desires his own happiness,

original: ji ltar na de las slu ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na de las slu ba yin /
translated: how could he deceive?üîΩIf you think that he would deceive even though he knows,

original: shes su zin kyang brtse ba med pas slu bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: shes su zin kyang brtse ba med pas slu bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: because he lacks love,

original: de yang bde bar gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /üîΩthugs brtse ldan phyir gzhan don yang //
analyzed: de yang bde bar gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste / thugs brtse ldan phyir gzhan don yang //
translated: that also is not possible for the Sugata.üîΩBecause he is compassionate, he is

original: rtsom pa thams cad sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa thams cad sbyor phyir ro //
translated: engaged in the welfare of others.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs bzad pa'i thabs rtsom pa thams cad la mngon par sbyor ba mdzad ba gang yin pa de ni sems can la phan par mdzad ba'i phyir yin na gzhan gyi don gyi thabs kyis lam mngon sum du mdzad pa brtse ba'i bdag nyid du
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs bzad pa'i thabs rtsom pa thams cad la mngon par sbyor ba mdzad ba gang yin pa de ni sems can la phan par mdzad ba'i phyir yin na gzhan gyi don gyi thabs kyis lam mngon sum du mdzad pa brtse ba'i bdag nyid du
translated: The Bhagavat, who is engaged in all the means of destroying the afflictions, does so in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: gyur pa de nyid la bzhugs pa ji ltar na brdzun gsung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gyur pa de nyid la bzhugs pa ji ltar na brdzun gsung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could he, who is compassionate by nature, who has actualized the path of the means for the benefit of others, and who remains in that state, speak falsely?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe brdzun gyi tshig gi rgyu med pa'am dgos pa med pa de ni de'i tshe brdzun smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe brdzun gyi tshig gi rgyu med pa'am dgos pa med pa de ni de'i tshe brdzun smra ba ma yin te /
translated: As for the application, if someone does not have a cause for speaking falsely or does not have a need for it, then at that time he is not speaking falsely.

original: gzhan bden pa smras @61b ba'i dus kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan bden pa smras @61b ba'i dus kyi lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the time when others speak truthfully.üîΩIn the state of the Sugata, there is no cause for speaking falsely,

original: 'di'i bde bar gshegs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ba den pa ma yin pa gsung ba'i rgyu mi mnga' ba'am /
analyzed: 'di'i bde bar gshegs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ba den pa ma yin pa gsung ba'i rgyu mi mnga' ba'am /
translated: or there is no need for it.

original: dgos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-apprehension of a cause.

original: gang zhig gang gi don bya ba'i phyir gang gi brtse bas don gang sgrub par byed pa de de'i don grub ba la de'i yul can gyi brtse ba yongs su mi 'dor ba de ni de la slu bar mi byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi don bya ba'i phyir gang gi brtse bas don gang sgrub par byed pa de de'i don grub ba la de'i yul can gyi brtse ba yongs su mi 'dor ba de ni de la slu bar mi byed de /
translated: He who, out of love for someone, accomplishes a goal for that one, does not deceive that one with regard to the accomplishment of that goal, since he does not abandon his love for that one.

original: dper na bu'i bza' ba'i phyir zas sgrub par byed pa can gyi ma lta bu'o //üîΩbrjod bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par yang sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bu'i bza' ba'i phyir zas sgrub par byed pa can gyi ma lta bu'o // brjod bar 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par yang sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a mother, who has accomplished food for the sake of her child‚Äôs eating, does not deceive her child with regard to the accomplishment of the food.

original: sems can la brtse bas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i thabs bsgrubs par gyur pa de ni yul can gyi brtse ba yongs su dor bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la brtse bas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i thabs bsgrubs par gyur pa de ni yul can gyi brtse ba yongs su dor bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The special person who is the speaker, having accomplished the means for the exhaustion of the afflictions out of love for sentient beings, in order to accomplish the aims of sentient beings, does not abandon his love for sentient beings. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: de phyir tshad yin /
analyzed: de phyir tshad yin /
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar sku nyams su bstar ba phyin ci ma log pa de don du gnyer ba la ston par mdzad pa de'i phyir de'i de la de tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar sku nyams su bstar ba phyin ci ma log pa de don du gnyer ba la ston par mdzad pa de'i phyir de'i de la de tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Because he teaches the unerring method for attaining the body that he himself has attained, therefore, he is a valid person for those who seek that body.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba la don gang phyin ci ma log par ston pa de ni de'i cho de la tshad mar gyur pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba la don gang phyin ci ma log par ston pa de ni de'i cho de la tshad mar gyur pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever person teaches the unerring method for attaining a goal that another person seeks, that person should be known as a valid person for that other person.

original: dper na nad pa nad med pa don du gnyer ba la nad med pa'i thabs phyin ci ma log pa ston par byed pa'i sman pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nad pa nad med pa don du gnyer ba la nad med pa'i thabs phyin ci ma log pa ston par byed pa'i sman pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a doctor who teaches the unerring method for attaining health to a sick person who seeks to be well.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par yang sdug bsngal zad pa don du gnyer ba la ji ltar bstar ba bzhin du sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par yang sdug bsngal zad pa don du gnyer ba la ji ltar bstar ba bzhin du sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so
translated: The person who is the subject of the statement is a valid person for those who seek to end suffering because he teaches the unerring method for ending suffering. This is a natural inference.

original: // de de ltar na lugs las 'byung ba 'gro ba la phan par mdzad par bzhed pa nyid la sogs ba rgyu snga ma snga mas phyi ma phyi ma thams cad la srid pa'i rjes su dpag pas /
analyzed: // de de ltar na lugs las 'byung ba 'gro ba la phan par mdzad par bzhed pa nyid la sogs ba rgyu snga ma snga mas phyi ma phyi ma thams cad la srid pa'i rjes su dpag pas /
translated: Thus, the former reason is the basis for the latter, and the latter is the effect of the former.

original: tshad ma shin tu mi srid ba med pa rab tu bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: tshad ma shin tu mi srid ba med pa rab tu bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established the existence of valid cognition,

original: da ni lugs las bzlog pa 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma rtogs pa'i sgo nas rgyu phyi ma phyi ma grub pa yang dag par ston pa bstan pa'i ngo bo can gyi bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid bsgrub par 'dod pas /
analyzed: da ni lugs las bzlog pa 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma rtogs pa'i sgo nas rgyu phyi ma phyi ma grub pa yang dag par ston pa bstan pa'i ngo bo can gyi bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid bsgrub par 'dod pas /
translated: now, in order to establish the existence of the BhagavƒÅn as valid cognition, which is the nature of the teaching that correctly teaches the former cause through understanding the latter effect and the latter cause through understanding the former effect, in reverse order,üîΩhe says,

original: yang na skyob /
analyzed: yang na skyob /
translated: Or, the protector,

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston mdzad yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston mdzad yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the teacher of the four truths.

original: bcom ldan @62a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan @62a * //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn,

original: 'das ni sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'phags ba'i bden pa bzhi ston par mdzad pa yin pa de ltar na sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba de rnams kyi de la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das ni sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'phags ba'i bden pa bzhi ston par mdzad pa yin pa de ltar na sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba de rnams kyi de la tshad ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is a valid cognizer for those who seek the pacification of suffering because he teaches the four noble truths, which are the cause for the pacification of the suffering of cyclic existence for sentient beings.

original: gal te gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag bstan mod kyi /
translated: Even though he taught the suffering of others,

original: 'on kyang rnam pa phyin ci log pas bstan pa de'i phyir de'i bstan pa las grol ba ma yin pa de ltar na de dag skyob ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa phyin ci log pas bstan pa de'i phyir de'i bstan pa las grol ba ma yin pa de ltar na de dag skyob ba ma yin no //
translated: he is not liberated from his teaching because he taught it in a distorted way. Thus he is not a protector.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad pa de'i phyir /üîΩde'i rjes su 'brang pa can nyid grol ba de ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad pa de'i phyir / de'i rjes su 'brang pa can nyid grol ba de ltar na /
translated: The Blessed One is a valid cognizer for those who seek liberation because he teaches without distortion.

original: grol ba don du gnyer ba rnams kyi skyob pa de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: grol ba don du gnyer ba rnams kyi skyob pa de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore those who follow him are liberated. Thus he is a valid cognizer for those who seek liberation.

original: de la bden pa re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi dag gis ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bden pa re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi dag gis ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Each of the four noble truths is taught in four parts.

original: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid dang stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid dang stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: Suffering is impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: kun 'byung ni kun 'byung ba nyid dang rgyu nyid dang / rkyen nyid dang rab tu skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni kun 'byung ba nyid dang rgyu nyid dang / rkyen nyid dang rab tu skye ba nyid do //
translated: Origination is origination, cause, condition, and full production.

original: 'gog pa ni 'gog pa nyid dang zhi ba nyid dang gya nom pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni 'gog pa nyid dang zhi ba nyid dang gya nom pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: Cessation is cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence.

original: lam ni lam nyid dang rigs pa nyid dang / sgrub pa nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid ces bya ba rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: lam ni lam nyid dang rigs pa nyid dang / sgrub pa nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid ces bya ba rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: The path is the path, appropriateness, accomplishment, and definite release.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dag ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor rab tu bsgrubs pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu can gyi dngos pos khyad par dang / lhag ma kun 'byung gis rnam par bsgrubs par 'gyur ba de ltar na so sor ma brjod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dag ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor rab tu bsgrubs pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu can gyi dngos pos khyad par dang / lhag ma kun 'byung gis rnam par bsgrubs par 'gyur ba de ltar na so sor ma brjod do //
translated: The truths of suffering and origination are established as the nature of that which is to be accomplished and that which accomplishes, respectively. Since they are the cause of that, they are distinguished by their nature and the remaining truths are established by origination.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i rnam par grub pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i rnam par grub pa na /
translated: Likewise, when the truth of cessation is established as the aspect of the cessation of suffering,

original: lhag ma dang lam yang sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i thabs nyid du bstan pa na /
analyzed: lhag ma dang lam yang sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i thabs nyid du bstan pa na /
translated: the remaining two truths are taught as the means for the cessation of suffering.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba'i ngo bo rig pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa yang grub par 'gyur ba de ltar na so sor ma brjod do //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba'i ngo bo rig pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa yang grub par 'gyur ba de ltar na so sor ma brjod do //
translated: When that is established, the aspects of the knowledge of its divisions and so on are also established.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das ni 'phags ba'i bden pa sdug bsngal log pa'i thabs su gyur pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ni 'phags ba'i bden pa sdug bsngal log pa'i thabs su gyur pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is a valid means of knowledge for those who seek the means for the cessation of suffering,

original: de don du gnyer ba la ston par mdzad pa'i phyir de la tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba la ston par mdzad pa'i phyir de la tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: because he teaches the means for the cessation of suffering for those who seek it.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba gang yin pa la sdug bsngal @62b de'i rang bzhin dang / sdug bsngal de'i rgyu dang sdug bsngal de'i rab tu zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs de lta bur gyur pa ston par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba gang yin pa la sdug bsngal @62b de'i rang bzhin dang / sdug bsngal de'i rgyu dang sdug bsngal de'i rab tu zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs de lta bur gyur pa ston par byed pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever teaches the nature of that suffering, the cause of that suffering, the cessation of that suffering, and the means for the cessation of that suffering to those who seek the cessation of that suffering is a valid means of knowledge for them.

original: de'i dngos bo de la tshad mar gyur pa yin te nad pa nad rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba la nad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la sogs pa ji lta bur gyur pa ston par byed pa'i sman pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos bo de la tshad mar gyur pa yin te nad pa nad rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba la nad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la sogs pa ji lta bur gyur pa ston par byed pa'i sman pa lta bu'o //
translated: He is a valid authority with regard to that thing, just as a physician is for a patient who is seeking the complete alleviation of his illness.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang skyes bu 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang skyes bu 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba la /
translated: The Lord Buddha is also like that for persons who are seeking the complete alleviation of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rgyu dang rab tu zhi ba dang / thabs phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rgyu dang rab tu zhi ba dang / thabs phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: He teaches the suffering of cyclic existence, its cause, its complete alleviation, and the means to achieve that complete alleviation. This is a natural inference.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ni phyis ston par byad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ni phyis ston par byad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the reason will be taught later.

original: sdug bsngal yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering?

original: sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe suffering of cyclic existence is the aggregates.‚Äù

original: 'khor bar 'khor bas na 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor bas na 'khor ba ste /
translated: It is cyclic existence because it cycles in cyclic existence.

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun no //
translated: It is a continuum of birth and death.

original: de phung po gang dag la yod pa de dag ni 'khor ba can gyi phung po ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //üîΩsdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis dngos sam /
analyzed: de phung po gang dag la yod pa de dag ni 'khor ba can gyi phung po ste gzugs la sogs pa'o // sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis dngos sam /
translated: The aggregates in which this is found are the aggregates of the transmigrator, i.e., form, etc.

original: brgyud pas sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: brgyud pas sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not directly or indirectly painful, because of the three kinds of suffering.

original: gal te sems can snga ma 'ga' zhig las 'di lta bu'i rnam pa nyid du 'ongs pa ma yin zhing byung ba yang yang 'khor ba gzhan len pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang las 'khor ba yin zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sems can snga ma 'ga' zhig las 'di lta bu'i rnam pa nyid du 'ongs pa ma yin zhing byung ba yang yang 'khor ba gzhan len pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang las 'khor ba yin zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: If no sentient being comes from a previous existence in this form, and if, having arisen, he does not go to another existence, then from what does transmigration result?

original: goms las sngon byas pa goms pa las yid kyi chos 'di rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms las sngon byas pa goms pa las yid kyi chos 'di rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It results from the habit-energy of the previous action.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dod chags la sogs gsal bar mthong phyir te //üîΩskye ba 'di la skyes bu sngar 'dod chags kyi shas chung ba rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa las /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs gsal bar mthong phyir te // skye ba 'di la skyes bu sngar 'dod chags kyi shas chung ba rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa las /
translated: Because the manifest defilements are seen.üîΩIn this life, a person who previously had little attachment, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa shas che ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa shas che ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: through the habit-energy of his actions in accordance with conditions, will have much attachment, etc.

original: de dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba de ni goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba de ni goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
translated: The manifest desire, etc. of those is due to prior habituation.

original: de la dang por yang ngo bo nyid kyis sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba ni goms pa sngon du song ba can yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ro //üîΩsbyor ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / khro @63a * //
analyzed: de la dang por yang ngo bo nyid kyis sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba ni goms pa sngon du song ba can yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ro // sbyor ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / khro @63a * //
translated: First, one should understand that the manifest desire, etc. of sentient beings is due to prior habituation.

original: ba la sogs pa dang / shes rab dang / snying rje dang / byams pa dang / ma chags pa la sogs pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang sems can la sogs pa 'dod pa gsal ba gang yin pa de ni goms pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa dang / shes rab dang / snying rje dang / byams pa dang / ma chags pa la sogs pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang sems can la sogs pa 'dod pa gsal ba gang yin pa de ni goms pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: The application is that the manifest desire, hatred, ignorance, pride, arrogance, jealousy, miserliness, anger, etc. and the manifest wisdom, compassion, love, nonattachment, etc. and the manifest crafts, sentient beings, etc. are due to prior habituation.

original: dper na skye ba 'di nyid la sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan mi gsal ba can goms pa'i dbang gis phyis gsal ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skye ba 'di nyid la sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan mi gsal ba can goms pa'i dbang gis phyis gsal ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in this very life, the qualities that were previously explained as being unclear become clear later on through the power of habituation.

original: yon tan de dag goms pa ma mthong ba can gyi skyes bu 'ga' zhig gi yang skye ba 'di la dang por chos de dag gsal ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yon tan de dag goms pa ma mthong ba can gyi skyes bu 'ga' zhig gi yang skye ba 'di la dang por chos de dag gsal ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: Even in the case of some person who has not seen the habituation to those qualities, it is said that in this life, those qualities are clear from the beginning. This is a logical argument from effect.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can ma mthong du zin kyang sgrub bar byed pa de ltar na 'gal ba'i dogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can ma mthong du zin kyang sgrub bar byed pa de ltar na 'gal ba'i dogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, even though habituation in a previous world is not seen, it is established. In that case, there is no fear of contradiction.

original: mi 'gal bar grub pa ni ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal bar grub pa ni ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the establishment of non-contradiction is itself uncertain.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba ni goms pa sngon du song ba can yin na'ang /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba ni goms pa sngon du song ba can yin na'ang /
translated: Even though the clarity of attachment and so on is preceded by habituation,

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid med par dang po gsal ba goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid mthong bar 'dod par 'gyur na de yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid med par dang po gsal ba goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid mthong bar 'dod par 'gyur na de yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: If you assert that the first clear appearance of the world beyond is seen without prior habituation to the world beyond, then that is contradictory.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi gsal ba phyis goms pa la sogs pa 'phel pa gang yin pa de yang de sngon rang bzhin mtshungs pas byas pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi gsal ba phyis goms pa la sogs pa 'phel pa gang yin pa de yang de sngon rang bzhin mtshungs pas byas pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, any increase of desire and so on due to later habituation and so forth is also due to the prior creation of a similar nature.

original: 'on kyang goms pas gsal bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pas gsal bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: However, through habituation, it becomes clear.

original: bsgrubs par byas pas stong pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrubs par byas pas stong pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not the case that emptiness is not established in the same way, there is no contradiction.

original: de ltar yin na yang 'jig rten pha rol gyi goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub byas stong pa ma yin nam ma yin te thog ma med pa can nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang 'jig rten pha rol gyi goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub byas stong pa ma yin nam ma yin te thog ma med pa can nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir
translated: Even if that is so, is the example empty of the probandum because prior habituation to the world beyond is itself the probandum? No, because beginninglessness is the probandum.

original: ro // 'di ni 'jig rten 'di yin na /
analyzed: ro // 'di ni 'jig rten 'di yin na /
translated: This is the next world.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs tha dad par byas pa de ni byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa dang / 'phra bar rnam par gzhag pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs tha dad par byas pa de ni byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa dang / 'phra bar rnam par gzhag pa tsam yin te /
translated: The distinction of the two worlds is merely a conceptual construction, like the distinction of the young, the middle-aged, and the old.

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not cling to it.

original: rnam pa 'dis ni sems can thog ma med pa can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba de ltar na skyon yod pa @63b nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis ni sems can thog ma med pa can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba de ltar na skyon yod pa @63b nyid ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the fact that sentient beings are beginningless is established, and the error is not committed.

original: gsal ba goms pa sngon du song ba can yin pa grub na de yod na yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di khyab pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba goms pa sngon du song ba can yin pa grub na de yod na yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di khyab pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is established that the manifestation of the manifest is preceded by habituation, then, since it exists when that exists, the reason is not unestablished.

original: gzhan yang goms pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'dod ba gang yin pa des de glo bur bar brjod par bya ba la rgyu gzhan brtag par bya ba yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang goms pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'dod ba gang yin pa des de glo bur bar brjod par bya ba la rgyu gzhan brtag par bya ba yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, if one does not accept that the manifestation of attachment, etc. is due to habituation, then one should say that it is adventitious, and one should investigate other causes.

original: re zhig 'dod rgyal nyid ma yin //
analyzed: re zhig 'dod rgyal nyid ma yin //
translated: It is not accidental.

original: rgyu med par 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gsal ba skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med par 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gsal ba skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Attachment, etc., do not arise from a cause, because they are not manifest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu med can skye 'gal phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med can skye 'gal phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to arise without a cause.

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs pa'i skyon yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs pa'i skyon yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the error of their being permanent, etc., would be entailed.

original: kha cig na re ji skad du rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dag gi chos yin no zhes smra ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re ji skad du rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dag gi chos yin no zhes smra ste /
translated: Some say: They are properties of wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: bad kan dag gi rang bzhin ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: bad kan dag gi rang bzhin ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin zhing /
translated: The nature of phlegm is attachment, etc.

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin ni zhe sdang la sogs pa yin la rlung gi rang bzhin ni gti mug la sogs pa yin bas /
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin ni zhe sdang la sogs pa yin la rlung gi rang bzhin ni gti mug la sogs pa yin bas /
translated: The nature of bile is anger, etc. The nature of wind is delusion, etc.

original: de gsal ba las kyang gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de gsal ba las kyang gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, attachment, etc., are manifest from the unmanifest.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de ni rlung sogs chos ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de ni rlung sogs chos ma yin no //
translated: Attachment, etc., are not properties of wind, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'khrul phyir te /
analyzed: 'khrul phyir te /
translated: Because of error.

original: bad kan la sogs pa so so la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'khrul par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa so so la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'khrul par mthong ngo //
translated: The manifestation of attachment, etc., is seen to be in error in each case, such as in phlegm.

original: de ltar na bad kan gyi rang bzhin can yang 'dod chags la sogs pa shas chung ba dang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can yang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i shas che ba ma yin pa dang / rlung gi rang bzhin can yang gti mug la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin pa de ltar na yid kyi yon tan rnams phan tshun 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bad kan gyi rang bzhin can yang 'dod chags la sogs pa shas chung ba dang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can yang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i shas che ba ma yin pa dang / rlung gi rang bzhin can yang gti mug la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin pa de ltar na yid kyi yon tan rnams phan tshun 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even one of phlegm constitution would not have little passion, etc., and even one of bile constitution would not have much hatred, etc., and even one of wind constitution would not have clear delusion, etc. Thus, the mental qualities would be mixed up.

original: gang med par yang yod pa gang yin pa de'i de rgyur rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang med par yang yod pa gang yin pa de'i de rgyur rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that what is absent should be the cause of what is present.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la 'khrul pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la 'khrul pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is confused about something is not the cause of that,

original: dper na chu la du ba 'khrul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu la du ba 'khrul pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the confusion of water about smoke.

original: bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin so so la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin so so la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the confusion of the manifestation of passion, etc., in each of the individual constitutions of phlegm, etc., is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: gal te rang bzhin 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause of the mixture of the constitutions,‚Äù

original: skyon med yin na /
analyzed: skyon med yin na /
translated: then there is no fault.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi //üîΩbad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa yin yang shes rab la sogs @64a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi // bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa yin yang shes rab la sogs @64a * //
translated: This is true,üîΩbut the person who has the qualities of wisdom, etc.,

original: pa'i yon tan can gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: pa'i yon tan can gang yin pa de la /
translated: even though he has the nature of phlegm, etc.,

original: de'i bad kan 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na /üîΩgang gis na de'i rang bzhin nges pa'i yon tan la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bad kan 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na / gang gis na de'i rang bzhin nges pa'i yon tan la brten pa yin no //
translated: is not just that phlegm, etc.üîΩTherefore, the qualities that are the basis of his nature are not just those.üîΩBut if the person has the nature of bile, then the qualities of wisdom, etc.,

original: 'on kyang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can yang rgyu 'di yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan can ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can yang rgyu 'di yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan can ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can yin no zhe na /
translated: are in the nature of bile, because the natures are mixed.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de tshe ji ltar skyes bu de'i shes rab mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi ngang tshul can du bde ltar na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de tshe ji ltar skyes bu de'i shes rab mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi ngang tshul can du bde ltar na /
translated: If this is so, then how can the wisdom of that person be in the nature of bile?

original: de las gzhan te rang bzhin de gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba can dring ba dang / rdul dang skal pa ngan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyang ci'i phyir de'i mi mthong skye bu mkhris pa'i yon tan can de'i ste mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan te rang bzhin de gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba can dring ba dang / rdul dang skal pa ngan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyang ci'i phyir de'i mi mthong skye bu mkhris pa'i yon tan can de'i ste mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And why is it that other qualities, such as being a man, being a particle, and being unfortunate, are not seen in him?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin gyi yon tan yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin gyi yon tan yin pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever is a quality of a certain nature

original: yon tan de yod na de'i 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan de yod na de'i 'gyur te /
translated: is seen when that quality exists,

original: dper na mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan lta bu'o //
translated: like the qualities of wisdom, etc., which are qualities of one who has a bilious nature.üîΩAnger, etc., are qualities of one who has a bilious nature.

original: khro ba la sogs pa yang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa yang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a reason from nature.

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin 'phel ba na yang de tsam du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can du de las gzhan pa'i chos 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin 'phel ba na yang de tsam du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can du de las gzhan pa'i chos 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you maintain that when the bilious nature increases, the qualities of anger, etc., increase to the same degree, then you must admit that other qualities, such as being a man, etc., also increase.

original: mi 'gyur bde bas na mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir de'i shes rab ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bde bas na mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir de'i shes rab ma yin no //
translated: It is not the wisdom of bile because it is associated with the nature of bile.

original: gal te yon tan 'ga' zhig rang bzhin gcig la so sor nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yon tan 'ga' zhig rang bzhin gcig la so sor nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If a certain quality is not determined in a single nature,

original: 'on kyang mkhris pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de dag ni bad kan dang rlung gi yang yin zhing de bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i gang yin pa de dag mkhris pa'i yang yin pa de ltar na thams cad kyi chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mkhris pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de dag ni bad kan dang rlung gi yang yin zhing de bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i gang yin pa de dag mkhris pa'i yang yin pa de ltar na thams cad kyi chos thams cad yin no //
translated: but rather, whatever is a quality of bile is also of phlegm and wind, and similarly, whatever is of wind, etc. is also of bile, then everything would have all qualities.

original: gang rang bzhin gang yang rung ba cig skyes pa de'i chos de nyid yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin thams cad kyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gang yang rung ba cig skyes pa de'i chos de nyid yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin thams cad kyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Whatever quality arises in a certain nature, that is its quality. Thus, it would belong to all natures.

original: de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa chos kun ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa chos kun ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because attachment, etc. are not the qualities of all dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /üîΩskyes bu thams cad kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen / skyes bu thams cad kyi /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it follows that the attachment of all beings

original: 'dod chags mtshungs par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags mtshungs par thal phyir ro //
translated: would be the same.

original: gang gi tshe gang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gi chos de yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩji ltar skyes bu gcig gi rang bzhin gcig @64b la 'dod chags ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gi chos de yin pa de'i tshe / ji ltar skyes bu gcig gi rang bzhin gcig @64b la 'dod chags ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: When something is the nature of a certain thing,üîΩthen just as the nature of one person is, so too the nature of another person would be.

original: skyes bu'i rang bzhin gzhan la gnas pa'i 'dod chags kyang de 'dra bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang bzhin gzhan la gnas pa'i 'dod chags kyang de 'dra bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: And just as the attachment of one person is, so too the attachment of another person would be.

original: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa can du 'gyur zhing /üîΩde bzhin du zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa can du 'gyur zhing / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, all would be similar in having attachment.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And likewise, all would be similar in having anger, delusion, pride, arrogance, jealousy, stinginess, wisdom, and so on, because their causes would be similar.

original: sbyor ba ni rgyu mtshungs pa can gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rgyu mtshungs pa can gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: that which has a similar cause is similar.

original: dper na rgyu mtshungs pa can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu mtshungs pa can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a sprout and so on that have a similar cause.

original: skyes bu la 'dod chags la sogs pa la yang rgyu rang bzhin mtshungs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩmtshungs pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu la 'dod chags la sogs pa la yang rgyu rang bzhin mtshungs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // mtshungs pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The argument from the nature of the cause is as follows: ‚ÄúDesire, etc., have a cause that is of the same nature as themselves.‚ÄùüîΩThe argument from the non-observation of the homogeneous is as follows: ‚ÄúDesire, etc., do not have a cause that is of the same nature as themselves.‚Äù

original: mtshungs su zin kyang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs su zin kyang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they are homogeneous, they are not homogeneous.

original: sbyor ba gang gis gang mtshungs su zin kyang mi mtshungs pa de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis gang mtshungs su zin kyang mi mtshungs pa de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: The application of the argument is as follows: ‚ÄúEven though they are homogeneous, they are not homogeneous, because they are not caused by that alone.‚Äù

original: dper na chu cha mnyam du zin kyang me lce'i tshogs 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba chu'i rgyu can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu cha mnyam du zin kyang me lce'i tshogs 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba chu'i rgyu can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even though water is homogeneous, the increase and decrease of the mass of flames is not caused by water.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang skyon gyi rang bzhin mtshungs su zin kyang 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang skyon gyi rang bzhin mtshungs su zin kyang 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Desire, etc., even though they are homogeneous in the nature of the fault, increase and decrease.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervasion.

original: gal te gzugs sogs bzhin skyon med //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sogs bzhin skyon med //
translated: If there were no fault, like form, etc.,

original: de ltar na 'di 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di 'gyur na /
translated: then this would be the case.

original: 'byung ba rnams mtshungs kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams mtshungs kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: The elements are the same, but form and so on increase and decrease.

original: 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mthong ba'i phyir thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa dag ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mthong ba'i phyir thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa dag ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even so, the reductio and the counter-reductio are not established, because the result of the elements is seen.

original: de la'ang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: de la'ang brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin //
translated: The same objection applies to you.

original: gal te 'byung ba khyad par med pa dag yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba khyad par med pa dag yin na /
translated: If the elements are not different,

original: de'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then their results, form and so on, would not increase and decrease.

original: de ltar na 'di la yang de bzhin du brtsad pa nyid yod pa de lta na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la yang de bzhin du brtsad pa nyid yod pa de lta na /
translated: So the same objection applies to you.

original: de lta bu'i rigs can thams cad phyogs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rigs can thams cad phyogs su byas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since all such arguments are the same,

original: thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: the reductio and the counter-reductio are not established.

original: de tsam rgyu nyid yin pa bsam pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de tsam rgyu nyid yin pa bsam pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is not the case that the mere elements are the cause.

original: @65a * // gzugs la sogs pa ni 'byung ba tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: @65a * // gzugs la sogs pa ni 'byung ba tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not caused by the mere elements.

original: rgyu ma mthong ba yang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma mthong ba yang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and you accept that the cause is not seen.

original: gal te thal ba la byung ba rnams kyang phyogs su byas ba'i phyir khas blangs pa las nyams pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thal ba la byung ba rnams kyang phyogs su byas ba'i phyir khas blangs pa las nyams pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the example is flawed because the elements that arise are taken as the subject,

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: then you have lost your case.

original: gal te de la 'byung ba dag las gzugs la sogs pa skye ba la yang khyad par can /
analyzed: gal te de la 'byung ba dag las gzugs la sogs pa skye ba la yang khyad par can /
translated: If you say that the elements are the cause of the arising of form, etc.,

original: las rnams bdag po med 'gyur na //
analyzed: las rnams bdag po med 'gyur na //
translated: then karma would be without an owner.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams la phan pa dang / gnod pa sgrub par byed pa'i las sna tshogs pa gzhan dang gzhan dag gis /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams la phan pa dang / gnod pa sgrub par byed pa'i las sna tshogs pa gzhan dang gzhan dag gis /
translated: In this way, the various karmas that bring about benefit and harm to sentient beings

original: 'byung ba'i rdul phra rab re re dang / skad cig ma re re gzhan dang gzhan dag ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyu yin no //üîΩde ltar ma yin na 'byung ba mtshungs kyang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rdul phra rab re re dang / skad cig ma re re gzhan dang gzhan dag ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyu yin no // de ltar ma yin na 'byung ba mtshungs kyang ci'i phyir /
translated: cause each of the subtle particles of the elements and each moment of the elements to be the cause of the various forms, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa ma yin zhes brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa ma yin zhes brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then even though the elements are the same, why are the forms, etc., not the same?üîΩThis is the same as the objection.

original: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin can de dag nyid kyi 'gyur ba'i khyad par mi rung ba'i phyir dang rgyu mtshan med par rang bzhin nyid las gyur pa yin na
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin can de dag nyid kyi 'gyur ba'i khyad par mi rung ba'i phyir dang rgyu mtshan med par rang bzhin nyid las gyur pa yin na
translated: Nor is the difference of form, etc. due to the difference in the nature of the elements, because it is not tenable that those elements which have no different natures have a difference in transformation, and because there is no reason for the nature itself to transform.

original: nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang gyur pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang gyur pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not tenable that it is definite, then it follows that it does not transform later on, just as it did not in the beginning.

original: gzugs sna tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni 'byung ba sna tshogs pa nyid yin no zhes gzhan gyis brtags pa yang rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni 'byung ba sna tshogs pa nyid yin no zhes gzhan gyis brtags pa yang rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable for others to imagine that the cause of the variety of forms is the variety of the elements.

original: de ltar na de dag gis khyad par yin pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gis khyad par yin pa na /
translated: Thus, if they are the cause,

original: thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa ma nges par brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa ma nges par brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: then the reductio and the reversal of the reductio are not to be stated without certainty.

original: gzhan yang rlung dang / bad kan dang / mkhris pa'i skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rlung dang / bad kan dang / mkhris pa'i skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang /
translated: Moreover, if there is a difference in the faults of wind, bile, and phlegm,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par med phyir rlung la sogs pa'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par med phyir rlung la sogs pa'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no difference between them with regard to passion, etc.

original: gang gis chos gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gis chos gang yin pa de ni /
translated: If something is a quality of something,

original: de'i khyad par yod na gdon mi za bar khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par yod na gdon mi za bar khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then when there is a difference in the former, there is a difference in the latter.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi yon tan yin pa de ni de'i khyad par yod na khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi yon tan yin pa de ni de'i khyad par yod na khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: That is, if something is a quality of something, then when there is a difference in the former, there is a difference in the latter.

original: dper na rlung gi khyad par yod na grang ba dang 'dar ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rlung gi khyad par yod na grang ba dang 'dar ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when there is a difference in the wind, there is a difference in cold, shivering, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos kyang @65b rlung la sogs pa'i skyon gyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos kyang @65b rlung la sogs pa'i skyon gyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The qualities of passion, etc. are the qualities of the faults of the wind, etc. This is a natural inference.

original: khyad par du 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i tshe de'i chos ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i tshe de'i chos ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin te /
translated: And if there is no difference in the latter, then there is no difference in the former.

original: gang zhig gang gi khyad bar yod na khyad par du mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i yon tan ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi khyad bar yod na khyad par du mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i yon tan ma yin te /
translated: That is, if something is a quality of something, then when there is no difference in the former, there is no difference in the latter.üîΩFor example, when there is no difference in the wind, there is no difference in cold, shivering, etc.

original: dper na me'i khyad par yod na grang ba nyid khyad par du mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i khyad par yod na grang ba nyid khyad par du mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when there is a difference in fire, cold is not a difference.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par yod na yang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par yod na yang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And when there is a difference in wind, etc., attachment, etc. are not a difference. This is a non-observation of a pervader.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na nyes pa'i rgyu can yin na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i gnas skabs thams cad kyi rgyu can ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na nyes pa'i rgyu can yin na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i gnas skabs thams cad kyi rgyu can ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even though it is a cause of faults, it is not a cause of all occasions of faults such as attachment.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: nyes par gyur pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu can dag yin te nad kyi khyad par bzhin no des na rang gi rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes par gyur pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu can dag yin te nad kyi khyad par bzhin no des na rang gi rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a cause of the difference of faults, like the difference of a disease. Therefore, it is not a cause of the difference that is its own cause.

original: skyon de'i gyur pa gzhan na yod na yang da las gzhan pa'i nyes pa de'i chos med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyon de'i gyur pa gzhan na yod na yang da las gzhan pa'i nyes pa de'i chos med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the fault is in another, then there is no property of that fault other than the fault.

original: de ltar na yang gcig ni khro ba can dang / shes rab can dang / rdul la sogs pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang gcig ni khro ba can dang / shes rab can dang / rdul la sogs pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one would not be angry, intelligent, or full of passion, etc.

original: gal te de dang de'i gyur pa'i khyad bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang de'i gyur pa'i khyad bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the difference is due to the transformation of the self,

original: yon tan thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir cig car shes rab dang khro ba la sogs pa mngon du gsal bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir cig car shes rab dang khro ba la sogs pa mngon du gsal bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that intelligence, anger, etc. would manifest simultaneously, because the difference that is the cause of all qualities would exist.

original: de dag ni de cam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de cam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they would have that as their cause alone, and there would be no other thing to which they are related.

original: gal te mkhris pa 'khrugs pa yod na sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa'i mkhris pa'i yon tan zhe sdang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te mkhris pa 'khrugs pa yod na sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa'i mkhris pa'i yon tan zhe sdang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: If you say that when there is a disturbance of bile, the quality of bile that is harmful due to suffering, anger arises,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: de ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad 'gyur ba yis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'gyur ba yis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is transformed by transformation.

original: ji ltar mkhris pa'i 'gyur bas gdungs pa'i skyes bu'i zhe sdang dang / de bzhin du rlung dang bad kan gyi yang 'gyur bas 'gyur ba las zhe sdang 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar mkhris pa'i 'gyur bas gdungs pa'i skyes bu'i zhe sdang dang / de bzhin du rlung dang bad kan gyi yang 'gyur bas 'gyur ba las zhe sdang 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: Just as anger arises from the transformation of bile, so too would anger arise from the transformation of wind and phlegm.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i yon tan du yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i yon tan du yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But you do not assert that wind and so on are qualities of anger.

original: gal te thams cad kyi chos yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi chos yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If anger were a universal mental factor,

original: bad kan la sogs pa 'gyur ba na yang zhe sdang la sogs pa yod pas 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa 'gyur ba na yang zhe sdang la sogs pa yod pas 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: then it would not be contradictory to say that anger exists even when phlegm and so on are transformed.

original: @66a * // de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @66a * // de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: kun las skye ba'ang min te /
analyzed: kun las skye ba'ang min te /
translated: It is also not the case that anger arises from all three humors,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag kyang thams cad kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag kyang thams cad kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: because these afflictions such as attachment are not universal mental states.üîΩWhy? Because it would follow that attachment would be the same for all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na thams cad kyi 'dod chags mtshungs par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang rlung la sogs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na thams cad kyi 'dod chags mtshungs par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang rlung la sogs pa /
translated: This fault has already been explained.üîΩMoreover, if the cause of wind and so on

original: rgyu ni 'phel bar 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'phel bar 'gyur ba na //
translated: increases,

original: 'bras bu 'grib par mi rung ste //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grib par mi rung ste //
translated: it is not suitable for the result to decrease.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gti mug la sogs pa khyad par du mi 'gyur ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gti mug la sogs pa khyad par du mi 'gyur ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the results of wind and so on would not be different from delusion and so on.

original: ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: tsha ba la sogs bzhin te /
analyzed: tsha ba la sogs bzhin te /
translated: It is like heat and so on.

original: ji ltar mkhris pa la sogs pa 'phel ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar mkhris pa la sogs pa 'phel ba na /
translated: Just as when bile and so on increase,

original: tsha ba la sogs pa 'phel ba de ltar yid kyi yon tan yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ni skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang //
analyzed: tsha ba la sogs pa 'phel ba de ltar yid kyi yon tan yang 'phel bar 'gyur ro // 'di ni skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang //
translated: heat and so on increase, so too the qualities of the mind increase.

original: zhes bya ba'i gzhung btsugs pa yin na /üîΩgal te skyon rnams cha snyoms na yang 'dod chags la sogs pas 'gyur ba nyid srid pa'i phyir dang / cha mi snyoms pa la yang zhe sdang gi 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir dang / rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par yod na yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzhung btsugs pa yin na / gal te skyon rnams cha snyoms na yang 'dod chags la sogs pas 'gyur ba nyid srid pa'i phyir dang / cha mi snyoms pa la yang zhe sdang gi 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir dang / rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par yod na yang /
translated: This is the established text of ‚ÄúEven if the faults have differences,‚ÄùüîΩbut if the faults are equal, it is possible that attachment and so on will increase, and if they are not equal, it is possible that aversion will increase, and even if there is a difference in wind and so on, attachment and so on will become different.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par du gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par du gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: the reason is not established.

original: ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs /
translated: It is like this: Attachment and so on

original: 'gyur ba na yang bde sogs skyed //
