analyzed: 'gyur ba na yang bde sogs skyed //
translated: and when they change, they generate pleasure and so on.

original: khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa las nang gi reg bya'i khyad par gyi don phan 'dogs par byed pa dang de las gzhan pa'i rjes su byed pas bde ba'am /
analyzed: khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa las nang gi reg bya'i khyad par gyi don phan 'dogs par byed pa dang de las gzhan pa'i rjes su byed pas bde ba'am /
translated: From the homogeneous state of the elements and so on, the specific internal tactile objects that benefit and those that are other than that arise.

original: sdug bsngal lam 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba las skyes pa la yin gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal lam 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba las skyes pa la yin gyi /
translated: Thus pleasure, pain, attachment and so on arise from pleasure and so forth.

original: nyes pa las skye ba ma yin pa de ltar na grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa las skye ba ma yin pa de ltar na grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on do not arise from faults.

original: gal te bad kan la sogs pa 'phel pa na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel par mi 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gal te bad kan la sogs pa 'phel pa na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel par mi 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: If attachment and so on do not increase when phlegm and so on increase,

original: de'i rgyu can nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can nyid yin na yang /
translated: then even though they are its cause,üîΩfaults do not generate attachment and so on.üîΩIf attachment and so on arise from faults,üîΩthen suffering arises from suffering.

original: nyes pa cha mi mnyam pa las skyes pa ni sdug bsngal yin la cha mi mnyam pa las skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'dod chags skyed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa cha mi mnyam pa las skyes pa ni sdug bsngal yin la cha mi mnyam pa las skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'dod chags skyed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If suffering arises from an imbalance of the elements,üîΩthen attachment and so on arise from suffering.üîΩIf attachment and so on arise from pleasure,üîΩthen pleasure arises from faults.

original: de ni cha mi mnyam skyes sdug bsngal gyis //
analyzed: de ni cha mi mnyam skyes sdug bsngal gyis //
translated: It is the suffering of the unequalled.

original: gal te 'dod chags mi skyed na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags mi skyed na //
translated: If passion is not produced,üîΩthen why is passion produced in that way?

original: 'o na de ltar yin na rgyu @66b cis 'dod chags de skyed pa smros shig / gzhan gyis cha mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar yin na rgyu @66b cis 'dod chags de skyed pa smros shig / gzhan gyis cha mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The other says, ‚ÄúFrom the equalized elements, etc.

original: nyes pa cha mnyam pa'i rgyu las khu ba 'phel zhing khu ba de las 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni go rims yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa cha mnyam pa'i rgyu las khu ba 'phel zhing khu ba de las 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni go rims yin no //
translated: The order is: from the cause of the equalized faults, semen increases; from that semen, passion increases.

original: nyes pa mi mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul par ston par byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa mi mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul par ston par byed do //
translated: He shows the error in the statement, ‚ÄúFrom the unequalized faults, etc.

original: nyes mi mnyam la'ang ches shin tu //
analyzed: nyes mi mnyam la'ang ches shin tu //
translated: Even in the unequalized faults,

original: chags pa can 'ga' zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: chags pa can 'ga' zhig mthong ngo //
translated: one sees some very passionate.

original: des na khams cha mnyam pa las 'dod chags ma yin no //
analyzed: des na khams cha mnyam pa las 'dod chags ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, passion is not from the equalized elements.

original: nyes pa rnams cha mnyam pa la yang gzhan pa mthong /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams cha mnyam pa la yang gzhan pa mthong /
translated: One sees others with the equalized faults,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis chags pa chung ba can gang yin pa chags pa can du'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis chags pa chung ba can gang yin pa chags pa can du'o //
translated: but some have a nature of little passion.

original: shin tu yul brten pas khu ba zad pa'i rgyu las phyir skyes bu shin tu chags pa can gzhan la khrag 'dzag pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: shin tu yul brten pas khu ba zad pa'i rgyu las phyir skyes bu shin tu chags pa can gzhan la khrag 'dzag pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: But one sees that another man who is not very passionate has an emission of blood due to the cause of the exhaustion of blood.

original: gzhan khu ba shin tu mang ba tsan yang chags pa can ma yin pa de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan khu ba shin tu mang ba tsan yang chags pa can ma yin pa de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, passion, etc., do not have as their causal-sign the humors in a state of equilibrium, etc.,

original: de yod na yod pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not occur when the latter are present.

original: sbyor pa ni gang yod kyang gang mi 'gyur zhing gang med kyang 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor pa ni gang yod kyang gang mi 'gyur zhing gang med kyang 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: That which does not occur when something is present and does occur when it is absent is not caused by it,

original: dper na chu yod kyang mi 'gyur zhing med na yang 'gyur ba'i sgron ma 'di ni chu'i rgyu can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu yod kyang mi 'gyur zhing med na yang 'gyur ba'i sgron ma 'di ni chu'i rgyu can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the light of a lamp is not caused by the presence of water, even though it may be present, and is not caused by the absence of water, even though that may be absent.

original: 'ga' zhig gi 'dod chags kyang khams snyoms pa dang / khu ba 'phel ba yod na yang mi 'gyur zhing med na yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi 'dod chags kyang khams snyoms pa dang / khu ba 'phel ba yod na yang mi 'gyur zhing med na yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: gzhan yang bud med gcig la khu nges med /
analyzed: gzhan yang bud med gcig la khu nges med /
translated: Moreover, there is no certainty of semen in a single woman.

original: bud med la la la de'i khu ba so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med la la la de'i khu ba so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no certainty of semen in a single woman.

original: de'i phyir bud med gcig la so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir bud med gcig la chags pa drag mi 'gyur na yang 'ga' zhig la nges par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bud med gcig la so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir bud med gcig la chags pa drag mi 'gyur na yang 'ga' zhig la nges par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no certainty of semen in a single woman, attachment to a single woman is not due to semen.

original: de pas na 'dod chags kyi rgyu khu pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de pas na 'dod chags kyi rgyu khu pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, semen is not the cause of attachment.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang nges pa med na yang nges par 'gyur ba de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang nges pa med na yang nges par 'gyur ba de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If something occurs even when something else is absent, then the former is not caused by the latter.

original: chu nges pa med par s'a lu'i sa bon la nges pa'i s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu nges pa med par s'a lu'i sa bon la nges pa'i s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a rice sprout occurs even when water is absent.

original: 'dod chags kyang khu ba nges pa med na yang nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang khu ba nges pa med na yang nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Attachment is also certain even when semen is not certain. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de ltar @67a * //
analyzed: de ltar @67a * //
translated: This is so,

original: ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te gzugs sogs kyang yan lag //
analyzed: ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te gzugs sogs kyang yan lag //
translated: but if form and so on are also limbs,

original: khu ba nges pa med na yang nges par 'dod chags skye ba yin te /
analyzed: khu ba nges pa med na yang nges par 'dod chags skye ba yin te /
translated: attachment arises as certain even when semen is not certain,

original: gzugs dang nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because form, enjoyment, and so on are co-producing causes.

original: min te kun la nges phyir ro //
analyzed: min te kun la nges phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is certain in all.

original: skyes bu khu pa mtshungs pa can dag gi nang nas gcig cig gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bud med la 'dod pa spyod pa na gzhan de nyid la rnam par sdang ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu khu pa mtshungs pa can dag gi nang nas gcig cig gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bud med la 'dod pa spyod pa na gzhan de nyid la rnam par sdang ba yin no //
translated: Among men with equal semen, when one engages in sexual intercourse with a woman endowed with qualities such as form, another abhors her.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa nges par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa nges par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If form and so on were to make it certain,

original: nges pa med par yang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nges pa med par yang mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not be uncertain.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'dod chags 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'dod chags 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Attachment does not arise due to the reason of form, etc.

original: 'dod chags can dag gi 'ga' zhig gi tshe bud med kyi yul nges pa med pa can gyi 'dod chags kyang spyir 'byung bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags can dag gi 'ga' zhig gi tshe bud med kyi yul nges pa med pa can gyi 'dod chags kyang spyir 'byung bar mthong ngo //
translated: For, in the case of those who are attached, attachment to a particular woman is seen to arise in general even when the object is uncertain.

original: gang gis bud med 'ga' zhig gi gzugs la sogs pa la kun du rtog par byed cing 'dod chags kyis gdungs pa de ni ma bsams par phrad pa gzugs ngan pa can dang lhan cig spyod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i
analyzed: gang gis bud med 'ga' zhig gi gzugs la sogs pa la kun du rtog par byed cing 'dod chags kyis gdungs pa de ni ma bsams par phrad pa gzugs ngan pa can dang lhan cig spyod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i
translated: If one imagines that attachment arises due to the conception of the form, etc. of a particular woman, then one would not engage in intercourse with an ugly woman without thinking about it, but one does.

original: phyir rgyu thams cad 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rgyu thams cad 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all causes are confused.

original: gal te khu ba'i gzugs tsam gyis lhan cig byed pas kyang 'dod chags 'gyur ba de'i tshe yon tan mi 'dzin can gyi'ang 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te khu ba'i gzugs tsam gyis lhan cig byed pas kyang 'dod chags 'gyur ba de'i tshe yon tan mi 'dzin can gyi'ang 'gyur /
translated: If attachment arises due to the mere form of semen, then attachment would arise even in those who do not grasp her good qualities.

original: skyes bu gtsang ma'i 'du shes dang bral ba so sor btags pa la sogs pa'i stobs dang ldan du zin kyang bud med gzugs dang ldan pa la yang 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gtsang ma'i 'du shes dang bral ba so sor btags pa la sogs pa'i stobs dang ldan du zin kyang bud med gzugs dang ldan pa la yang 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if a man has the power of imagination, etc., and is devoid of the notion of purity with respect to the woman, still passion arises for a woman who has a beautiful form.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang khu ba yod du zin khyad gtsang ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba mi skye ba de ltar na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang khu ba yod du zin khyad gtsang ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba mi skye ba de ltar na /
translated: For, even if form and semen exist, passion does not arise for one who is devoid of the notion of purity, etc.

original: 'dod chags ni de tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni de tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin no //
translated: Thus, passion is not caused by that alone.

original: spyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: spyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which does not occur when something exists is not caused by that alone.

original: dper na sa yod du zin kyang myu gu med pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa yang gzugs dang khu ba la sogs pa dag yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na sa yod du zin kyang myu gu med pa lta bu'o // 'dod chags la sogs pa yang gzugs dang khu ba la sogs pa dag yod du zin kyang /
translated: For example, even if earth exists, a sprout does not occur.üîΩAnd even if form and semen exist, passion, etc., do not occur for one who has the notion of impurity, etc.

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes can mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes can mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: gal te yon tan 'dzin de yang //
analyzed: gal te yon tan 'dzin de yang //
translated: If he grasps her qualities,

original: yan lag @67b yin na /
analyzed: yan lag @67b yin na /
translated: If it is a part,

original: gal te de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: then it is so, but

original: yon tan 'dzin pa yang 'dod chags skye ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur 'dod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan 'dzin pa yang 'dod chags skye ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur 'dod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: if you assert that apprehending good qualities is the co-originating cause of the generation of attachment, then it is merely establishing what is already established.üîΩIn that case, all beings

original: de'i tshe skyes bu thams cad dag / yon tan 'dzin pa can 'gyur ro //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes bu thams cad dag / yon tan 'dzin pa can 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: would be apprehenders of good qualities.üîΩWhy?

original: rgyu la khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the cause.

original: gzugs sam khu pa 'am gzhan 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid yon tan 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa yin pa de ltar na thams cad yon tan 'dzin pa can nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzugs sam khu pa 'am gzhan 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid yon tan 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa yin pa de ltar na thams cad yon tan 'dzin pa can nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: That which is taught to be the cause of attachment, whether it is form, smell, or something else, is not different from the cause of apprehending good qualities. In that case, all would be apprehenders of good qualities.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba can nam /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba can nam /
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, as explained, attachment and so on do not arise from apprehending good qualities.

original: yon tan 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not apprehenders of good qualities.

original: ci ste mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes skal pa mi mnyam pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir thams cad yon tan 'dzin pa can ma yin no zhes 'dod na /üîΩ'o na de'i tshe skal pa mnyam pa'i yang bdag dang bdag gir ltar ba'i rjes su 'brel ba'i sems la ltos nas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gyur ba de ltar na rigs mthun sngon du song ba'i 'jug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod pa cung zad
analyzed: ci ste mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes skal pa mi mnyam pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir thams cad yon tan 'dzin pa can ma yin no zhes 'dod na / 'o na de'i tshe skal pa mnyam pa'i yang bdag dang bdag gir ltar ba'i rjes su 'brel ba'i sems la ltos nas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gyur ba de ltar na rigs mthun sngon du song ba'i 'jug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod pa cung zad
translated: But if you maintain that the perception of impurity, etc., is not a universal because it is a state of dissimilar type,

original: kyang med do //
analyzed: kyang med do //
translated: then at that time, desire, etc., would be related to the mind that is associated with the view of self and mine in a state of similar type. Thus, there would be no disagreement with our position that the mind is engaged in the present through having been of a similar type in the past.

original: gal te nyes pa'i rang bzhin las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te nyes pa'i rang bzhin las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If desire, etc., arise from a nature that is faulty,

original: gnas skabs can gang chags can 'dod //
analyzed: gnas skabs can gang chags can 'dod //
translated: then why does a lustful person desire a state that is impure?

original: pad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu de 'dra ste /
analyzed: pad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu de 'dra ste /
translated: A person who is by nature a lustful person is like that.

original: khro ba las bzlog pa 'dod chags kyang rang bzhin nyid la gnas pa zhe sdang can mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro ba las bzlog pa 'dod chags kyang rang bzhin nyid la gnas pa zhe sdang can mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Desire is not a lustful person who abides in a nature that is opposite to anger.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / de'i ngo bo mtshungs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / de'i ngo bo mtshungs pa med phyir ro //
translated: because there is no similarity of nature between desire and hatred.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba de'i phyir zhe sdang dang / 'gal ba dang / 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bad kan gyi ming can yang yin pa de la gnas pa'i zhe sdang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba de'i phyir zhe sdang dang / 'gal ba dang / 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bad kan gyi ming can yang yin pa de la gnas pa'i zhe sdang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are contradictory, therefore, hatred does not exist in one who is of the nature of desire, which is contradictory to hatred.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin la gnas pa de ni de'i skyed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin la gnas pa de ni de'i skyed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: when one who is of the nature of something that is contradictory to the arising of something else exists, then the latter does not arise.

original: dper na me grang ba'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me grang ba'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire does not arise from cold.

original: skyes bu 'di yang zhe sdang dang 'gal ba 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal pa dmigs pa'o//
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang zhe sdang dang 'gal ba 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal pa dmigs pa'o//
translated: And this person exists in the nature of desire, which is contradictory to hatred. This is the observation of a contradiction that is a special reason.

original: @68a * // de la gnas pa'i zhe sdang 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: @68a * // de la gnas pa'i zhe sdang 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: Hatred does not exist in one who is of that nature.

original: 'di la nges pa mthong mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa mthong mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not see the certainty in this.

original: rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not conceive of it.

original: gang zhig gi tshe de'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / yang phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gi tshe de'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / yang phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa yin no //
translated: When one is in the nature of attachment, aversion, jealousy, miserliness, etc.,

original: rang bzhin gnyis ka 'dus pa las gnyi ga 'jug par rtog pa yang 'jug pa mtshungs par thal bas gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis ka 'dus pa las gnyi ga 'jug par rtog pa yang 'jug pa mtshungs par thal bas gsal ba yin no //
translated: The theory that both are engaged by the combination of both natures is also clear, because the consequence is that engagement is the same.

original: gal te ji ltar mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las byung ba can gyi rdul la sogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jug pa dang ldog pa de dag dang 'dra bar 'di la yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las byung ba can gyi rdul la sogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jug pa dang ldog pa de dag dang 'dra bar 'di la yang yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that just as the engagement and withdrawal of certain things such as the particles that arise from the nature of bile are like that, so it is here,

original: de ni ma yin te mtshungs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te mtshungs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because there is no similarity.

original: tsha ba dang grang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas /
analyzed: tsha ba dang grang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas /
translated: The existence and nonexistence of the particles, etc., depend on some other reason, such as heat or cold.

original: rdul la sogs pa dag gi yod pa dang med pa ni rgyu mtshan ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rdul la sogs pa dag gi yod pa dang med pa ni rgyu mtshan ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The existence and nonexistence of the particles, etc., are just as the reason is, and thus

original: de dag gi 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: it is reasonable that they engage and withdraw.

original: 'dir yang yid las byung ba dag gi rgyu ji skad du bstan pa med par gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'gags byed pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'dir yang yid las byung ba dag gi rgyu ji skad du bstan pa med par gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'gags byed pa gang yin /
translated: Here, too, the cause of the mental creations is not taught to be anything other than what has been taught, so what is it that ceases?

original: ci ste 'di la yang kun du rtog pa yang yan lag nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba de'i tshe kun du rtog pa yang bdag dang bdag gi dang / gtsang ba dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ming can gyi mtshan nyid kyi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'di la yang kun du rtog pa yang yan lag nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba de'i tshe kun du rtog pa yang bdag dang bdag gi dang / gtsang ba dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ming can gyi mtshan nyid kyi sa bon yin no //
translated: If you imagine that imagination itself is a limb, then imagination is the seed of the characteristics of the names of self, being mine, purity, and happiness.

original: nyes pa tsam las 'jug pa can 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin pa de ltar na de dag gi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa tsam las 'jug pa can 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin pa de ltar na de dag gi chos ma yin no //
translated: But desire and so on are not the cause of faults alone. Thus they are not the dharmas of the ƒÅryas.

original: gal te gang yang de skad du smra ba de'i yang nyes pa 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang yang de skad du smra ba de'i yang nyes pa 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If someone were to say this, would not the fault just mentioned apply to him as well?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: No, it would not.

original: mtshungs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no similarity.

original: gang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni nyes pa'i rgyu can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni nyes pa'i rgyu can ma yin no //
translated: Desire and so on are not the cause of faults.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then are they?

original: rigs mthun bag chags khyad par la //
analyzed: rigs mthun bag chags khyad par la //
translated: The arising of attachment, etc.

original: rags las pas ni 'jug pa can //
analyzed: rags las pas ni 'jug pa can //
translated: is due to the special development of concordant latent impressions.üîΩThose attachments, etc. that arise in dependence on the special cause of the view of self and of being, are activated by the development of the latent impressions of the various other consciousnesses.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba rigs mthun pa dang rgyu'i khyad par de la ltos nas 'jug cing skye ba yod pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pa gzhan dang gzhan bag chags rab tu sad par byed
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba rigs mthun pa dang rgyu'i khyad par de la ltos nas 'jug cing skye ba yod pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pa gzhan dang gzhan bag chags rab tu sad par byed
translated: When the conditions are close at hand, they arise.

original: pa dag gis rab tu sad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dag gis rab tu sad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are not close at hand, they do not arise.

original: gang gi tshe rkyen thag nye ba de'i tshe 'gyur ba @68b gang yin de'i de skad du smra ba'i ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon de dag du thal ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen thag nye ba de'i tshe 'gyur ba @68b gang yin de'i de skad du smra ba'i ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon de dag du thal ba med do //
translated: Thus, the faults that we explained earlier do not follow for those who maintain that the arising of attachment, etc. is due to the development of latent impressions.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin pa bsal ma thag pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin pa bsal ma thag pa /
translated: We have just refuted the assertion that attachment, etc. are properties of the elements, such as wind.

original: des ni 'byung ba'i chos nyid bkag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: des ni 'byung ba'i chos nyid bkag par rig par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that we have also refuted the assertion that the elements are the properties of attachment, etc.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faults of wind, etc. are the intrinsic nature of the elements.

original: dper na rlung dang me dang / chu dag gi chos 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rlung dang me dang / chu dag gi chos 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the qualities of wind, fire, and water are not desire and so on.

original: rten yang bkag pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: rten yang bkag pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: The support is also refuted.

original: yod med rten yang min phyir ro //
analyzed: yod med rten yang min phyir ro //
translated: Because the support of the existent and the non-existent is also not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kyi rten bsal zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kyi rten bsal zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has already been refuted that the mind has a support, as stated in the lines:üîΩ‚ÄúThe support is also refuted.üîΩBecause the support of the existent and the non-existent is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rten nyid yin pa bsal ba nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rten nyid yin pa bsal ba nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the support for the arising of desire and so on is also refuted.

original: yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: yang mi brjod do //
translated: I will not elaborate further.

original: de dag kyang 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i 'byung ba dngos por gyur pa khas blangs nas rten ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i 'byung ba dngos por gyur pa khas blangs nas rten ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: They say that the elements are not the support because they accept that the elements are real entities that are different from form and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag las 'byung ba'i rdzas gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa cung zad kyang med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag las 'byung ba'i rdzas gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa cung zad kyang med pa de ltar na /
translated: If that were not so, then there would be no substance of the elements that is different or not different from form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: gang las de rten yin /
analyzed: gang las de rten yin /
translated: In that case, what is the support of the elements?

original: 'byung ba tsam yang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam yang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that the mere elements are included in the five sense bases such as form,

original: de kho na nyid mang po nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mang po nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that suchness would be manifold.

original: de ltar khas len na yang rnam par shes pa de tsam dag rten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas len na yang rnam par shes pa de tsam dag rten par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you accept that, consciousness would be supported by those elements.

original: 'di ltar mang po dag shes pa dag gcig gi bdag nyid kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mang po dag shes pa dag gcig gi bdag nyid kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to think that many consciousnesses are phenomena that are the same nature.

original: de ltar na sems de nying don gzhan nam don gzhan ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de ltar na sems de nying don gzhan nam don gzhan ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: In that case, mind would be either a different object or not a different object.

original: don gzhan nyid ma yin na ni /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid ma yin na ni /
translated: If it is not a different object,

original: ji ltar sems gzugs gcig gi bdag nyid du 'gyur pa yin pa de nyid sgra la sogs pa'i yang yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems gzugs gcig gi bdag nyid du 'gyur pa yin pa de nyid sgra la sogs pa'i yang yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then just as mind is the same nature as form, it would also be the same nature as sound and so on.

original: chos gcig las tha dad ba med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa gcig nyid du 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gcig las tha dad ba med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa gcig nyid du 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, because it would not be different from a single phenomenon, form and so on would be one. But that does not exist.

original: dbang po gcig gis gzugs la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gcig gis gzugs la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense faculty has faults such as form.

original: don gzhan nyid yin na yang gzugs la sogs ba ji snyed pa de'i 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa yang de snyed yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin na yang gzugs la sogs ba ji snyed pa de'i 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa yang de snyed yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If it were a different object, then just as there are many forms, there would be many consciousnesses that are the result of that form.

original: nan gyis de kho na nyid mang po nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩzhar @69a * //
analyzed: nan gyis de kho na nyid mang po nyid du 'gyur te / zhar @69a * //
translated: Thus, you would insist that reality is manifold.

original: la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this digression.

original: gal te 'byung ba dag la brten nas 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gnas pa yin no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir rten bkag na ji ltar khas blangs ba la gnod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dag la brten nas 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gnas pa yin no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir rten bkag na ji ltar khas blangs ba la gnod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you assert that derived form endures in dependence on the primary elements, how is your assertion not undermined by the refutation of support?

original: de ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: This does not undermine our assertion.

original: 'di ltar kho po cag ni /üîΩdkar po la sogs sa sogs la //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho po cag ni / dkar po la sogs sa sogs la //
translated: We do not assert thatüîΩthe primary elements

original: brten pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brten pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: are the support of form such as white.

original: 'byung ba reg bya'i bdag nyid dag las gzugs la sos pa skye bar 'dod pa gang yin pa der ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang 'bras bu dus tha dad pa de ltar na 'byung ba bzhir gyur pa la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa rten la gnasüîΩpa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba reg bya'i bdag nyid dag las gzugs la sos pa skye bar 'dod pa gang yin pa der ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang 'bras bu dus tha dad pa de ltar na 'byung ba bzhir gyur pa la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa rten la gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, form and so on do not exist in the primary elements as their support,

original: 'on kyang de dag las 'gyur pa de ltar ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag las 'gyur pa de ltar ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but they are transformations of the primary elements.

original: 'o na ji ltar na 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas pa zhes tha snyad du byed ce na de rgyur byas pa'i sgra dag kyang /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas pa zhes tha snyad du byed ce na de rgyur byas pa'i sgra dag kyang /
translated: If that is so, then how can you call the primary elements the cause of form and so on?

original: rgyu'i don yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu'i don yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term cause is used because

original: rten gyi don ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi don ma yin no //
translated: it does not mean support.

original: 'byung ba bzhi po rang rten dang // gzugs sogs tha dad med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi po rang rten dang // gzugs sogs tha dad med par ni //
translated: The four primary elements are the cause of form and so on,

original: gnas can phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas can phyir ro //
translated: because they are the basis of form and so on.

original: rgyu'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rten pa'i 'byung ba rnams rten yin par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rten pa'i 'byung ba rnams rten yin par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The primary elements are the cause of form and so on, because they are the basis of form and so on.

original: de bzhin rten nyid kyang yin par rtog pa la gal te /
analyzed: de bzhin rten nyid kyang yin par rtog pa la gal te /
translated: Likewise, if you imagine that the primary elements are the support,

original: 'byung ba dang rgyur byas ba'i gzugs de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin 'di yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rgyur byas ba'i gzugs de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin 'di yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time, the nature of those primary elements and the nature of the derivative form that is supported by them are ascertained as the nature of the support and the supported.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin nges pa med na rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo med pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi sems me rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin nges pa med na rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo med pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi sems me rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If their nature is not ascertained, then the support and the supported do not exist, and derivative form is not suitable as the mind.

original: de la yang de ltar rtog na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag gi lus rten ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang de ltar rtog na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag gi lus rten ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if you imagine that, then desire and so on are not the support of the body.

original: de ltar na gal te brten par 'gyur ba de'i tshe brtan pa'i ngo bor lus kyi bdag nyid can gyi rten yod na de dag kyang de bzhin du tha dad pa med par 'jug par gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te brten par 'gyur ba de'i tshe brtan pa'i ngo bor lus kyi bdag nyid can gyi rten yod na de dag kyang de bzhin du tha dad pa med par 'jug par gyur te /
translated: Thus, if they become the support, then at that time, if the support that is the nature of the body exists, they also engage in that way without being separate.

original: de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are ascertained as the nature of the support and the supported.

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba na //
translated: If they change in another way,

original: de'i rten nyid kyi rang bzhin med pas 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten nyid kyi rang bzhin med pas 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature as a basis would be destroyed.

original: 'jig pa med na ni sngar yang 'di'i rten nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa med na ni sngar yang 'di'i rten nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not destroyed, then it would follow that it was not a basis previously.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye ba de ltar na brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye ba de ltar na brten pa ma yin no //
translated: If something arises at some time, it is not a basis in that way.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan @69b cig tha dad par gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan @69b cig tha dad par gnas pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is different from something and coexists with it

original: de la rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor so sor nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor so sor nges pa ma yin te /
translated: is not ascertained as having the nature of a basis and something based on it,

original: dper na ba lang dang rta lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang rta lta bu'o //
translated: like a cow and a horse.üîΩAnd attachment, etc., are different from the elements.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'byung ba rnams dang tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'byung ba rnams dang tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te myos sogs nus pa bzhin //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te myos sogs nus pa bzhin //
translated: This is true, but

original: tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin /
translated: if attachment, etc., were different from the elements,üîΩlike the potency of intoxication,

original: chang tshar gyur pa la rdzas ldog pa med du zin kyang myos pa'i nus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chang tshar gyur pa la rdzas ldog pa med du zin kyang myos pa'i nus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the potency of intoxication would cease even though the potency of the substance has not ceased.

original: de ltar na nus pa chang la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa chang la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, since the potency is based on the beer, it is not ascertained.

original: ma nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not unascertained,

original: 'di ltar dngos las nus pa don gzhan dag ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos las nus pa don gzhan dag ma yin /
translated: because in this way the potency is not a different object from the thing.

original: chang la myos pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: chang la myos pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: The potency to generate the effect of intoxication exists in the beer itself, and it is not different from the beer.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

original: chang nyid yin te de'i 'bras bu byed pa nus pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chang nyid yin te de'i 'bras bu byed pa nus pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is the beer itself, because the potency to produce its effect is taught to be the beer itself.

original: gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de la de brten par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de la de brten par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is something does not depend on itself,

original: don dam pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni gzhi tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni gzhi tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ultimate basis of the dependent and that which is dependent is different.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni de dang lhan cig don dam par rten dang brten pa'i dngos pos ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni de dang lhan cig don dam par rten dang brten pa'i dngos pos ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: That which is something does not ultimately depend on itself as the basis and that which is based on the basis.

original: dper na rang gi bdag nyid dang myos pa'i nus pa de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rang gi bdag nyid dang myos pa'i nus pa de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the self of itself and the potency of intoxication itself.

original: myos pa'i nus pa yang chang nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: myos pa'i nus pa yang chang nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the potency of intoxication is also the very liquor itself.üîΩThis is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi chang gnas pa nyid ni myos pa'i nus pa ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi chang gnas pa nyid ni myos pa'i nus pa ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: This is true, but the very endurance of the liquor is the cessation of the potency of intoxication.

original: gang gnas pa na ldog pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid yin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gnas pa na ldog pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid yin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Since that which endures is not that which ceases, the reason is not established.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang gnas ba na ldog pa de ni de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang gnas ba na ldog pa de ni de nyid ma yin te /
translated: And what is the syllogism? Whatever endures is not that itself.

original: dper na pa lang gnas pa na rta ldog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pa lang gnas pa na rta ldog pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when an ox endures, a horse does not cease.üîΩAnd when the liquor endures, the potency of intoxication ceases.

original: chang gnas pa na yang myos pa'i nus pa ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chang gnas pa na yang myos pa'i nus pa ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: dngos 'jig 'gyur gyi chang zhes bya ba myos pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu'i bdag nyid tsha ba'i gnas skabs na med par 'gyur gyi rten gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos 'jig 'gyur gyi chang zhes bya ba myos pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu'i bdag nyid tsha ba'i gnas skabs na med par 'gyur gyi rten gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúdisintegration of the thing‚Äù is the state of heat that is the cause of the effect of intoxication. It does not exist when the thing is present, nor does it exist in the thing itself.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na tshang na ste myos pa'i nus pa yod par rung ba na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na tshang na ste myos pa'i nus pa yod par rung ba na /
translated: What is it like? It is like the heat of the thing when the capacity for intoxication is present.

original: brten pa de 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brten pa de 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The thing itself does not disintegrate.

original: de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo yin ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgtan tshigs @70a * //
analyzed: de dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo yin ba'i phyir ro // gtan tshigs @70a * //
translated: This is because the nature of the thing is to be the basis of the thing that is dependent on it.

original: ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: de bas na gal te nus pa ldog pa yin zhes 'dod pa de'i tshe chang las nus pa de gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na gal te nus pa ldog pa yin zhes 'dod pa de'i tshe chang las nus pa de gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, if you maintain that the capacity ceases, then the capacity of the thing is not different from the thing itself.

original: chang de nyid ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: chang de nyid ldog pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the thing itself ceases.

original: ci ste yang rten du gyur pa chang gnas pa nyid yin la nus pa ldog ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang rten du gyur pa chang gnas pa nyid yin la nus pa ldog ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you maintain that the thing itself, which is the basis, is present, while the capacity ceases, that is illogical.

original: myos pa'i nus pa dang 'brel par rung ba'i chang gnas ba na nus pa 'ga' zhig kyang ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: myos pa'i nus pa dang 'brel par rung ba'i chang gnas ba na nus pa 'ga' zhig kyang ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: and the potency of intoxication is not stopped when the potency of the alcohol is present.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang 'brel par rung ba ma tshang ba med pa'i ngo por gnas shing /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang 'brel par rung ba ma tshang ba med pa'i ngo por gnas shing /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is the potency of intoxication is not stopped when the alcohol is present, because it is not incomplete with regard to the state of being fit to be related to intoxication.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de gnas pa na de la brten pa ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de gnas pa na de la brten pa ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is in such a state is not stopped when it is present, because it is not incomplete with regard to the state of being fit to be related to intoxication.

original: dper na snga ma'i gnas skabs la myos pa'i nus pa de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snga ma'i gnas skabs la myos pa'i nus pa de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is just like the potency of intoxication in the former state.

original: phyis kyi chang yang myos pa'i nus pa dang ldan par rung ba ma tshang ba med par gnas pa'i ngang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyi chang yang myos pa'i nus pa dang ldan par rung ba ma tshang ba med par gnas pa'i ngang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The later alcohol is in a state of being not incomplete with regard to the state of being fit to be related to the potency of intoxication. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: The reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang yod na ldog pa de ni de nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i khyad par sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang yod na ldog pa de ni de nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i khyad par sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because it is not the case that whatever is stopped when something is present is that itself, and so on. This is not an establishment of a particular potency.

original: gang zhig kho na yin pa de ni de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las gtan tshigs grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig kho na yin pa de ni de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las gtan tshigs grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: The reason is established by the syllogism: ‚ÄúThat which is just this is not different from this.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄîThis is true, but

original: gal te de mtshungs she na /
analyzed: gal te de mtshungs she na /
translated: if it is the same,üîΩjust as the intoxicating power of alcohol is not a different object, in the same way, attachment and other mental factors are not different objects from the primary mind.

original: ji ltar chang las myos pa'i nus pa don gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba dag las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las 'byung ba yang don gzhan ma yin no zhe na de ni de ltar min te /
analyzed: ji ltar chang las myos pa'i nus pa don gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba dag las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las 'byung ba yang don gzhan ma yin no zhe na de ni de ltar min te /
translated: This is not so, because

original: 'byung sems tha dad nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung sems tha dad nyid phyir ro //
translated: the primary elements and mind are different.

original: 'byung ba dag las sems mtshan nyid tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag las sems mtshan nyid tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: The primary elements and mind are definitely different in their characteristics.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: snang ba tha dad can rtogs phyir //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad can rtogs phyir //
translated: Because of the understanding of different appearances.

original: lus dang sems dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa can gyi shes pa'i yul nyid yin no //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa can gyi shes pa'i yul nyid yin no //
translated: The body and mind are the objects of a cognition that has different aspects.

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe lus yul du mi byed pa na yul gzhan 'dzin pa can gyi rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig yang dag par rig par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe lus yul du mi byed pa na yul gzhan 'dzin pa can gyi rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig yang dag par rig par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when the body is not the object, some consciousness that apprehends another object is cognized.

original: rang gi yul kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi yul kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par mi snang ngo //
translated: At that time, the body does not appear in the aspect of its own object, which is the particular color, shape, etc.

original: yang gang gi tshe lus yul du byed pa de'i tshe lus zlum pa dang ring ba'i rnam par snang ste /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe lus yul du byed pa de'i tshe lus zlum pa dang ring ba'i rnam par snang ste /
translated: But when the body is the object, at that time the body appears in the aspect of round or long, etc.

original: de'i tshe lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa nyid nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa nyid nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the aspect of the body and the aspect of mental consciousness are experienced as different.

original: lhan cig dmigs pa yang yul dang yul can nyid du @70b 'gyur na de ni gzhan gyi lus la yang yod pa yin na /
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa yang yul dang yul can nyid du @70b 'gyur na de ni gzhan gyi lus la yang yod pa yin na /
translated: And the simultaneous observation of the two would make them object and subject, but that is not the case with another‚Äôs body.

original: de yang dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyi rten ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyi rten ma yin no //
translated: And that is not the basis of the mind that observes it.

original: de bas na rang gi lus dang rnam par shes pa dag ni snang ba tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi lus dang rnam par shes pa dag ni snang ba tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body and consciousness are different, because they are perceived by consciousnesses that have different appearances.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang snang ba tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas bzung ba de dag ni dngos su tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang snang ba tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas bzung ba de dag ni dngos su tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The application of the reason is as follows: Whatever are perceived by consciousnesses that have different appearances are actually different,

original: dper na me'i gzugs dang rlung gi reg bya lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i gzugs dang rlung gi reg bya lta bu'o //
translated: like the form of fire and the tactility of wind.

original: lus dang sems dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang snang pa tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung par bya ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus dang sems dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang snang pa tha dad pa can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung par bya ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The body, mind, and the collection of attachment, etc., are perceived by consciousnesses that have different appearances. This is the natural reason.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan du na 'dis yul snang bar byed cing gsal bar byed pas na snang ba ste dbang po'o //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan du na 'dis yul snang bar byed cing gsal bar byed pas na snang ba ste dbang po'o //
translated: Moreover, in another way, it is an appearance because it illuminates and makes manifest its object. The sense faculty is that.

original: tha dad pa yang de yin pas na snang ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang de yin pas na snang ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is different because it is that. Therefore, it is different appearances.

original: dbang po tha dad pas rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pas rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is cognized by different faculties.

original: dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is apprehended by different faculties.

original: lus kyang dbang po gzhan gyis yul du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: lus kyang dbang po gzhan gyis yul du byas pa yin la /
translated: The body is also the object of another faculty,

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan nyid kyis yin pa de ltar na tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan nyid kyis yin pa de ltar na tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: and consciousness is the object of another faculty. Thus, they are different.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gis dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa de dang de ni dngos su bdag nyid tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gis dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa de dang de ni dngos su bdag nyid tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is apprehended by different faculties is actually different in self-existence,

original: dper na me'i gzugs dang rlung gi reg bya lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i gzugs dang rlung gi reg bya lta bu'o //
translated: like the form of fire and the tactility of wind.

original: lus dang sems dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus dang sems dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The collection of body, mind, and attachment, etc. is apprehended by different faculties. This is a natural inference.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa dag gis gzung bar bya ba'i rdzas gcig med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs snga ma ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa dag gis gzung bar bya ba'i rdzas gcig med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs snga ma ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: because there is no single substance that is apprehended by both seeing and touching.

original: gal te yang dbang po drug pa mi 'dod pa de ltar na yang gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa'i sgrub bar byed pa 'ga' zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yang dbang po drug pa mi 'dod pa de ltar na yang gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa'i sgrub bar byed pa 'ga' zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: Even if you do not accept a sixth sense faculty, you must still state some proof for consciousness.

original: de yang shes pa sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang shes pa sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And if that proof is a different proof for consciousness,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don du 'gyur ba yin na zhen pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don du 'gyur ba yin na zhen pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then what is the use of asserting a sixth sense faculty?

original: gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin par bsam par bya'o //
translated: You should consider that the second reason is also unestablished.

original: yang na snang ba tha dad can rtogs phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang la snang ba tha dad pa des rtogs pa'i phyir te /üîΩbdag nyid dang gzhan dag gi mngon sum yid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes @71a * //
analyzed: yang na snang ba tha dad can rtogs phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang la snang ba tha dad pa des rtogs pa'i phyir te / bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gi mngon sum yid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes @71a * //
translated: Or, because of the apprehension of different appearances means because of the apprehension of different appearances by a person.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is the direct perception of oneself and others.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: sems ni bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yin zhing /
analyzed: sems ni bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yin zhing /
translated: The mind is directly perceived by the self.

original: lus ni bdag nyid dang skyes bu'i khyad par gzhan gyi yang mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: lus ni bdag nyid dang skyes bu'i khyad par gzhan gyi yang mngon sum yin no //
translated: The body is directly perceived by the self and by others.

original: gal te yang sems lus las tha dad par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang sems lus las tha dad par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If the mind were not different from the body,

original: gzhan gyis gzhan gyi lus bzung ba na lus bzhin du de dang 'brel ba can gyi sems kyang bzung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan gyi lus bzung ba na lus bzhin du de dang 'brel ba can gyi sems kyang bzung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then when one person grasps the body of another, the mind of the first person would grasp the body of the second person, just as the body is grasped.

original: sems bzhin du lus kyang ma bzung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems bzhin du lus kyang ma bzung par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, the body of the second person would not be grasped, just as the mind is not grasped.

original: de dag gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are one.

original: sems nyid ni gzung par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems nyid ni gzung par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The mind itself is not ungraspable by nature,

original: bdag nyid kyis de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it grasps itself.üîΩEven if it were graspable, it would not be conceived as being different from the body.

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang gzhan nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir rtog pa ma yin no zhes 'dod na gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi lus kyang ma bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang gzhan nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir rtog pa ma yin no zhes 'dod na gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi lus kyang ma bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the body of another person would not be grasped.

original: de bas na tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are different.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yin pa dang / gang zhig bdag dang gzhan gyi mngon sum gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yin pa dang / gang zhig bdag dang gzhan gyi mngon sum gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The argument is this: that which is the direct perception of oneself and that which is the direct perception of oneself and others are mutually different.

original: dper na rang nyid kyis mkhal ma'i zug gzer nyams su myong ba dang / zlos gar mkhan lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rang nyid kyis mkhal ma'i zug gzer nyams su myong ba dang / zlos gar mkhan lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one‚Äôs own experience of the pain of a kidney ailment and the experience of an actor.

original: bdag nyid kyi sems kyang bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems kyang bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yin zhing /
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is the direct perception of oneself.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: One‚Äôs own body is the direct perception of oneself and others. This is a natural inference.

original: gzhan yang gal te sems lus la brten par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sems lus la brten par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if the mind were to depend on the body,

original: lus 'gyur ba'i bar du yang /
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba'i bar du yang /
translated: then the mind would be impermanent.

original: ji srid du ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rgyu mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs gcig la lus gnas pa gnas skabs gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rgyu mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs gcig la lus gnas pa gnas skabs gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin pa de srid du /
translated: As long as the body remains in the same condition as it was seen, without taking on another condition,

original: yid ngo bo mtshungs 'gyur te //
analyzed: yid ngo bo mtshungs 'gyur te //
translated: the mind would remain of the same nature.

original: de la brten pa'i gzugs sogs bzhin du /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i gzugs sogs bzhin du /
translated: Like the form that is based on it,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the mental consciousness would have only one aspect.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have a similar cause.

original: 'di ltar skad cig mar yul gzhan pa can nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig mar yul gzhan pa can nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it would engage in objects that are different in each moment.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi de'i tshe rten tha dad pa med na yang don gzhan dang gzhan yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi de'i tshe rten tha dad pa med na yang don gzhan dang gzhan yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then even if the basis is not different, the other objects would be its parts.

original: de'i phyir shes pa ni rnam pa gcig pa can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa ni rnam pa gcig pa can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, consciousness does not have only one aspect.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That also does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: In this way, conceptual thought

original: don gyi gzhan dbang can nyid gang rnam par @71b rtog pa phyi rol gyi don thag nye ba la ltos pa med pa can nye bar len pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi gzhan dbang can nyid gang rnam par @71b rtog pa phyi rol gyi don thag nye ba la ltos pa med pa can nye bar len pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: is dependent on objects. Conceptual thought that does not depend on external objects that are near arises by the power of grasping.

original: ji ltar na de dag gi lhan cig byed pa don yin zhing de so sor nges pa la sogs pa yang yin yang gang tshe lus la ltos med par shes ba skye ba /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag gi lhan cig byed pa don yin zhing de so sor nges pa la sogs pa yang yin yang gang tshe lus la ltos med par shes ba skye ba /
translated: When consciousness arises without depending on the body,üîΩthe latent ten dency of some consciousnesses

original: la la'i shes 'ga' bag chags dag / sad pa yi ni rgyur 'gyur pa //üîΩde'i tshe rgyu des na 'ga' zhig las 'ga' 'gyur /
analyzed: la la'i shes 'ga' bag chags dag / sad pa yi ni rgyur 'gyur pa // de'i tshe rgyu des na 'ga' zhig las 'ga' 'gyur /
translated: is the cause of awakening.üîΩAt that time, due to that cause, some consciousnesses would arise from some consciousnesses.

original: shes pa 'ga' zhig las de ma thag tu shes pa 'ga' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: shes pa 'ga' zhig las de ma thag tu shes pa 'ga' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since that is the case, there is no contradiction.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis sems can thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis sems can thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it established that sentient beings have no beginning,

original: snga na med pa'i sems can me skye ba yang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i sems can me skye ba yang grub pa yin te /
translated: but also it is established that sentient beings do not arise without a cause.

original: de ni rnam shes min pa'ang rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: de ni rnam shes min pa'ang rnam shes kyi //
translated: Because it is not consciousness,

original: nyer len min phyir grub pa yin //
analyzed: nyer len min phyir grub pa yin //
translated: it is established that it is not the substantial cause of consciousness.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang mi mthun pas mi skye zhing mthun pas kyang skye ba de ni de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang mi mthun pas mi skye zhing mthun pas kyang skye ba de ni de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: That which does not arise without something else and arises with it is the cause of that.

original: dper nas bon la sogs pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rdzas su byed pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper nas bon la sogs pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rdzas su byed pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a seed, etc. are the cause of a sprout, etc. which is similar to it and not similar to it.

original: phyis kyi shes pa yang sngar gyi shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dag gis skye ba dang mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyis kyi shes pa yang sngar gyi shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dag gis skye ba dang mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the subsequent consciousnesses are produced by the former consciousnesses which are similar to them and not similar to them. This is a natural inference.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness itself is the appropriator of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not non-consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo lus la sogs pa nye bar lan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo lus la sogs pa nye bar lan pa ma yin no //
translated: The body, etc. which are not consciousness are not the appropriator.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa ni rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa ni rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is not consciousness does not have the nature of the appropriator of consciousness.

original: sems can thog ma med pa yin pa de ltar na snga na med pa'i sems can rab tu skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thog ma med pa yin pa de ltar na snga na med pa'i sems can rab tu skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Since sentient beings are beginningless, sentient beings are not produced without a prior cause.

original: 'ang zhes bya pa'i sgras ni lus la sogs pa'i rgyu can nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya pa'i sgras ni lus la sogs pa'i rgyu can nyid yin na /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that if they were the cause of the body, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa cig car thal ba'i phyir yang sems can thog ma med pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa cig car thal ba'i phyir yang sems can thog ma med pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
translated: then attachment, etc., would be simultaneous.

original: gal te yang sems mngon par gsal ba can ma yin pa'i 'byung pa'am /üîΩrtsva la sogs pa glang po che'i bdag nyid yin pa las rnam par shes pa mi rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang sems mngon par gsal ba can ma yin pa'i 'byung pa'am / rtsva la sogs pa glang po che'i bdag nyid yin pa las rnam par shes pa mi rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yod pa yin no //
translated: But if the elements, which are not clearly manifest as mind,üîΩor grass, etc., which are of the nature of the elephant, have the capacity to produce consciousness,

original: rnam par shes nus ldan phyir te //üîΩrgyu'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma yin pa las rnam par shes pa mi @72a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes nus ldan phyir te // rgyu'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma yin pa las rnam par shes pa mi @72a * //
translated: then consciousness would arise from what is not its cause.üîΩBut this is unacceptable, because consciousness arises only from what is its cause.

original: 'byung ba zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de 'dod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de 'dod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: What we have said is that consciousness does not arise from what is not its cause.üîΩThis is what we accept.

original: de ni grub ba la sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni grub ba la sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: But this is not an argument, because it is not established.

original: de ltar na sems mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa can gyi 'byung ba rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar na sems mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa can gyi 'byung ba rnams la /
translated: Thus, the elements, which are not clearly manifest as mind,

original: nus pa'i ngo bor gnas par 'dod pa'i sems gang yin pa de ci mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems gang yin pa de de nyid yin nam 'on te gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: nus pa'i ngo bor gnas par 'dod pa'i sems gang yin pa de ci mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems gang yin pa de de nyid yin nam 'on te gzhan nyid yin /
translated: Is the mind that is asserted to exist in the form of a potential the same as the mind that exists in the manifest state or is it different?

original: rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la glang po che mngon par gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid nus pa'i gnas skabs na yin nam /
analyzed: rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la glang po che mngon par gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid nus pa'i gnas skabs na yin nam /
translated: Is the essence of the manifest elephants the same as the essence that exists in the potential state?

original: 'on te gzhan nyid yin grang na gal te gzhan nyid yin pa de'i tshe gzhan yod na de yod do zhes rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan nyid yin grang na gal te gzhan nyid yin pa de'i tshe gzhan yod na de yod do zhes rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If they are different, then it is not logical to say that when one exists, the other exists.

original: ci ste mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi sems dang glang po che'i ngo bo gang yin pa sems mngon par gsal ba can ma yin par mngon par 'dod 'dod pa'i 'byung ba rnams sam rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la de nyid yod pa yin no zhes
analyzed: ci ste mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi sems dang glang po che'i ngo bo gang yin pa sems mngon par gsal ba can ma yin par mngon par 'dod 'dod pa'i 'byung ba rnams sam rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la de nyid yod pa yin no zhes
translated: If you assert that the essence of the manifest mind and the essence of the manifest elephants are the same, then the elements or the tips of the ku≈õa grass, which are not minds that are manifest, would have to be the same as the manifest mind.

original: 'dod pa de dang de shin tu srid pa ma yin te blun pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa de dang de shin tu srid pa ma yin te blun pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This is not possible because it is absurd.

original: grangs can phyugs las gzhan /
analyzed: grangs can phyugs las gzhan /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya is like a cow.

original: ngo tsha bcas pa su brjod rtsol te 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: ngo tsha bcas pa su brjod rtsol te 'bad par byed do //
translated: The one who is ashamed makes effort, that is, he strives.

original: 'di ltar rtsva mchog rtsel glang chen brgya //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsva mchog rtsel glang chen brgya //
translated: Thus, a hundred elephants at the tip of a blade of grass

original: sngon chad ma mthong ba mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs de'i tshe na rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs par yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: sngon chad ma mthong ba mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs de'i tshe na rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs par yod do zhe'o //
translated: at the time when it is not manifest, that is, not seen before, it is said to exist without being perceived.

original: gal te de la yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo nyid dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de la yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo nyid dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed there, then its own nature would be perceived.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe gang la yod pa de ni de'i tshe de la rang gi ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe gang la yod pa de ni de'i tshe de la rang gi ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever exists at a certain time and place has its own nature at that time and place,

original: dper na mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems dang / glang po che brgya de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon par gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems dang / glang po che brgya de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the mind at the time of manifestation and those very hundred elephants.

original: glang po che brgya dang sems kyang rtsva mchog gi rtse mo dang / sems mngon par gsal ba can ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i 'byung pa'i khyad par rnams la yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: glang po che brgya dang sems kyang rtsva mchog gi rtse mo dang / sems mngon par gsal ba can ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i 'byung pa'i khyad par rnams la yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The minds of a hundred elephants are in the tips of the blades of grass, and the special elements that are not clearly manifest exist.

original: ngo bo gang zhig snang gyur pa //
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig snang gyur pa //
translated: That nature which appears

original: ngo bo de ni sngar mi snang /
analyzed: ngo bo de ni sngar mi snang /
translated: that nature did not appear before.
