original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi /üîΩrgyu ni lan brgyar rnam phye yang //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi / rgyu ni lan brgyar rnam phye yang //
translated: The nature of the elementsüîΩis not manifest in the body.üîΩThe nature of the elements is not manifest in the body, because the body is not a cause of the elements, just as the body of a living person is not a cause of the mind.

original: gson pa'i lus bzhin du sems dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa g-yo ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gson pa'i lus bzhin du sems dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa g-yo ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is not manifest in the body, because the body is not a cause of the mind, just as the body of a living person is not a cause of the mind.

original: rtsa ba'i bdag nyid can mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bdag nyid can mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: The nature that is not manifest in the state of the root, that is, in the state of the elements, is different from the nature that is manifest in the state of the body.

original: gzhan yod pa na @72b de yod do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa na @72b de yod do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: When the one exists, the other is not said to exist.

original: sbyor ba ni rnam grangs med par gang zhig gang gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ba de ni dngos su der 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rnam grangs med par gang zhig gang gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ba de ni dngos su der 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not of the nature of something else is not actually of the nature of that other thing.

original: dper na bde ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa can gyi sdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: dper na bde ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa can gyi sdug bsngal lam /
translated: For example, pain, which is not of the nature of pleasure,

original: me'i gzugs dang chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: me'i gzugs dang chu lta bu'o //
translated: or the form of fire, which is not of the nature of water.

original: nus par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang sems mngon par gsal ba'i ngo bo dang glang po brgya'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o /
analyzed: nus par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang sems mngon par gsal ba'i ngo bo dang glang po brgya'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o /
translated: And the thing that is asserted to be possible is not of the nature of a clear mind or of a hundred elephants. This is the observation of an internal contradiction in the pervader.

original: // / chad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / chad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on the ‚ÄúDifferentiation of the Middle and the Extremes‚Äù

original: bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: Eighteenth

original: de nyid yin pa snang ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar na ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yin pa snang ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar na ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were observed as it is in the state of appearance, it would not be unestablished.

original: de bas na thams cad rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, in order to prove that what is not consciousness is not the appropriator of consciousness because it is not of the nature of consciousness,

original: grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: But it is not the case that what is already established is established again.

original: gzhan yang gal te sems can thog ma med pa ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sems can thog ma med pa ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, if you do not accept that sentient beings are beginningless,

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what do you accept?

original: snga na med par rab tu skye ba de'i tshe snga na med pa 'byung ba la sems can khas len na /
analyzed: snga na med par rab tu skye ba de'i tshe snga na med pa 'byung ba la sems can khas len na /
translated: If you accept that sentient beings arise without a prior cause, then you are accepting that sentient beings arise without a prior cause.

original: rigs mthun pa la rag las pas 'jug pa can dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang lus kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa la rag las pas 'jug pa can dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang lus kyi chos yin no //
translated: But attachment and so on do not arise in dependence on a homogeneous continuum, but rather they are properties of the body.

original: de bas na ji ltar lus ni lag pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / chen po dang / chung du dang / sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i kha dog dang / de ma yin pa'i kha dog dang mig la sogs pa ma tshang ba med pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar lus ni lag pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / chen po dang / chung du dang / sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i kha dog dang / de ma yin pa'i kha dog dang mig la sogs pa ma tshang ba med pa'am /
translated: Therefore, just as the body is sometimes possessed of certain things such as arms and legs, and is sometimes not possessed of them, and just as the body is sometimes large, sometimes small, sometimes fair, and sometimes not fair, and just as the body is sometimes complete with eyes and so on, and sometimes not,

original: gzhan yin pas chos de dag skye ba nges pa med pa can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan yin pas chos de dag skye ba nges pa med pa can yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then the arising of these properties is not definite.

original: chags sogs nges med thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chags sogs nges med thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Attachment and so on would arise in the absence of a cause.

original: 'dod chags can dang ches 'dod chags can dang / ches shin tu 'dod chags can 'ba' zhig gi 'dod chags nyid kyi bar du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags can dang ches 'dod chags can dang / ches shin tu 'dod chags can 'ba' zhig gi 'dod chags nyid kyi bar du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The same applies to those who are greedy, very greedy, and extremely greedy.

original: de ltar na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / zas la sogs pa 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang ma byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / zas la sogs pa 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa brjod par bya'o // sbyor ba ni gang ma byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, pleasure, pain, joy, sorrow, desire for food, etc., hatred, envy, avarice, etc., and wisdom, etc., should be explained.

original: gang snga na med pa'i chos rnams dang / @73a * //
analyzed: gang snga na med pa'i chos rnams dang / @73a * //
translated: The application is that which arises from what has not yet arisen, and which did not exist previously.

original: sbyor ba de ni chos de dag dang ldan par nges par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba de ni chos de dag dang ldan par nges par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is that which is not definitely existent as possessing those phenomena which did not exist previously.

original: lus de nyid la dbang po dang / yan lag dang / nyid lag dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par nges pa med pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus de nyid la dbang po dang / yan lag dang / nyid lag dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par nges pa med pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the body itself, which is not definitely possessed of a particular sense faculty, limb, or member, color or shape.

original: snga na med pa'i skyes bu 'di yang mngal du snga na med par 'byung ba dang / snga na med pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i skyes bu 'di yang mngal du snga na med par 'byung ba dang / snga na med pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This person who has never existed before arises in the womb without having existed before, and is endowed with desire, etc. which have never existed before.

original: yang na gang dang gang lus kyi chos yin pa de dang de ni skye bar 'gyur ba nges par skye ba dang 'brel par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang dang gang lus kyi chos yin pa de dang de ni skye bar 'gyur ba nges par skye ba dang 'brel par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, whatever is a property of the body is not necessarily connected with the certainty of arising, with arising.

original: dper na dbang po dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the faculties, color, shape, limbs, members, etc.

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / zas la sogs pa 'dod pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa yang lus kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab bar byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / zas la sogs pa 'dod pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa yang lus kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab bar byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, desire for food, etc., and wisdom, etc. are properties of the body.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Desire, etc. have the nature of the cause of the elements.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid de las kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid de las kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: And from that which is the cause of desire and so on, the nature of the elements, no person at all is excluded,

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma 'das phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma 'das phyir te /
translated: because it is not excluded from the nature of the elements.

original: rgyu'i phyir des skyed pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir des skyed pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Because of the cause, he would possess desire and so on generated by that.

original: 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, no one at all would be free from desire and so on.üîΩIf you accept that all persons possess desire and so on,

original: gal te skyes bu thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod na zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod na zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: then the syllogism is:

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig rgyu'i ngang bzhin las ma 'das pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig rgyu'i ngang bzhin las ma 'das pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: With respect to the subject, the collection of causes, it is not tenable that it is the effect of itself, because it is not excluded from the nature of the cause,

original: dper na myu gu'i rgyu'i tshogs ni myu gu rgyu las ma 'das pa yin pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu'i rgyu'i tshogs ni myu gu rgyu las ma 'das pa yin pa de lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the collection of causes of a sprout is not excluded from the nature of the cause of a sprout.

original: skyes bu 'di yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This person also does not transcend the nature of a cause, such as attachment, and so on, and the nature of an element. This is a reason of nature.

original: skyes bu 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: skyes bu 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even though this person does not transcend the nature of an element,

original: 'di'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang dbang po la sogs pa lus kyi chos 'ga' zhig gi tshe med pa can nyid yin pas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang dbang po la sogs pa lus kyi chos 'ga' zhig gi tshe med pa can nyid yin pas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: his color, shape, faculties, and so on, which are the qualities of the body, are sometimes nonexistent. Therefore, this reason is indefinite.

original: de ltar na yang khas blangs @73b nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang khas blangs @73b nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even though this is so, we should state our position.

original: gal te 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das pa kun chags sogs ldan pa /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das pa kun chags sogs ldan pa /
translated: If one does not transcend the nature of an element, then one possesses attachment, and so on.

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, all are equal in attachment, because all attachment, and so on, are the nature of an element.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las rgyu khyad par can ma yin pa de ni de las khyad par ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las rgyu khyad par can ma yin pa de ni de las khyad par ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not a special cause from something is not a special effect from that,

original: dper na rgyu khyad par can ma yin pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu khyad par can ma yin pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, a sprout that does not have a special cause.

original: skyes bu gzhan rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rgyu khyad par can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rgyu khyad par can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And for other persons, desire, etc., also do not have a special cause. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal ta 'byung phul 'byung phyir min //
analyzed: gal ta 'byung phul 'byung phyir min //
translated: not because of the excellence of the elements.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa can nyid du ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa can nyid du ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Desire, etc., are similar, but

original: gal te 'byung ba phul du byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba phul du byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: if there is a special desire, etc., because of the excellence of the elements,

original: 'di ltar skyes bu gzhan du 'gyur ba can gyi 'byung ba rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phul du byung ba 'ga' zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de ltar na skyes bu gzhan rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa yang
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu gzhan du 'gyur ba can gyi 'byung ba rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phul du byung ba 'ga' zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de ltar na skyes bu gzhan rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa yang
translated: then, in the case of other persons, desire, etc., also are not the cause of the special elements, because they are not the cause of the special elements.

original: rgyu khyad par can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu khyad par can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is not a special cause‚Äù is not established.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe srog chags gang yin pa de la srog dang ldan pa dang / ches srog dang ldan pa dang / ches shin tu srog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe srog chags gang yin pa de la srog dang ldan pa dang / ches srog dang ldan pa dang / ches shin tu srog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If that were so, then there would be no difference between the living being and the one who possesses life, the one who possesses life to a greater degree, and the one who possesses life to a still greater degree.

original: 'byung rnams srog chags khyad par med na'ang /
analyzed: 'byung rnams srog chags khyad par med na'ang /
translated: If the elements are not different from the living being,

original: khyad par 'di rten can gang yin //
analyzed: khyad par 'di rten can gang yin //
translated: then what is the basis of this difference?

original: 'byung ba phul du byung ba la brten nas 'di chags pa can dang / ches chags pa can dang / ches shin tu chags pa can du 'gyur ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba phul du byung ba la brten nas 'di chags pa can dang / ches chags pa can dang / ches shin tu chags pa can du 'gyur ba gang yin pa /
translated: The one who is attached, the one who is more attached, and the one who is most attached are based on the excellence of the elements.

original: khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan /
analyzed: khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan /
translated: The reason for the difference isüîΩthe excellence of the elements.

original: des ni phul byung 'grib pa can /üîΩ'byung ba de nyams 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni phul byung 'grib pa can / 'byung ba de nyams 'gyur te /
translated: The elements that are excellentüîΩare diminished.

original: 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are destroyed.

original: gang las nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang las nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what are they diminished?

original: de yod pa las te /
analyzed: de yod pa las te /
translated: From their existence.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid las so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid las so //
translated: because of being endowed with attachment, etc.

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig skye bzhin pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig skye bzhin pa nyid ni /
translated: Thus, a certain one who is in the process of arising

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba la sogs pa med pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog dang ser sna dang bral ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba la sogs pa med pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog dang ser sna dang bral ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: is endowed with the absence of suffering, pleasure, etc., is free from attachment, and is free from hatred, envy, and avarice.

original: de ltar na @74a * //
analyzed: de ltar na @74a * //
translated: Thus,

original: gang zhig gang la 'phel ba dang ldan pa de ni rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa can rang gi 'bras bu yang nyams par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la 'phel ba dang ldan pa de ni rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa can rang gi 'bras bu yang nyams par byed de /
translated: that which is endowed with the increase of something is a thing that has an interrupted dharma and also causes the degeneration of its effect,

original: dper na 'byung ba rnams la dkar po dang / nag po dang / sngon bsangs la sogs pa'i kha dog rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba rnams la dkar po dang / nag po dang / sngon bsangs la sogs pa'i kha dog rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the elements are the cause of the increase and decrease of the colors white, black, blue, etc.

original: de ltar 'byung ba rnams la 'byung ba'i phul du byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad bar gyi 'bras bu can 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa rgyun chad pa'i chos srid pa can 'byung ba rnams bdag nyid med par 'gyur ba na 'dod chags nyid
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba rnams la 'byung ba'i phul du byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad bar gyi 'bras bu can 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa rgyun chad pa'i chos srid pa can 'byung ba rnams bdag nyid med par 'gyur ba na 'dod chags nyid
translated: Thus, when the elements, which are subject to increase and decrease, which are the cause of the special effects of passion, etc., and which are subject to birth and death, become devoid of self, passion itself

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ba' zhig kyang skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ba' zhig kyang skye par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be destroyed. Therefore, only the passionless will be born.

original: sbyor pa ni gang zhig gang la phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa de ni de la srid pa med pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor pa ni gang zhig gang la phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa de ni de la srid pa med pa can yin te /
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is subject to increase and decrease is not subject to birth and death.

original: dper na 'byung ba de dag nyid la dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba de dag nyid la dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the elements themselves are not subject to birth and death, but are the cause of the increase and decrease of the color white, etc.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yang phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yang phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cause of the passion, etc., of a person is also increase and decrease. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the case,üîΩbut it is not so in the case of the elements.

original: gal te tha dad kyang chags sogs //
analyzed: gal te tha dad kyang chags sogs //
translated: If, though distinct, attachment, etc.

original: rgyu mtshungs bdag nyid mi zad phyir min na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs bdag nyid mi zad phyir min na /
translated: Do not arise from the non-exhaustion of a similar cause,

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa ches shin tu ba'i rgyu 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod na'ang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i spyi zad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa ches shin tu ba'i rgyu 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod na'ang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i spyi zad par 'gyur na /
translated: If attachment, etc. do not arise from the exhaustion of the general cause of attachment, etc., even though there is an increase and decrease of the specific cause of attachment, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig kyang skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig kyang skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: then even those who are completely free from attachment, etc. would generate attachment, etc.üîΩBut this is not the case, because those who are free from attachment, etc. do not generate attachment, etc.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa mi zad pa de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ga' zhig kyang srid pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa mi zad pa de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba 'ga' zhig kyang srid pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the cause of attachment, etc. is not exhausted, it is not possible that anyone is free from attachment, etc.

original: gal te de ltar yin na skyes bu kun la 'dod chags 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na skyes bu kun la 'dod chags 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If this were so, then all people would have the same attachment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bdag nyid 'dra 'byung phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dra 'byung phyir /
translated: Because the same self arises.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Attachment, etc. arise from similar causes.

original: rgyu 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because the cause is the same.

original: khra mo la sogs pa la la lar ba lang shes pa ches shin tu ba lang dang / shin tu ba lang dang / ches shin tu ba lang zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: khra mo la sogs pa la la lar ba lang shes pa ches shin tu ba lang dang / shin tu ba lang dang / ches shin tu ba lang zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Some, such as the CƒÅrvƒÅkas, do not accept that there is a cow that is more or less than another cow.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: bdag nyid mtshungs las 'byung /
analyzed: bdag nyid mtshungs las 'byung /
translated: They arise from a similar cause.

original: ba lang gi rigs gcig las skye ba can no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rigs gcig las skye ba can no //
translated: They arise from a single type of cow.

original: de ni gzhan gyi gzhung gi sgo @74b nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi gzhung gi sgo @74b nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught from the perspective of the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: 'di yang tshu rol mdzes pa rang gi sgrub pa'i mtha' la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang tshu rol mdzes pa rang gi sgrub pa'i mtha' la yang ngo //
translated: This is also the case in the SƒÅ·πÉkhya system.

original: sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag la srog chags la sogs pa ches shin tu ba ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag la srog chags la sogs pa ches shin tu ba ste /
translated: In the great elements such as earth, there is no such thing as a living being that is more or less than another living being.

original: srog chags dang shin tu srog chags dang ches shin tu srog chags zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srog chags dang shin tu srog chags dang ches shin tu srog chags zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no such thing as a living being that is more or less than another living being.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags can dang / shin tu 'dod chags can dang ches shin tu 'dod chags can zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags can dang / shin tu 'dod chags can dang ches shin tu 'dod chags can zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, there is no such thing as a passionate person, a very passionate person, or a most passionate person.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They arise from a similar cause.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for hatred, etc.

original: bdag nyid mtshungs pa dang / ches shin tu ba dang ldan pa ma gtogs par de'i rgyur brtags pa can yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mtshungs pa dang / ches shin tu ba dang ldan pa ma gtogs par de'i rgyur brtags pa can yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no cause for the defilements other than the object-field which is equal or better.

original: bdag nyid mtshungs pa yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa dang / ches shin tu ba yod na chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mtshungs pa yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa dang / ches shin tu ba yod na chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object-field is equal, there is attachment; if it is better, there is esteem.

original: gcig la gnyi ga yod pa ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyon tan nam chos dro ba'i ches shin tu pa yang 'phal ba dang / 'gib  pa yod na yang /
analyzed: gcig la gnyi ga yod pa ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro // yon tan nam chos dro ba'i ches shin tu pa yang 'phal ba dang / 'gib  pa yod na yang /
translated: But one does not esteem and hate the same object at one and the same time.üîΩIf the object-field is hot, there is aversion; if it is cold, there is attachment.üîΩBut one does not feel aversion and attachment at the same time.

original: gang tshe me dro ma yin min //
analyzed: gang tshe me dro ma yin min //
translated: If the object-field is good, there is esteem; if it is bad, there is aversion.üîΩBut one does not esteem and hate the same object at one and the same time.üîΩIf the object-field is equal, there is attachment; if it is better, there is esteem.

original: chos can nam yon tan can 'ga' zhig gi tshe ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos can nam yon tan can 'ga' zhig gi tshe ma mthong ngo //
translated: But one does not esteem and hate the same object at one and the same time.

original: gal te de ltar 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'di yin zhe na /
translated: If the object-field is hot, there is aversion; if it is cold, there is attachment.üîΩBut one does not feel aversion and attachment at the same time.üîΩIf the object-field is good, there is esteem; if it is bad, there is aversion.üîΩBut one does not esteem and hate the same object at one and the same time.

original: 'byung ba phul du byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa nyid yod na yang 'dod chags can nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa thob pa med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'byung ba phul du byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa nyid yod na yang 'dod chags can nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa thob pa med pa de ltar na /
translated: Even though there is increase and decrease of the cause of fire, such as fuel, one does not obtain the nonexistence of the fiery, etc.

original: gang zhig gang las phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, the application of ‚Äúincrease and decrease‚Äù to anything is indefinite.

original: min te dro ba nyid las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /üîΩdro ba nyid las me zhes bya ba chos can nam /
analyzed: min te dro ba nyid las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de / dro ba nyid las me zhes bya ba chos can nam /
translated: That is not so. The response is stated in the lines ‚ÄúHeat is not fire,‚Äù and so on.üîΩHeat is not a quality of fire, nor is fire a different quality.

original: yon tan tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /üîΩgang gis na dro ba yon tan nam /
analyzed: yon tan tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na / gang gis na dro ba yon tan nam /
translated: If heat is not fire,üîΩhow could heat be a quality of fire?

original: chos te me zhes bya ba'i rdzas la 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang ldan pa yang med pa can ma yin /
analyzed: chos te me zhes bya ba'i rdzas la 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang ldan pa yang med pa can ma yin /
translated: How could fire be a substance that has increase and decrease?

original: me'i rdzas tha dad pa bkag pa yang rdzas 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du bsan  pa dag las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: me'i rdzas tha dad pa bkag pa yang rdzas 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du bsan  pa dag las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of the substance of fire should be understood from other arguments refuting substance.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na gang la yang dro ba nyid 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang ldan pa me zhes bya ba'i chos can yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na gang la yang dro ba nyid 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang ldan pa me zhes bya ba'i chos can yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, there is no such thing as fire that has the property of increasing or decreasing heat.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: dro ba nyid me yin la /üîΩde yang sa phyogs la @75a * //
analyzed: dro ba nyid me yin la / de yang sa phyogs la @75a * //
translated: Heat is fire.üîΩAnd that is not something that exists in a property-possessor, such as a place,

original: sogs pa'i chos can gang la phul du byung ba dang / 'grib pa dang ldan ba de yod pa med pa can yang yin no /
analyzed: sogs pa'i chos can gang la phul du byung ba dang / 'grib pa dang ldan ba de yod pa med pa can yang yin no /
translated: that has the property of increasing or decreasing.

original: de bas na 'di ltar yon tan las gzhan gang la yon tan can gyi yod pa'i yon tan rnams gang yin pa'i chos can la lar ches shin tu ba ldan pa can tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan de dag las tha dad na'ang /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar yon tan las gzhan gang la yon tan can gyi yod pa'i yon tan rnams gang yin pa'i chos can la lar ches shin tu ba ldan pa can tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan de dag las tha dad na'ang /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the property-possessor, in which the properties exist as the possessor of the property of heat, is not different from the properties that are possessed by the possessor of the property of heat.

original: chos can gang la tha dad pa dang ldan pa de rigs tha dad pa na /
analyzed: chos can gang la tha dad pa dang ldan pa de rigs tha dad pa na /
translated: If the property-possessor, in which the properties are possessed, is different from the properties,

original: chos can la la chad 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos can la la chad 'gyur te /
translated: then the property-possessor would be severed.

original: chos rgyun chad pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rgyun chad pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The continuum of the property would be severed.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dkar sogs bzhin te /
analyzed: dkar sogs bzhin te /
translated: It is like white and so on.

original: snam bu la yod pa tsam gyi ngang tshul can gyi dkar po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig chos can gyi rigs sam /
analyzed: snam bu la yod pa tsam gyi ngang tshul can gyi dkar po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no // sbyor ba ni gang zhig chos can gyi rigs sam /
translated: like the whiteness, etc., which have the mode of being of mere presence in the cloth.

original: yon tan can gyi rigs gang la chos sam yon tan gyis ches shin tu ba dang ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: yon tan can gyi rigs gang la chos sam yon tan gyis ches shin tu ba dang ldan pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is this: Whatever is the most excellent of a class of phenomena or a class of things having qualities is

original: de tha dad pa la lar chos rgyun chad pa can yang yin te /
analyzed: de tha dad pa la lar chos rgyun chad pa can yang yin te /
translated: also discontinuous in its properties or qualities in some places.

original: dper na bum pa dang sna ma bu dag la dkar po nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos sam yon tan yang chos can srog chags sam /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang sna ma bu dag la dkar po nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o // 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos sam yon tan yang chos can srog chags sam /
translated: For example, whiteness, etc., in the pot and the cloth.üîΩAnd the properties or qualities of attachment, etc., are the most excellent of the phenomena or qualities of living beings.

original: yon tan can dag gi ches shin tu ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yon tan can dag gi ches shin tu ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Since the inference is stated with a distinction, it is not indeterminate.

original: de ltar yin na yang chos can me lce 'am yon tan can de la dro ba nyid gang yin pa dro ba nyid phul du 'byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang chos can me lce 'am yon tan can de la dro ba nyid gang yin pa dro ba nyid phul du 'byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not heat, which is the attribute of the flame, the most excellent heat?

original: me lce yod na rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid yon no zhe na /
analyzed: me lce yod na rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid yon no zhe na /
translated: And when the flame exists, heat does not cease. Thus, the example is not proven.

original: ma yin te de la yang dro ba'i khyad par chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la dro ba nyid ni 'byung pa yin la /
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang dro ba'i khyad par chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de la dro ba nyid ni 'byung pa yin la /
translated: No, because the particular heat is the attribute of the flame.

original: de las 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs skye zhing dro ba nyid chad pa na de'i 'bras bu gzugs rnam par chad pa yin no //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs skye zhing dro ba nyid chad pa na de'i 'bras bu gzugs rnam par chad pa yin no //
translated: Heat is the primary element, and form derived from the primary elements arises from heat. When heat ceases, the form that is its effect also ceases.

original: reg bya dang gzugs la ma gtogs pa'i rdzas gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na dkar po la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i ba lang dad /
analyzed: reg bya dang gzugs la ma gtogs pa'i rdzas gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no // de ltar na dkar po la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i ba lang dad /
translated: There is no substance other than tangible and visible form.

original: lus ni chos sam yon tan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lus ni chos sam yon tan ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the whiteness, etc., of the cow and the pleasure, etc., of the body are not the attributes of the cow and the body.üîΩThe cow and the body are the attributes of whiteness, etc., and pleasure, etc.

original: 'on kyang ba lang dang / lus ni chos can nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang ba lang dang / lus ni chos can nyid yin zhing /
translated: The cow and the body are the substrata of the attributes.

original: gzhan ni de'i chos yin pa'i phyir chos can gnas pa na chos rnams @75b 'chad cing chos gnas pa na chos can 'chad pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te lus la gzugs dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa ma byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung ba dang / nges par 'brel ba can yin pa de dang 'dra bar lus kyi chos su gyur pa yid bde ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan ni de'i chos yin pa'i phyir chos can gnas pa na chos rnams @75b 'chad cing chos gnas pa na chos can 'chad pa ma yin no // gal te lus la gzugs dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa ma byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung ba dang / nges par 'brel ba can yin pa de dang 'dra bar lus kyi chos su gyur pa yid bde ba dang /
translated: But it is not the case that when the basis of attributes endures, its attributes are destroyed, nor that when its attributes endure, the basis of attributes is destroyed.üîΩIf form, smell, taste, tactility, etc.üîΩarise in the body, then pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, attachment, anger, desire for food, wisdom, etc.üîΩarise in the body.üîΩIf pleasure, etc.

original: yid mi bde ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang zas la sogs pa 'dod pa dang shes rab la sogs pa 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang zas la sogs pa 'dod pa dang shes rab la sogs pa 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: arise in the body, then form, smell, taste, tactility, etc.üîΩarise in the body.

original: gang la byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang la byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since pleasure, etc.

original: gzugs sogs bzhin nges med /
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin nges med /
translated: are not definitely concomitant with the body, they are not attributes of the body.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa dag go ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa dag go ci'i phyir zhe na /
