original: gzugs la sogs pa khyad par med pa de dag 'byung ba las tha dad med phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa khyad par med pa de dag 'byung ba las tha dad med phyir ro //
translated: because form and so on are not different from the elements.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi nges pa gang yin pa de 'byung ba la tha dad pa med par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi nges pa gang yin pa de 'byung ba la tha dad pa med par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The universal of form and so on is present without difference in the elements.

original: lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is present through the determination of co-existence.

original: yang na 'byung ba dag las gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba dag las gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Or, if form and so on are not different from the elements,

original: khyod kyi gzhung gi 'byung ba nyid gzugs la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi gzhung gi 'byung ba nyid gzugs la sogs pa yin no //
translated: then in your system the elements themselves are form and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba yod na gzugs la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba yod na gzugs la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they have the nature of the elements, form and so on would exist if the elements existed.üîΩHere, too, desire and so on are either characterized by the determination of co-existence with the elements,

original: 'dir yang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams dang lhan cig gnas par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can nam /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams dang lhan cig gnas par nges pa'i mtshan nyid can nam /
translated: Here, the characteristics of the afflictions such as attachment are definitely concomitant with the arising of the afflictions.

original: de yod na yod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tha dad pa med pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang zhig gang la tha dad par gnas pa yod na ma byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khyad par dang
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tha dad pa med pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang zhig gang la tha dad par gnas pa yod na ma byung ba las snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khyad par dang
translated: If that exists, then the difference which has the characteristic of existence does not exist. Thus, when there is the existence of the difference of one thing from another, then that which did not exist previously would arise from what did not exist previously.

original: bcas pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is the reason with a particular that is stated, it is not indeterminate.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang la lhan cig gnas pa'i nges ba yod pa med na ma byung ba las 'byung ba de ni de las nges par skye ba dang 'brel ba can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang la lhan cig gnas pa'i nges ba yod pa med na ma byung ba las 'byung ba de ni de las nges par skye ba dang 'brel ba can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not have the nature of existing simultaneously with something else does not arise from what did not exist previously, because it is related to arising from that,

original: dper na lus de nyid la mig dang / rna ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus de nyid la mig dang / rna ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the eye, ear, hand, etc., of that very body.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang lus dang lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa yod pa med na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang lus dang lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa yod pa med na /
translated: Also, attachment, etc., do not have the nature of existing simultaneously with the body.

original: snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since they arise from what did not exist previously, this is the observation of a contradiction that makes a distinction.
That

original: ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te de mtshungs she na /
analyzed: gal te de mtshungs she na /
translated: if they are similar,üîΩthen the reason is not established, because there is no separate pleasure, etc.

original: de la yang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na de ni len de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na de ni len de nyid ma yin te /
translated: that has such a nature.

original: sngar 'dod chags la sogs pa tha dad par sgrub pas lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / nus pa'i ngo bo yod na yang de nyid la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar 'dod chags la sogs pa tha dad par sgrub pas lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / nus pa'i ngo bo yod na yang de nyid la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because it has already been demonstrated that attachment, etc. are not established as separate, and that they do not operate simultaneously, and that if they have the nature of potentiality, they do not exist in reality.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod par bya ste skyon 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod par bya ste skyon 'di nyid yin no //
translated: Even if you accept this, we must say that this is a fault.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩchags sogs cig car skye thal phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / chags sogs cig car skye thal phyir //
translated: Why?üîΩBecause it follows that attachment, etc. would arise simultaneously.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog la sogs pa cig car 'jug par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / phrag dog la sogs pa cig car 'jug par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that attachment, aversion, jealousy, etc. would operate simultaneously, like form, etc.

original: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnus pa'i rang bzhin yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'jug pa can srid pa gsal bas 'dod pa ma grub pa dang / 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro // nus pa'i rang bzhin yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'jug pa can srid pa gsal bas 'dod pa ma grub pa dang / 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa yin na yang /
translated: because it is the nature of the elements and because its nature is not impaired.üîΩEven if the nature of the potential exists, the nature of attachment and so on is to engage, and it is possible that the manifestation of attachment and so on is not established because there is no difference in the nature of the elements.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nus pa dang / gsal ba'i khyad par mi rung ba'i phyir ro de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nus pa dang / gsal ba'i khyad par mi rung ba'i phyir ro de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Even though there is no difference in the nature of the elements, it is not possible that the nature of the potential of attachment and so on and the difference in manifestation are not established.

original: 'dod chags la la sogs pa 'jug pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la la sogs pa 'jug pa la /
translated: Even though that is so, in the engagement of attachment and so on,

original: phyi rol gyi yul ni lhan cig byed pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul ni lhan cig byed pa yin la /
translated: an external object is a cooperative condition.

original: de ma thag nye ba gang yin pa de de'i tshe 'jug par 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na yul nges par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cig car skye bar thal ba med do zhe na de ni ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ma thag nye ba gang yin pa de de'i tshe 'jug par 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na yul nges par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir cig car skye bar thal ba med do zhe na de ni ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: Whatever is immediately proximate at that time will engage. In that case, because it is the ascertainment of the object, the consequence of simultaneous arising does not occur.

original: yul ni nges byed ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ni nges byed ma yin no //
translated: The object is not the ascertainer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rnam rtog yul nyid yin phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rnam rtog yul nyid yin phyir ro //
translated: Because attachment and so on have conceptualized objects.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don thag nye ba la ltos pas 'jug pa can ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don thag nye ba la ltos pas 'jug pa can ma yin na /
translated: If attachment and so on do not engage in dependence on external objects that are close,

original: gang gis na nges par skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na nges par skye bar 'gyur /
translated: then how could they definitely arise?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir yul nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir yul nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they are not objects that ascertain their objects, since they are subjects that superimpose objects through conception.

original: gzhan yang kho bo cag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba la rigs mthun pa'i rgyu yod do zhes smra na /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bo cag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba la rigs mthun pa'i rgyu yod do zhes smra na /
translated: Moreover, we say that attachment and so on have a cause that is a homogeneous type.

original: de yang khyed cag mi 'dod de gang gi tshe skye ba la skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang khyed cag mi 'dod de gang gi tshe skye ba la skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med pa de'i tshe /
translated: But you do not assert that, because when attachment and so on arise, there is no cause that is a homogeneous type.

original: skal ba mnyam @76b rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam @76b rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no cause that is a homogeneous type,

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa yang de ma thag tu rgyu nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa yang de ma thag tu rgyu nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: it is also refuted that consciousness is the cause of attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu med pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu med pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore attachment and so on are causeless.

original: chags sogs nges pa med pa'am /üîΩgang 'ga' zhig la'ang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar mthong ba de nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags sogs nges pa med pa'am / gang 'ga' zhig la'ang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar mthong ba de nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Attachment and so on are not definite,üîΩor else, it is impossible that attachment and so on arise for some.

original: sbyor ba yang gang la rgyu med pa de ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang la rgyu med pa de ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: If something has no cause, it is impossible.

original: dper na de kho na nyid lnga pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de kho na nyid lnga pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the five principles.üîΩAnd attachment and so on have no cause.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la yang rgyu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩgal te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la yang rgyu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o // gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the nonobservation of a property of the opponent.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established because the arising of attachment and so on is the cause,

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe 'byung ba dag rtag tu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu rtag tu nye ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe 'byung ba dag rtag tu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu rtag tu nye ba yin te /
translated: then it follows that the cause of attachment and so on would always be present because the elements would always be complete.

original: rgyu ni nye phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ni nye phyir te /
translated: Because the cause is present.

original: gyu'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo rnams dag thams cad thams cad tshe na skye ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyu'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo rnams dag thams cad thams cad tshe na skye ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the minds of passion, etc., are produced at all times, for all men, and in all ways.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa thag nye ba can yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa thag nye ba can yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: When the cause is present, without deficiency, and is proximate, then it is at that time.

original: dper na lus de nyid la gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus de nyid la gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in that very body, form, etc., are present.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo yang rgyu mtshang pa med pa thag nye ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo yang rgyu mtshang pa med pa thag nye ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the minds of passion, etc., are present, without deficiency, and are proximate. This is a natural inference.

original: nus pa yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pas 'dod pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pas 'dod pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: And if there is the capacity, the nature of passion, etc., is not present. Thus, the thesis is not established.

original: gyur pa'i khyad par 'jug pa med pas ma grub pa yang ma yin te rang bzhin 'pho ba med pa can gyi gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gyur pa'i khyad par 'jug pa med pas ma grub pa yang ma yin te rang bzhin 'pho ba med pa can gyi gyur pa'am /
translated: Nor is it unestablished, because the special transformation is not admitted. There is no transformation of a nature that is without transference.

original: de'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kyang spong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kyang spong ba ma yin no //
translated: Nor is any special transformation of it admitted.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gcig la gnas pa'i skyes bu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo rgyu thag nye ba can rigs mtshungs pa thams cad ci'i phyir 'dug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gcig la gnas pa'i skyes bu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo rgyu thag nye ba can rigs mtshungs pa thams cad ci'i phyir 'dug par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why would not all those who are in the same situation, who have the same cause, namely, a mind with attachment, etc., remain the same?

original: skad cig ma re re gyur pa yang rgyu med pa can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re gyur pa yang rgyu med pa can yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If the transformation is causeless, then it would be momentary.

original: gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan byung ba tsam cung zad gang yin pa de'i gzhung btsugs pa'i phyir gyur pa skad cig ma rim bzhin du 'gyur ba can ma yin pa'am /üîΩde'i rgyu mtshan med pa can yin na yang ltos par bya ba med pa'i phyir @77a * //
analyzed: gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan byung ba tsam cung zad gang yin pa de'i gzhung btsugs pa'i phyir gyur pa skad cig ma rim bzhin du 'gyur ba can ma yin pa'am / de'i rgyu mtshan med pa can yin na yang ltos par bya ba med pa'i phyir @77a * //
translated: If the transformation were to occur for some slight reason, then it would be established that the transformation is not a gradual change from one instant to the next.

original: rtag tu gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rtag tu gyur pa'am /
translated: If it were causeless, then it would be permanent, because there would be nothing to rely on.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin no zhes lan du mar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin no zhes lan du mar bshad zin to //
translated: Or, it would not be at all, as has been explained many times.

original: de'i phyir / goms las 'dod chags sogs bsal ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir / goms las 'dod chags sogs bsal ba //
translated: Therefore: Attachment, etc., are removed through habituation.

original: mthong phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad kyi 'khor ba can gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal du grub pa yin no //üîΩsdug bsngal gsum mam /
analyzed: mthong phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad kyi 'khor ba can gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal du grub pa yin no // sdug bsngal gsum mam /
translated: All the reasons stated above, such as ‚Äúbecause it is seen,‚Äù establish that the five appropriated aggregates of the one in cyclic existence are suffering.üîΩThe five appropriated aggregates are suffering because they are related to the three kinds of suffering,

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal de dang 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal de dang 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi /
translated: or because they are related to birth, etc., and because they are impermanent, etc., in four ways.

original: 'ga' zhig tshe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tshe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: The four aspects of the truth of suffering are taught in the verse that begins, ‚ÄúAt some time, etc.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal de mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: That suffering is impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'ga' zhig tshe na dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tshe na dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is sometimes perceived.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni gcig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyun zhes bya ba ni gcig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The continuum of suffering does not exist as a single entity.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par nyid gzhan dang gzhan 'jug pa yin gyi rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par nyid gzhan dang gzhan 'jug pa yin gyi rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the occurrence of one particular suffering after another, but it is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang bstan bcos mdzad pa rang nyid kyis rnam pa du mas bstan zin pa'i phyir yang brjod na mi mdzes par 'gyur bde ltar na ma spros se //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang bstan bcos mdzad pa rang nyid kyis rnam pa du mas bstan zin pa'i phyir yang brjod na mi mdzes par 'gyur bde ltar na ma spros se //
translated: Therefore, it is not elaborated here.

original: de ltar na mi rtag pa nyid yin no //üîΩphung po rnams kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang nyes brten phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na mi rtag pa nyid yin no // phung po rnams kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang nyes brten phyir /
translated: Thus, they are impermanent.üîΩThe aggregates are also suffering because faults are related to them.

original: phung po rnams la nyes pa rnams rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir te tsag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po rnams la nyes pa rnams rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir te tsag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The aggregates are suffering because faults are related to them, because they are associated with pain.

original: nyes pa yang bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa yang bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Faults are self and mine, manifest clinging, and so on.

original: de bas na skye ba'i dus na bdag gi ngo bo gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skye ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun nas sbyor ba'i phyir sdug bsngal du 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba'i dus na bdag gi ngo bo gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skye ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun nas sbyor ba'i phyir sdug bsngal du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore they are asserted to be suffering because at the time of birth they are the cause of tormenting the self, because they are the suffering of karmic maturation of birth and so on and because they are related to the fetters.

original: rgyu'i dbang nyid phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang nyid phyir /
translated: Because they are under the power of causes.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: They are suffering because they are under the power of others.

original: phung po rnams kyi skad cig ma re re la rgyus gzhan gyi dbang yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi skad cig ma re re la rgyus gzhan gyi dbang yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Since the aggregates are momentary, and since each moment is caused by another,

original: de sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: they are suffering.

original: bdag min te gang gi phyir 'di ltar phung po mi rtag pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag tu 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag min te gang gi phyir 'di ltar phung po mi rtag pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag tu 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: They are not the self, because in this way the aggregates are impermanent and subject to another‚Äôs volition.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid bdag gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid bdag gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are not the self, which is by nature one‚Äôs own.üîΩThe self is the basis of action and enjoyment, and is characterized by independence.

original: bya ba dang longs spyod pa'i rten gyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / rang dbang gi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir bdag yin pa de ltar @77b na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang longs spyod pa'i rten gyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / rang dbang gi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir bdag yin pa de ltar @77b na bdag med pa'o //
translated: The self does not exist in this way.

original: sdug bsngal de phung po dang tha mi dad pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de phung po dang tha mi dad pa'am /
translated: That suffering is not different from the aggregates,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pas 'jug pa'ang min te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pas 'jug pa'ang min te /
translated: nor does it occur by the self‚Äôs blessing, which is inexpressible.

original: des na bdag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na bdag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the self. This is the meaning.

original: des ni stong pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni stong pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, emptiness is explained.

original: bdag ni rang gi rkyen la rag las pa'i phung po rnams kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yang /
analyzed: bdag ni rang gi rkyen la rag las pa'i phung po rnams kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yang /
translated: I am not like some aspect of the aggregates that depend on their own conditions.üîΩ

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The self is not a benefactor in any way, like the aspects of the aggregates that are dependent on their own conditions.

original: de ji ltar na byin gyis rlob pa po nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na byin gyis rlob pa po nyid yin na /
translated: How could it be the consecrator?

original: gang gis na stong pa nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na stong pa nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: By what means would it not be empty?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngang tshul can du mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i byin gyis rlob pa po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngang tshul can du mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i byin gyis rlob pa po nyid ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: That which does not have the nature of benefiting something is not the consecrator of that thing,

original: dper na bum pa la mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, a barren woman‚Äôs son in regard to a pot.

original: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngad tshul can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngad tshul can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nonobservation of a pervader is as follows: The thing that is asserted to be the self does not have the nature of benefiting the aggregates.

original: de nyid ni /üîΩrgyu min byin gyis rlob pa min //
analyzed: de nyid ni / rgyu min byin gyis rlob pa min //
translated: This is stated in the line:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a cause and it is not a consecrator.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar yang na rtag nyid ji ltar rgyu yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang na rtag nyid ji ltar rgyu yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, how could a permanent entity be a cause? It could not be!

original: de yang skabs gzhan du mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang skabs gzhan du mang du bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times in other contexts.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyur mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i rang bzhin la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin te bum pa la mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyur mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i rang bzhin la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin te bum pa la mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is not a cause of something does not have the nature of assisting that thing, like a barren woman‚Äôs son does not have the nature of assisting a pot.

original: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang phung po rnams kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang phung po rnams kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The thing that is asserted to be a self is not a cause of the aggregates. This is a case of the nonobservation of a more extensive property.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir du ma gcig las ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir du ma gcig las ni /
translated: Because a permanent entity cannot be a cause,üîΩmany things would not arise

original: 'pho ba med pa'i rang bzhin las /üîΩdus tha dad par skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa'i rang bzhin las / dus tha dad par skye mi 'gyur //
translated: from a single, unchanging nature.

original: cig car kho nar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig car kho nar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They would arise all at once,

original: rgyu ma tshang pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause would not be incomplete.

original: yang na 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is not the case that it is sometimes, because there is no distinction.

original: gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur ba 'di'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur ba 'di'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: That which exists when this exists is its cause, and that which does not exist when this does not exist is its effect.

original: de'i rgyu de las gzhan pa thag ni nye ba na 'ang /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de las gzhan pa thag ni nye ba na 'ang /
translated: If the cause of this is not near,

original: de med pa na de'i 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de med pa na de'i 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: then its effect will not arise when it does not exist.

original: 'bras bu dag ni mi skye phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag ni mi skye phyir //
translated: Because the effect does not arise,

original: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog @78a * //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog @78a * //
translated: the other cause is inferred.

original: 'gyur na // dper na gang med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu mi skye ba de'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gyur na // dper na gang med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu mi skye ba de'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, because this does not exist, its effect does not arise, and the other causes of that are like that.

original: de ni rtag rnams la yod min /
analyzed: de ni rtag rnams la yod min /
translated: This does not exist for the permanent.

original: rtag pa rnams ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa rnams ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the permanent does not cease.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ldog pa nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ldog pa nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the cessation explained above does not exist,

original: gang gis na de'i nus pa rtog par byed de thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis na de'i nus pa rtog par byed de thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how can its power be imagined? Because it is too much.

original: de pas na gang dag yod na gang nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: de pas na gang dag yod na gang nyid 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, when something exists, that very thing is the cause of that.

original: de ni de tsam gyis rgyu can nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de tsam gyis rgyu can nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That should be seen as having that much for its cause.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur ba de nyid ni de tsam las 'gyur ba'i dang tshul can dang / de las tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos ba med pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na 'gyur ba de nyid ni de tsam las 'gyur ba'i dang tshul can dang / de las tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos ba med pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever exists when something exists is the cause of that, and it is not accepted that it has a different cause apart from that.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i tshogs pa yod na 'bras bu'i khyad par nges par 'gyur ba khas blangs pa de tsam gyi rgyu can dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa khas blangs pa yin pa lta byu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i tshogs pa yod na 'bras bu'i khyad par nges par 'gyur ba khas blangs pa de tsam gyi rgyu can dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa khas blangs pa yin pa lta byu'o //
translated: For example, when the collection of desired things exists, the particular effect is definitely produced. It is accepted that it has that much for its cause and it is not accepted that it is dependent on another cause.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag yod na 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag yod na 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The eye consciousness exists when the eye, form, light, and attention exist. This is a natural inference.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang rna ba la sogs pa dang // sgra la sogs pa dang yid la byed pa dag yod na 'gyur ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'bad rtsol gyi mtshan nyid can rnam par shes pa yang snga ma'i khyad par yod na 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang rna ba la sogs pa dang // sgra la sogs pa dang yid la byed pa dag yod na 'gyur ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'bad rtsol gyi mtshan nyid can rnam par shes pa yang snga ma'i khyad par yod na 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The mental consciousness arises when there is a prior difference in consciousness characterized by effort.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa dang / mig 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa la sogs pa yang 'bad rtsol dang / lus rjes su mthun pa yod na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa dang / mig 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa la sogs pa yang 'bad rtsol dang / lus rjes su mthun pa yod na 'gyur ro //
translated: The in-breath and out-breath, the opening and closing of the eyes, etc., arise when there is effort and the body is in a suitable condition.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi bshad pa yin no //üîΩ'di'i kun 'byung ni /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi bshad pa yin no // 'di'i kun 'byung ni /
translated: Thus, the four kinds of suffering have been explained.üîΩThe origin of suffering is explained by the following verse:üîΩBecause it arises only occasionally,

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba nyid kyis ni //
translated: because it is produced by a cause,üîΩbecause it is dependent,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: and because it is subject to destruction.

original: re zhig sdug bsngal de rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal de rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Suffering does not arise without a cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba nyid kyis ni //
translated: Because it arises only occasionally.

original: gang res 'ga' 'byung tha de ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin pa de bas na gi skad du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal 'di rgyu bcas pa nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang res 'ga' 'byung tha de ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin pa de bas na gi skad du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal 'di rgyu bcas pa nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: Since that which occurs sometimes has a cause, therefore this suffering, as explained, is established as having a cause.

original: de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rgyu med de 'di la rgyu yod pa ma yin pas na rgya med pa de ni rtag tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu med de 'di la rgyu yod pa ma yin pas na rgya med pa de ni rtag tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur /
translated: that which has no cause, since it does not have a cause, would be either eternally existent or eternally non-existent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhan la mi ltos phyir @78b te //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos phyir @78b te //
translated: Because it does not depend on another.

original: don rgyu med pa can rang dbang du skye ba la gang thag nye ba las res 'ga' 'gyur ba dang thag nye ba med pa las dus gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: don rgyu med pa can rang dbang du skye ba la gang thag nye ba las res 'ga' 'gyur ba dang thag nye ba med pa las dus gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: An object without a cause arises independently. What is near would not sometimes occur and what is not near would not occur at another time.

original: ltos par bya ba cung zad kyang yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba cung zad kyang yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It would not be the case that there is anything at all that is dependent.

original: de bas na khyad par med pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'dod pa'i dus na'ang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par med pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'dod pa'i dus na'ang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there would be no distinction, it would not occur even at the time when it is supposed to occur.

original: 'byung ba'i dus ma yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dus ma yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there would be no distinction in the time when it does not occur, it would be eternally existent.

original: ji ltar tsher ma la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid kyi phyogs snga ma 'god par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar tsher ma la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid kyi phyogs snga ma 'god par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like thorns, etc.,‚Äù etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni padma'i sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / ge sar dang / lte ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni padma'i sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / ge sar dang / lte ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the stem, leaves, petals, pistils, and so on.

original: rno ba nyid sogs kyi sogs pa smos pas ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang / rtsub pa dang / 'jam pa la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: rno ba nyid sogs kyi sogs pa smos pas ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang / rtsub pa dang / 'jam pa la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsharpness, etc.‚Äù includes shape, color, roughness, smoothness, and so on.

original: ji ltar / rno ba nyid sogs rgyu med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar / rno ba nyid sogs rgyu med pa //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like sharpness, etc., have no cause,

original: de ltar sdug bsngal de dag rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal de dag rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: so too would these sufferings have no cause.‚Äù

original: zhes ni kha cig rab tu brjod /
analyzed: zhes ni kha cig rab tu brjod /
translated: This is what some people have said.

original: rang bzhin du smra ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du smra ba'o //
translated: This is the theory of the proponents of ‚Äúspontaneity.‚Äù

original: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To them we reply as follows:

original: rgyu zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such thing as a ‚Äúcause‚Äù that is something other than the effect.

original: 'on kyang gang yod na ni gang skye ba'am /üîΩ'gyur pa yod na 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang yod na ni gang skye ba'am / 'gyur pa yod na 'gyur ba yang /
translated: However, if something exists, then it can arise orüîΩchange.

original: gang zhig 'gyur ba na 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'gyur ba na 'gyur pa ste /
translated: If something changes, then it changes into something else.

original: dngos po 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa can gang yin pa /
analyzed: dngos po 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa can gang yin pa /
translated: That which is concomitant with the transformation of a thing

original: de ni de rgyur rab bstan pa //
analyzed: de ni de rgyur rab bstan pa //
translated: is taught to be its cause.

original: rgyur smra ba sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rgyur smra ba sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The Buddhists and others who speak of causes say this.

original: de dang de dag de rnams la yang yod /
analyzed: de dang de dag de rnams la yang yod /
translated: And those things exist for them.

original: sa bon gyi yul la sogs pa so sor nges pa gang dag la rno ba nyid la sogs par 'gyur ba de dag ni sa bon gyi yul la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: sa bon gyi yul la sogs pa so sor nges pa gang dag la rno ba nyid la sogs par 'gyur ba de dag ni sa bon gyi yul la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa de ltar na /
translated: Those things that are definite with regard to the place of the seed, etc., and that become sharp, etc., are concomitant with the existence and nonexistence of the place of the seed, etc.

original: de'i rgyu can de dag gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'bad rtsol gyis ci zhig bya /üîΩgal te reg bya yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can de dag gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'bad rtsol gyis ci zhig bya / gal te reg bya yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, since it is understood that they are the cause of that, what is the use of exertion here?üîΩEven if the cause of visual consciousness is not a tangible object,

original: med na mi 'gyur ba de ltar na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can de 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med na mi 'gyur ba de ltar na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can de 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: if visual consciousness occurs when a tangible object exists and does not occur when it does not exist, then the cause and effect relationship is mistaken.

original: de ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not a mistake.

original: 'di ltar reg bya zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg bya zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: Thus, what is called ‚Äútactile‚Äù is the elements.

original: de dag rgyur byas nas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rab tu 'jug pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de dag rgyur byas nas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rab tu 'jug pa de ltar na /
translated: The derivative form that is based on them is engaged in that way.

original: gzugs rgyu nyid phyir reg bya ni /
analyzed: gzugs rgyu nyid phyir reg bya ni /
translated: Thus, the tactile is the cause of form.

original: brgyud pas mthong ba la ni @79a * //
analyzed: brgyud pas mthong ba la ni @79a * //
translated: In the case of seeing at a distance,

original: rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
translated: there is no error because there is a reason.

original: de yang ldog pa tsam yid la byas nas lan du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ldog pa tsam yid la byas nas lan du bstan pa yin no //
translated: And that is stated as an answer by taking the mere negation to mind.

original: de ltar ma yin na bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa la 'brel pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa la 'brel pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, there would be no connection to the negation that has the explained characteristic.

original: de ltar na gzugs thag nye ba rab tu bstan nas reg bya'i ldog pa bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs thag nye ba rab tu bstan nas reg bya'i ldog pa bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, having taught the proximity of form, it is not possible to teach the negation of the tactile.

original: de de ltar na sdug bsngal rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na sdug bsngal rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, suffering is not causeless, but rather it has a cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin na yang sdug bsngal 'di ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin na yang sdug bsngal 'di ni /
translated: Even though it has a cause, this suffering

original: dbang phyug sogs las 'byung min no //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs las 'byung min no //
translated: does not arise from ƒ™≈õvara and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the principal, the person, and so on.

original: rgyu yang gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu yang gang gis she na /
translated: What is the reason that suffering does not arise from a cause?

original: rtag pa rnams ni bkag pa dang // zhes smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa rnams ni bkag pa dang // zhes smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúPermanence has been refuted.‚Äù

original: rtag pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te skabs gzhan du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te skabs gzhan du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Permanence does not exist in the least, because it has been refuted in other contexts.

original: dang gi sgras ni 'di nyid dang gzhan du bkag pa ste dbang phyug sogs ma yin khyad par med phyir ro zhes rtag pa nyid cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni 'di nyid dang gzhan du bkag pa ste dbang phyug sogs ma yin khyad par med phyir ro zhes rtag pa nyid cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates that it has been refuted as being the same as or different from its cause. Since it has been refuted as being neither the same as nor different from its cause, permanence does not exist in the least.

original: re zhig dbang phyug la sogs pa las sdug bsngal 'di 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: re zhig dbang phyug la sogs pa las sdug bsngal 'di 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Suffering does not arise from a cause such as ƒ™≈õvara.

original: yod na yang rtag pa rnams ni 'bras bu la nus med phyir /
analyzed: yod na yang rtag pa rnams ni 'bras bu la nus med phyir /
translated: Even if it did exist, suffering would not arise from a permanent cause, because a permanent cause would be devoid of the ability to produce an effect.

original: de dag las sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Suffering would not arise from a permanent cause.

original: de ltar na rtag pa nyid ni dus thams cad na nus pa yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na rtag pa nyid ni dus thams cad na nus pa yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, permanence would always have the ability to produce an effect.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med par cig car thams cad byed pa'am /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med par cig car thams cad byed pa'am /
translated: Without relying on other simultaneous causes, it would create everything at once.

original: mi byed na phyis kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi byed na phyis kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were to produce its effect without relying on a cooperating cause, it would either produce its effect all the time or it would never produce its effect.üîΩAnd later on, it would be just the same.üîΩTherefore, it is not capable of producing its effect at any time.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang nus pa med pa yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang nus pa med pa yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal 'di rgyu med pa can ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal 'di rgyu med pa can ma yin zhing /

analyzed: de la yang mi rtag pa'i rgyu gang yin pa 'ga' zhig gis de dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang mthun pa'i sgo nas yin no //

analyzed: skye ba'i gnas dang gzhan skabs dang / nye bar mkho ba dang / sems can la sogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa'o //

original: ngas dang rten dang nye bar len pa yongs su len pa'i don can no //
analyzed: ngas dang rten dang nye bar len pa yongs su len pa'i don can no //

analyzed: bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i sred pa yin par 'dod do //
