analyzed: nga'i 'di zhes sdug bsngal yongs su spangs nas kyang bde ba de thob par bya'o zhes 'jug pa'i ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pas kun nas bslangs pa'i bdag tu chags pa nyid la thams cad du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The engagement of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the attachment to self, which is always present.

original: mngal na gzhan pa'i 'jug pa yang srog chags ji skad du bshad pa dag tu chags pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngal na gzhan pa'i 'jug pa yang srog chags ji skad du bshad pa dag tu chags pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
translated: The engagement of another in the womb is also preceded by attachment, as explained for the living being.üîΩThe application is the appropriation of the desired place, such as the womb, by engaging in superimposing that on the basis of the conception of self, which is not under the control of another living being, is stable, is permanent, is happy, and is free from self and what belongs to self.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang 'gang srog chags gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa sems la gnas pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang bral ba la der sgro 'dogs nas 'jug pa dang / gnas la sogs pa 'dod pa yongs su len pa gang yin pa de @80b thams cad kyi phyin ci log pa'i blo ni bdag tu chags pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang 'gang srog chags gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa sems la gnas pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang bral ba la der sgro 'dogs nas 'jug pa dang / gnas la sogs pa 'dod pa yongs su len pa gang yin pa de @80b thams cad kyi phyin ci log pa'i blo ni bdag tu chags pas byas pa yin te /
translated: All of those mistaken cognitions are produced by attachment to self.

original: dper na 'di nyid kyi tha snyad kyi dus su 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di nyid kyi tha snyad kyi dus su 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, at the time of the conventional, it is like the engagement that has the nature of change.

original: srog chags rnams kyang gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa /
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyang gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa /
translated: And also, the living beings are not under the control of another,

original: sems la gnas pa rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba la der sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa la sogs pa dang mngal la sogs pa'i gnas la 'jug pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: sems la gnas pa rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba la der sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa la sogs pa dang mngal la sogs pa'i gnas la 'jug pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: they are attached to the self that is permanent, blissful, pure, and free from being the self and being what belongs to the self, and they engage in the womb and so forth. This is the result of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa /
translated: Because it is so,

original: de phyir srid pa sred rten yin //
analyzed: de phyir srid pa sred rten yin //
translated: therefore, existence is the support of craving.

original: srid pa nyid skye ba'i kun du 'ching ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa nyid skye ba'i kun du 'ching ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Existence itself is the cause of the fetter of birth. This is the conclusion.

original: chags bral skye ba ma ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: chags bral skye ba ma ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because one who is free from attachment is not seen to be born,

original: zhes ni slob dpon rnams kyi gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes ni slob dpon rnams kyi gsungs so //
translated: this is what the masters say.üîΩBecause one who is free from attachment such as desire is not seen to be born,

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang dral ba skyes bu'i skye ba ma mthong ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang dral ba skyes bu'i skye ba ma mthong ba de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: skye ba ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas 'di'i 'di rgyu yin par gsungs pa slob dpon gyis 'di ltar sred pa srid pa'i rten yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas 'di'i 'di rgyu yin par gsungs pa slob dpon gyis 'di ltar sred pa srid pa'i rten yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Vasubandhu explains the meaning of this passage as follows: ‚ÄúDesire is the support of existence.‚Äù

original: de skad du bshad pa na chu tshol mdzes pa gang yin pas smras pa /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa na chu tshol mdzes pa gang yin pas smras pa /
translated: When this is explained in this way, the beautiful one who seeks water says:

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skye pa mthong pa'i phyir dang 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu yin pa de de ltar na lus med pa la yang 'dod chags ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skye pa mthong pa'i phyir dang 'dod chags skye ba'i rgyu yin pa de de ltar na lus med pa la yang 'dod chags ma mthong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSince one sees birth in one who is free from desire, and since desire is the cause of birth, therefore, desire is the cause of birth.‚Äù

original: lus med 'dod chags ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: lus med 'dod chags ma mthong phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúSince desire is not seen in one who is bodiless,üîΩtherefore, desire arises from the body.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúSince desire is not seen in one who is bodiless, therefore, desire arises from the body.‚Äù

original: lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin pa de ltar na lus las kyang ni 'dod chags 'byung ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin pa de ltar na lus las kyang ni 'dod chags 'byung ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSince desire is the cause of the body, therefore, desire arises from the body.‚Äù

original: de dang de ni 'dod pa ste grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dang de ni 'dod pa ste grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is what you desire, but it is not established.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos sam brgyud pa rnams 'ga' zhig gi yul la sos pa dang 'dra bar lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pa rnams 'ga' zhig gi yul la sos pa dang 'dra bar lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are like a person who is helpful to some, but harmful to others, the body is helpful to attachment, etc.

original: rgyu mtshan khas blangs phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan khas blangs phyir te /
translated: Because the reason is accepted,

original: phan 'dogs 'ga' zhig 'byung ba la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs 'ga' zhig 'byung ba la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that some things that are helpful are the cooperative conditions of attachment, etc.

original: nyer len dag ni bsal ba yin //
analyzed: nyer len dag ni bsal ba yin //
translated: The appropriator is refuted.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'ga' zhig bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'ga' zhig bkag pa yin no //
translated: It is refuted that the body is the cause of appropriating attachment, etc.

original: ni'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba nyid yin no @81a * //
analyzed: ni'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba nyid yin no @81a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also a cooperative condition.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de dag skye ba'i rgyu dang gags byed pa la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba nyid bkag pa de ltar na lus rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa dang / bkag pa dag la yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i rgyu dang gags byed pa la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba nyid bkag pa de ltar na lus rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa dang / bkag pa dag la yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When the cause of their arising and the obstruction, etc. are refuted, the body is not connected to them. Thus, there is no contradiction in accepting the body as a cause and refuting that.

original: 'dod chags med par skye ba ma mthong phyir 'di'i 'dod chags rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs 'di lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid yin par 'dod pa na ste khas len na tshu rol mdzes pa bdag nyid 'di'i rang gzhung la ni gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags med par skye ba ma mthong phyir 'di'i 'dod chags rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs 'di lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid yin par 'dod pa na ste khas len na tshu rol mdzes pa bdag nyid 'di'i rang gzhung la ni gnod par 'gyur //
translated: Since one does not see the arising of desire without a body, it is reasonable to say that the body is the cause of desire. But if you accept that the body is the cause of desire, then you contradict your own treatise, which states:üîΩ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of desire.‚Äù

original: de ltar na lus dang 'dod chags dag phan tshun rgyu nyid du khas len pas na /
analyzed: de ltar na lus dang 'dod chags dag phan tshun rgyu nyid du khas len pas na /
translated: Thus, since you accept that the body and desire are mutually causal,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs las lus dang lus las yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs yin pa de ltar na sems can gyi rgyun thog ma med pa can yin pas na de dag ni bdag nyid la 'gal ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs las lus dang lus las yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs yin pa de ltar na sems can gyi rgyun thog ma med pa can yin pas na de dag ni bdag nyid la 'gal ba byed pa yin no //
translated: the body arises from the collection of desire and so on, and the collection of desire and so on arises from the body. In that case, since the continuum of sentient beings is beginningless, you contradict yourself.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: gal te skyes las chags mthong phyir //
analyzed: gal te skyes las chags mthong phyir //
translated: But if you see desire arising from the body,

original: skye dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: skye dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin //
translated: then desire and the body arise simultaneously.

original: gang gi phyir srog chags skyes par gyur pa dag la 'dod chags mthong gi sngar ma yin pa de'i phyir skyes pa dang lhan cig 'dod chags 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog chags skyes par gyur pa dag la 'dod chags mthong gi sngar ma yin pa de'i phyir skyes pa dang lhan cig 'dod chags 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because desire is seen in living beings who have been born, but not before, therefore desire arises simultaneously with birth.

original: de bas na lus dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'dod chags ni lus kyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'dod chags ni lus kyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Thus desire, which has the same time of existence as the body, is not the cause of the body,

original: 'bras bu grub pa la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it does not do anything when the effect has already been produced.

original: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe rigs pa 'di nyid kyis lus la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang rag lus pa med pa de ltar na de dag phan tshun rgyu nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe rigs pa 'di nyid kyis lus la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang rag lus pa med pa de ltar na de dag phan tshun rgyu nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: If that is so, then by this very reasoning, the collection of desire, etc., is also independent. In that case, they are not mutually causal,

original: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin no //üîΩde bas na sngar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las 'di skyes pas na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin no // de bas na sngar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las 'di skyes pas na /
translated: but they are not without cause either.üîΩTherefore, since this arises from a previously existing homogeneous cause,

original: skal mnyam skyes phyir sngar grub yin //
analyzed: skal mnyam skyes phyir sngar grub yin //
translated: it is established first, because the homogeneous is born.

original: sngar grub pa'i phyir yang yon tan dang bcas pa'i rdzas skye ba yin no zhes rtog pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngar grub pa'i phyir yang yon tan dang bcas pa'i rdzas skye ba yin no zhes rtog pa mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not reasonable to imagine that a substance with qualities arises because it existed previously.

original: srog chags dag gnas la sogs pa yongs su len pa la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba la phyin ci log pa'i blo 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de bor nas ci'i phyir sred pa nyid rgyu nyid yin
analyzed: srog chags dag gnas la sogs pa yongs su len pa la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba la phyin ci log pa'i blo 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de bor nas ci'i phyir sred pa nyid rgyu nyid yin
translated: The error of taking as permanent, happy, self, mine, and free from the impurity of desire, that which is impermanent, suffering, empty, and not self, is the cause of the appropriation of the abodes, etc. of living beings. Why is craving taught to be the cause?

original: par bstan ce na /
analyzed: par bstan ce na /
translated: It is said:

original: bshad pa / srid la mi shes rgyu yin na'ang //
analyzed: bshad pa / srid la mi shes rgyu yin na'ang //
translated: Even though ignorance is the cause of existence,

original: 'dir mi shes pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du ma brjod sred pa nyid bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir mi shes pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du ma brjod sred pa nyid bshad pa ste /
translated: Here, ignorance is not said to be the cause of suffering, but craving is.

original: 'di ltar rgyu yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu yin par bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is taught to be the cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe @81b na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe @81b na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause craving is the cause of projecting existence,

original: srid par rgyu ni 'phen par byed phyir dang // srid pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: srid par rgyu ni 'phen par byed phyir dang // srid pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: and because it is the cause of the appearance of existence.

original: skye ba yongs su len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of the appropriation of birth.

original: srid pa ni yul la sogs pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rtsol ba kun nas slong bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: srid pa ni yul la sogs pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rtsol ba kun nas slong bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Existence is the exertion that is the cause of obtaining objects, etc.

original: 'bad rtsol las nye bar len pa'i phung po rgyu dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i rgyun skad cig ma gzhan dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol las nye bar len pa'i phung po rgyu dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i rgyun skad cig ma gzhan dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: From exertion, the aggregates that are appropriated arise, as a continuum of moments that are causes and effects, and as having the characteristic of birth.

original: de'i phyir mngal gyi gnas la sogs pa yongs su len pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngal gyi gnas la sogs pa yongs su len pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, since it is the cause of appropriating the womb, etc.,

original: rgyud 'phen par byed pa'i phyir srid pa'i sred pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud 'phen par byed pa'i phyir srid pa'i sred pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: existence is explained as craving for existence, because it propels the continuum.

original: de ma thag phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag phyir ro //
translated: Because it is immediately antecedent.

original: mi shes pa yod du zin kyang 'dod pa med par 'jug pa de ltar na /
analyzed: mi shes pa yod du zin kyang 'dod pa med par 'jug pa de ltar na /
translated: Even though ignorance exists, if there is no craving, one does not enter into existence.

original: 'dod pa las 'jug pa chod pa med pa yin pa 'di nyid rgyu ru bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'jug pa chod pa med pa yin pa 'di nyid rgyu ru bshad do //
translated: Thus, craving for existence is explained as the cause of the uninterrupted engagement in desire.

original: ji ltar mi shes pa rgyur ma brjod pa de ltar las kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyur ma bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar mi shes pa rgyur ma brjod pa de ltar las kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyur ma bshad do //
translated: Just as ignorance is not explained as a cause, so also karma is not explained as a cause of suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yod na yod med phyir ro//
analyzed: de yod na yod med phyir ro//
translated: Because if it exists, it exists; if it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: ji ltar rnam par grol ba'i sems la las sa bon du gyur pa yod du zin kyang ma rig pa'i sdug bsngal gyis khyad par du byas pa dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyis yongs su brlan par ma gyur pa de srid du /üîΩde dag 'bras bu 'byin par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par grol ba'i sems la las sa bon du gyur pa yod du zin kyang ma rig pa'i sdug bsngal gyis khyad par du byas pa dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyis yongs su brlan par ma gyur pa de srid du / de dag 'bras bu 'byin par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: Just as, even though there is a seed of karma in a liberated mind, it will not produce a result as long as it is not qualified by the suffering of ignorance and moistened by the craving of existence.

original: las kyang rgyu nyid du ma bshad do //
analyzed: las kyang rgyu nyid du ma bshad do //
translated: Thus, karma is not explained as a cause.

original: de ltar kun 'byung bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar kun 'byung bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the origin is explained.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal de dang de ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal de dang de ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: That suffering, which is explained as having a cause and a nature, is not permanent,

original: rgyu 'chad par srid pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'chad par srid pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: because it is possible to stop its cause, since it has a nature of existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las gags sogs srid phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las gags sogs srid phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible to stop the cause of suffering, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that it is possible for the cause to be incomplete.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang ldan pa ni rgyu gags byed pa dang / ma tshang ba srid pa can yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang ldan pa ni rgyu gags byed pa dang / ma tshang ba srid pa can yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because that which has a cause is subject to the obstruction of the cause and the incompleteness of the cause,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal ni rtag tu ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal ni rtag tu ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The suffering that is caused should be understood as not always occurring.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dag rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa de dag ni gags byed pa dang / rgyu ma tshang ba srid pa can gyi rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dag rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa de dag ni gags byed pa dang / rgyu ma tshang ba srid pa can gyi rgyu can yin te /
translated: The application is this: those that are caused are caused by a cause that is subject to obstruction and incompleteness of causes.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like seeds, etc.

original: sdug bsngal 'di yang rgyu dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩgang dag @82a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di yang rgyu dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // gang dag @82a * //
translated: This suffering is caused by a cause is a natural inference.

original: gags byed pa dang / ma tshang ba srid pa can gyi rgyu can yin pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar rtag tu ba'i rgyun gyi rjes su byed par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gags byed pa dang / ma tshang ba srid pa can gyi rgyu can yin pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar rtag tu ba'i rgyun gyi rjes su byed par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Those that are caused by a cause that is subject to obstruction and incompleteness of causes are not necessarily subject to a continuous series.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, just like those seeds, etc.

original: sdug bsngal yang gags byed pa dang ma tshang ba srid pa can gyi rgyu can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang gags byed pa dang ma tshang ba srid pa can gyi rgyu can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Suffering also is not a cause that is obstructed or incomplete. This is a contradictory observation that distinguishes.

original: 'khor ba nyid phyir thar pa med //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid phyir thar pa med //
translated: Because of cyclic existence, there is no liberation.

original: gang gi phyir srog chags 'di'i 'khor ba'i chos can yin na chos gang yin pa de gang gi yin pa de'i nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir thar pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog chags 'di'i 'khor ba'i chos can yin na chos gang yin pa de gang gi yin pa de'i nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir thar pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Because this living being has the quality of cyclic existence, whatever quality it has, it does not transcend that. Thus, because of cyclic existence, there is no liberation. This is the opponent's view.

original: sbyor na ni gang zhig chos can gang yin pa de ni de las grol ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor na ni gang zhig chos can gang yin pa de ni de las grol ba ma yin te /
translated: If it were connected, then whatever has the quality of something, it is not liberated from that.

original: dper na me dro ba'i chos can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me dro ba'i chos can lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire has the quality of heat.

original: skyes bu 'di yang 'khor ba'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang 'khor ba'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This living being also has the quality of cyclic existence. This is a contradictory observation of a pervader.

original: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That fault does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te 'khor ba can 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te 'khor ba can 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: because there is no one who cycles.

original: gang 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur //
translated: If there is no one who cycles, then who is liberated from cyclic existence?

original: sdug bsngal tsam 'ba' zhig po 'di rgyu dang bcas pa can 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / rgyu ma tshang ba las res 'ga' mi 'byung ngo zhes kho bo smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsam 'ba' zhig po 'di rgyu dang bcas pa can 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / rgyu ma tshang ba las res 'ga' mi 'byung ngo zhes kho bo smra'o //
translated: We say that this mere suffering, along with its causes, arises and sometimes does not arise due to the incompleteness of its causes.

original: de bas na grub pa la sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na grub pa la sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since we are proving what is already established for you, we are not at fault.

original: 'khor ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no one who cycles,

original: 'on kyang de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: but they are merely causes and effects.

original: ci ste gang skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa des de skyed par 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ni ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gang skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa des de skyed par 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ni ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause whatever is a productive cause produces it‚Äù is not established,

original: rgyu rnams la gags byed pa dang ma tshang ba dang srid pas 'bras bu rtsom pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams la gags byed pa dang ma tshang ba dang srid pas 'bras bu rtsom pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: we reply that it is not, because there is no certainty that effects will arise from causes due to the presence of obstacles, incompleteness, and possibility.

original: gal te 'khor ba 'ba' zhig bde pa can nam sdug bsngal can du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba 'ba' zhig bde pa can nam sdug bsngal can du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If cyclic existence were neither happy nor miserable,üîΩthen it would not be the case that ‚ÄúI strive to abandon misery and to obtain happiness.‚Äù

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal spang ba dang thob pa'i don du kho bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba yang cung zhig mi snang zhing de ltar rtsol ba med par 'gyur ro //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang sdug bsngal gang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir dang / bde ba thob pa'i phyir bo bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba ma @82b mthong ba de ni 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal spang ba dang thob pa'i don du kho bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba yang cung zhig mi snang zhing de ltar rtsol ba med par 'gyur ro // sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang sdug bsngal gang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir dang / bde ba thob pa'i phyir bo bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba ma @82b mthong ba de ni 'khor ba'am /
translated: And thus, there would be no striving.

original: thar pa 'ga' zhig la 'bad rtsol mi byed de /
analyzed: thar pa 'ga' zhig la 'bad rtsol mi byed de /
translated: The application is this: If one does not see that ‚ÄúI strive to abandon this misery and to obtain that happiness,‚Äù then one would not strive for either cyclic existence or liberation.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the son of a barren woman.

original: skyes bu 'di la yang ji ltar du bshad pa'i rnam pas ji skad du bshad pa'i kho bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di la yang ji ltar du bshad pa'i rnam pas ji skad du bshad pa'i kho bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And in this case, one does not see that ‚ÄúI strive‚Äù in the way explained above, in the manner explained above. This is the non-apprehension of a cause.

original: gal te gang dag grol ba'i bdag nyid can de ltar mi mthong pa de mdun du byas nas de skad du brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang dag grol ba'i bdag nyid can de ltar mi mthong pa de mdun du byas nas de skad du brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you say this to someone who has not seen the selflessness of phenomena in that way, then you are proving what is already established for them.

original: ci ste kho bo cag la sogs pa la brtsams pa yin pa de'i tshe ma grub pa ma yin te /üîΩthos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis mthong ba la mthong ba zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: ci ste kho bo cag la sogs pa la brtsams pa yin pa de'i tshe ma grub pa ma yin te / thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis mthong ba la mthong ba zhes mi bya'i /
translated: But if you say this to someone like me, then it is not something that is already established for me.üîΩFor, although we say that one sees with the wisdom that arises from hearing, one does not see in the same way that one sees with direct perception.

original: 'on kyang ji srid du mngon sum gyi de ni chos tsam kho na yin no zhes mngon sum du ma byas par ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji srid du mngon sum gyi de ni chos tsam kho na yin no zhes mngon sum du ma byas par ro //
translated: Rather, one sees in the sense that one has not directly perceived the mere phenomena that are the objects of direct perception.

original: bdag tu mngon par chags pas bdag tu chags pa'i rjes su zhugs pa can gyi yid /üîΩji srid bdag cag ma bcom pa //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par chags pas bdag tu chags pa'i rjes su zhugs pa can gyi yid / ji srid bdag cag ma bcom pa //
translated: The mind that is engaged in attachment to the self due to attachment to the selfüîΩwill be tormentedüîΩas long as the self is not destroyed.

original: de srid bdag tu chags pa can //üîΩde ni yongs su gdung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de srid bdag tu chags pa can // de ni yongs su gdung 'gyur ba //
translated: As long as it is tormented,

original: 'di sdug bsngal gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di sdug bsngal gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be tormented by suffering

original: ji srid du yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba /üîΩde srid sdug bsngal sgro btags nas //
analyzed: ji srid du yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba /üîΩde srid sdug bsngal sgro btags nas //
translated: as long as it is attached to the self.üîΩAs long as it is attached to the self,üîΩit will be attached to the self as long as it is not destroyed.

original: bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la'o //
translated: to the self.

original: rang bzhin du ni gnas pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ni gnas pa med //
translated: There is no abiding in a nature.

original: srog chags su mngon par 'dod pa'i phung po'i rgyun no //
analyzed: srog chags su mngon par 'dod pa'i phung po'i rgyun no //
translated: The continuum of the aggregates is what is asserted to be a living being.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rmongs pa las bdag la sdug bsngal nyid du sgro btags nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rmongs pa las bdag la sdug bsngal nyid du sgro btags nas /
translated: Since it is thus, the ignorant superimpose suffering on the self.

original: bde ba med pa de bas na de ltar thos ba dang ldan pas grol ba po ni med na yang /üîΩlog pa sgro 'dogs /
analyzed: bde ba med pa de bas na de ltar thos ba dang ldan pas grol ba po ni med na yang / log pa sgro 'dogs /
translated: Since there is no happiness, therefore, in this way, the wise one who is endowed with learning and is liberated, although there is no self,

original: de nyid bcom phyir brtson /
analyzed: de nyid bcom phyir brtson /
translated: he is diligent in destroying that superimposition.

original: bdag la sogs pa 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa 'ga' zhig go //
translated: The self and so on are some things.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la gang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pas chags pa dang ldan pa de ni de la sgro 'dogs pa'i chags pas byas pa'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la gang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pas chags pa dang ldan pa de ni de la sgro 'dogs pa'i chags pas byas pa'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Application is that which is imputed to some thing in some way by some person. The one who is endowed with attachment to that is endowed with engagement that is created by the attachment that superimposes that.

original: srog chags su mngon par 'dod pa'i 'dus byas kyi rgyun de nyid du ga dang bcas pa'i zas la dug med par sgro btags nas mngon par 'dod pa dang ldan pa des byas pa'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: srog chags su mngon par 'dod pa'i 'dus byas kyi rgyun de nyid du ga dang bcas pa'i zas la dug med par sgro btags nas mngon par 'dod pa dang ldan pa des byas pa'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the continuum of conditioned states that is asserted to be a living being is endowed with attachment to food that is free of poison, which is created by the engagement that is created by the superimposition of that.

original: 'dus byas kyi rgyun 'di yang nye bar len pa'i phung po'i rgyun 'di la bdag dang bdag gir sgro btags nas chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩre zhig bdag tu 'dzin pa'i 'ching ba @83a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rgyun 'di yang nye bar len pa'i phung po'i rgyun 'di la bdag dang bdag gir sgro btags nas chags pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // re zhig bdag tu 'dzin pa'i 'ching ba @83a * //
translated: This continuum of conditioned states is attached to the continuum of the appropriated aggregates through the superimposition of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù This is a natural inference.

original: can dag gi 'jug pa ni bdag la rjes su phan 'dogs pa'i phyir rigs pa yin na gang yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bdag dang bdag gir lta ba spangs pa can de dag ni 'ga' zhig gi tshes nga'am nga'i zhes bya ba'i blo med pa yin la
analyzed: can dag gi 'jug pa ni bdag la rjes su phan 'dogs pa'i phyir rigs pa yin na gang yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bdag dang bdag gir lta ba spangs pa can de dag ni 'ga' zhig gi tshes nga'am nga'i zhes bya ba'i blo med pa yin la
translated: The engagement of those who are bound by the conception of self is reasonable because it benefits the self. However, those who are free from attachment and have abandoned the views of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù do not have the cognition of ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine‚Äù in any context.

original: / de dag ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa cung zad la yang mi lta ba yin na ji ltar na de dag de'i don du 'jug par rigs pa yin /
analyzed: / de dag ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa cung zad la yang mi lta ba yin na ji ltar na de dag de'i don du 'jug par rigs pa yin /
translated: Since they do not rely on the slightest benefit to the self, how could it be reasonable for them to engage for the sake of the self?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig ji lta ba bzhin gyi ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig ji lta ba bzhin gyi ngo bo yin na /
translated: The application is this: If something is the nature of something, then it is not reasonable for it to engage for the sake of that thing.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa la lta ba ma yin pa de ni de lta bu'i ngo bo sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa la lta ba ma yin pa de ni de lta bu'i ngo bo sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that he does not look to benefit himself, for that is the nature of his practice.

original: dper na skyes bu 'ga' zhig bdag la phan 'dogs pa la mi lta ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu 'ga' zhig bdag la phan 'dogs pa la mi lta ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is not that a certain person does not look to benefit himself, but he does not look to benefit others.üîΩAnd it is not that the one free from attachment does not look to benefit himself, for he looks to the welfare of others.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang gnas par 'jug pa'i phyir bdag la phan 'dogs pa la mi lta ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang gnas par 'jug pa'i phyir bdag la phan 'dogs pa la mi lta ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-apprehension of cause.

original: gtan tshigs de ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: This reason is inconclusive,

original: 'di ltar bdag la chags pa nyid kyi gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la chags pa nyid kyi gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: for it is not that he abides in attachment to himself,

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas pa gang yin pa de ni brtse ba'am gzhan la yang phan gdags pa'i phyir 'ching ba med pa can du cung zad cig bzhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas pa gang yin pa de ni brtse ba'am gzhan la yang phan gdags pa'i phyir 'ching ba med pa can du cung zad cig bzhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: but rather, that he abides free from attachment, for he has a little attachment to others out of love or in order to benefit others.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa bdag gi bde ba'i phyir ram sems can la chags pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa bdag gi bde ba'i phyir ram sems can la chags pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not benefit others for the sake of his own happiness or out of attachment to sentient beings.

original: 'on kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la dmigs pa can gyi brtse bas yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la dmigs pa can gyi brtse bas yin te /
translated: But it is due to the compassion that has as its object the suffering of conditioned states.

original: rdo la chags pa'i sbal pa bton pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo la chags pa'i sbal pa bton pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the man who removes a frog from a stone.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi gnas pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi gnas pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the abiding of those who are free from attachment is

original: yang na las rnams sam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang na las rnams sam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: due to karma, or

original: sngon byas pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyun rang gi dang gis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyun rang gi dang gis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: the continuum of suffering projected by karma previously done proceeds by itself.

original: de 'ching bar byed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de 'ching bar byed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not that he causes it to be bound,

original: rgyun gcod par byed pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na gnyi ga la btang snyoms su byed pa yin no//
analyzed: rgyun gcod par byed pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na gnyi ga la btang snyoms su byed pa yin no//
translated: nor does he cause the continuum to be severed. Thus, he is indifferent to both.

original: gal te yang bar ma dor gags byed pa de'i tshe yang mi mthun pa nyid yin pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang bar ma dor gags byed pa de'i tshe yang mi mthun pa nyid yin pas ni ma yin no //
translated: If he were to interrupt it in the middle, then, since that would be incompatible, it is not that.

original: 'on kyang ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ci yin zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: de ltar sems can la phan gdags par bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang ma mthong ba'i phyir na 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems can la phan gdags par bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang ma mthong ba'i phyir na 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Since he does not see any benefit to sentient beings, there is no contradiction.

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs ba'i nus @83b pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs ba'i nus @83b pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams gnas pa yin no //
translated: The continuum of suffering is projected by former karma, and it is by the power of that karma that those who have abandoned the afflictions remain.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'phangs la ldog med 'dod phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'phangs la ldog med 'dod phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not desire to stop the continuum of suffering that has been projected.

original: ldog par smon pa ni ldog par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ldog par smon pa ni ldog par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who desire to stop it are those who desire to stop it.

original: ldog par 'dod pa ma yin pa ni ldog pa med pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ldog par 'dod pa ma yin pa ni ldog pa med pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who do not desire to stop it are those who do not desire to stop it.

original: ldog pa med pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu'i phyir ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin du 'jug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyu'i phyir ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin du 'jug pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because they are the cause of not desiring to stop it, they engage just as they have been projected.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'jug pa mi mthun pa'i ming can gyis rgyun gcad pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol rtsom pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang btang snyoms su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'jug pa mi mthun pa'i ming can gyis rgyun gcad pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol rtsom pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang btang snyoms su byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they do not strive to cut off the continuum of suffering that has been projected by the name of the incompatible continuum, but rather they remain indifferent.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'ching la dga' par mi bya zhing //
analyzed: 'ching la dga' par mi bya zhing //
translated: Do not delight in bondage,

original: gson pa la ni dga' mi bya //
analyzed: gson pa la ni dga' mi bya //
translated: Do not delight in life.

original: dper na gla ba'i gla bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na gla ba'i gla bzhin du //
translated: Like a musk deer,

original: kho bo dus la sdod pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kho bo dus la sdod pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: I will wait for the right time.

original: gal te de ltar gzhan 'jug par byed pa srid pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i las kyis kyang srid pa gzhan du 'phen par byed pa yin na'ang btang snyoms su byed pa de ltar na yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na
analyzed: gal te de ltar gzhan 'jug par byed pa srid pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i las kyis kyang srid pa gzhan du 'phen par byed pa yin na'ang btang snyoms su byed pa de ltar na yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na
translated: If it is possible that karma that connects one to another existence projects one into another existence, then even those who are indifferent would connect to another existence.

original: / skyon de yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar srid pa'i srid pa las rnam par rgal ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: / skyon de yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar srid pa'i srid pa las rnam par rgal ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: There is no such fault, because those who are inclined to transcend the existence of cyclic existence

original: srid pa'i sred las rnam rgal ba //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred las rnam rgal ba //
translated: are free from craving for existence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi las gzhan srid pa gzhan du 'phen nus yod min te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi las gzhan srid pa gzhan du 'phen nus yod min te /
translated: The karma of those free from attachment cannot project one into another existence,

original: shugs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shugs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because it lacks the power to do so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lhan cig byed pa'i zad phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i zad phyir ro //
translated: Because the cooperative cause has ceased.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la phyin ci log gi shes pa dang srid pa la sred pa yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la phyin ci log gi shes pa dang srid pa la sred pa yin te /
translated: The cooperative cause of karma that projects one into another existence is the mistaken consciousness that perceives the impermanent and so on as permanent and so forth and craving for existence.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de gnyi ga zad pa'i phyir 'phen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de gnyi ga zad pa'i phyir 'phen pa ma yin no //
translated: Because both of those co-operating causes are exhausted, it is not projected.

original: brtse bas chags pa dang bral ba rnams kyi gnas pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brtse bas chags pa dang bral ba rnams kyi gnas pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that those who are free from attachment through affection should abide,

original: 'di ltar brtse ba ni sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtse ba ni sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can yin na /
translated: because in that case, affection would be preceded by regard for sentient beings.

original: de yang sems rnam par grol ba dag la yod pa ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: de yang sems rnam par grol ba dag la yod pa ma yin pa des na /
translated: Moreover, that does not exist for those whose minds are liberated.

original: gang gis na brtse bas gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na brtse bas gnas par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would they abide through affection?

original: ci ste yod pa yin pa de'i tshe bdag tu lta ba spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yod pa yin pa de'i tshe bdag tu lta ba spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it does exist, then the view of self is not abandoned.

original: sbyor ba yang gang sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can de ni sems can du lta ba spangs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can de ni sems can du lta ba spangs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that application which is preceded by regard for sentient beings would not abandon the view of sentient beings,

original: dper na @84a * //
analyzed: dper na @84a * //
translated: for example,

original: bdag la chags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa lta bu'o //
translated: like attachment to self.

original: snying rje yang sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje yang sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Compassion is preceded by regard for sentient beings. This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: de ltar yang ma yin na snying rjes yang 'gyur ba yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin na snying rjes yang 'gyur ba yin pa de bas na /
translated: If it were not so, then compassion would be transformed.

original: bdag tu lta ba spangs ba can ma yin pa de ltar na bzlog pa ni gang dang gang bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi blo dang ldan pa de dag ni bdag tu lta ba spangs pa can yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba spangs ba can ma yin pa de ltar na bzlog pa ni gang dang gang bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi blo dang ldan pa de dag ni bdag tu lta ba spangs pa can yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, those who are not endowed with the abandonment of the view of self, but who are endowed with the mind that is preceded by the view of self, would not be endowed with the abandonment of the view of self.

original: dper na bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like one who is endowed with attachment to self, whose mind is preceded by the view of self.

original: skyes bu'i grol ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yang bdag tu lta ba snod du song ba can gyi snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i grol ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yang bdag tu lta ba snod du song ba can gyi snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: And, the one who is desirous of the liberation of beings is endowed with a compassionate mind that is preceded by the view of self. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: sbyor ba snga ma la grub pa la sgrub pa dang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba snga ma la grub pa la sgrub pa dang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: In the former syllogism, the proof is unestablished and the reason is unestablished.

original: sems can la dmigs pa can gyi snying rje ni don dam pa can ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos la dmigs pa can yin no //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa can gyi snying rje ni don dam pa can ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos la dmigs pa can yin no //
translated: Compassion that has sentient beings as its object is not ultimate, but rather it has the Dharma as its object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyis pa la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyis pa la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not established in the second.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The knowledge of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa shes pa yod na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa shes pa yod na /
translated: When there is the knowledge of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness in the knowledge of suffering,

original: zhe sdang spangs ba can gyi rgyud 'gal ba med pa'i brtse ba skye ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: zhe sdang spangs ba can gyi rgyud 'gal ba med pa'i brtse ba skye ba gang yin pa de /
translated: then there is the arising of compassion that is free from the cause of hatred, which is not contradictory in the continuum.

original: 'du byed snga ma 'jug pa can de dag gis sngar yang snying rje goms par byas shing /
analyzed: 'du byed snga ma 'jug pa can de dag gis sngar yang snying rje goms par byas shing /
translated: Those who have previously engaged in the formative forces have cultivated compassion.

original: de goms pa las phyis kyang brtse ba skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de goms pa las phyis kyang brtse ba skye ba yin no //
translated: From the cultivation of that, later on, compassion arises.
